reviews.review_title: Restful and sunny holidays in Tunisia.
reviews.review_text: A really great stay as a couple. Pleasant staff with an animation team at the top. Close to the new Medina and easy access via bus and taxi to Hammamet.  The meals are diverse and varied with a buffet and the restaurant upstairs is great. Clean hotel and caring housekeepers

reviews.review_title: I recommend this hotel to have a great holiday
reviews.review_text: Very good stay in the hotel Lella Baya, the staff is very helpful, the animation from morning to evening, the restaurant, the pool bar but also the massages that are top, maximum relaxation! I would definitely return to this hotel,

Hotel on top. Meal to the animators. A young and dynamic team. They come to you and make you participate everything All day long. Meals sound good there's a lot to choose from. The hotel is clean with great charm. In the theme. I advise.

reviews.review_title: A hotel with good value for money
reviews.review_text: Nice clean hotel with beautiful architecture. A little pity for the exteriors which could be a little better maintained. The big plus of this hotel is the very pleasant entertainment team, a team at the top, we never get bored!  You can also trust Faysel for the excursions to the hotel, we did the quad and catamaran with him and it was great! He didn’t lie, we saw the dolphins 🐬🩵 Small negative for some waiters especially at the central bar which are not all pleasant. We didn’t like the buffet of the restaurant either... the meals are good unfortunately the buffet was never full enough and / or too repetitive. The Tunisian restaurant upstairs is really to avoid, I’m sorry but it was really not good!  Value for money but be careful it is not a real all inclusive for me: some drinks are extra (mojito, pressed orange juice, perpermint...) the gym is also paid, safe deposit box...

Atypical hotel, very clean The animation team at the professional tooooop with incredible talent  Very good activities: darts, pétanque, aqua gym, dance...... I highly recommend thank you for all the pool too beautiful  Close to the beach Catering is variable and tasty  Everything is combined to spend a pleasant holiday

reviews.review_title: Super experience Animations at the top I had a pleasant stay
reviews.review_text: Yes great everything was perfect! 👍 atmosphere extra awesome animations! Good value for money! Impeccable service waiters always with a smile...! Cleanliness impeccable! I recommend and hotel..! Good variety of meals..! Animators all nice and really adorable

Thank you for the hospitality of all the hotel staff at the top catering servers, room service, bar, reception, swimming pool the animation team Aladdin, Lorenzo and Achref,Pika, Sisi and hafsa and Nino. 2nd stay in a month and not the last 🥂😜

Perfect hotel very beautiful exotic architecture,restful  Very good room  Diversified and quality restaurant  Very helpful and available staff  Animation at the top Pleasant environment  One week of disconnection Thank you.

Great Holiday!  Me and my mother visited for 1 week.    The entertainment team was amazing!  So welcoming, always so polite and fun made every day great.  Looked forward to seeing the team every day.  Great shows every evening and great activities in the day.   ( Darts, pool activities, dancing, aqua aerobics and yoga. )   Will definitely come back again!   Food was great! Lots of variety.  Cocktails not good.  Wine was lovely.   Hotel very clean

Welcome on arrival, beautiful architecture of the hotel. Very nice and large room with sea view. varied restoration. Very efficient housekeepers. l denimation team Very pleasant a multitude of activities we have a good stay and invite you to discover it.

Beautiful team anlmation.beautiful establishment.framework agreablle.beautiful room sea view.light flat for restoration.multitude of activity. The staff are kind and very professional smiles constantly. I have you stay there.

Good stay at the hotel lella baya Yasmine Hammamet  Good atmosphere with all the animation team day and night thank youiii to the whole team.. The architecture is beautiful  The top room is clean  Restaurant very good  Kind and pleasant staff 💞💞💞 I recommend ❤️❤️❤️

Very pleasant stay with a great team of animators who creates a very good dynamic. The little care of the holidaymakers. Animation every day  Very nice and beautiful spectacular hotel right at the lobby entrance. Very good service. Very good value for money.

Good stay at the hotel lella baya yasmine hammamet  Architecture at the top very beautiful  Animation: dynamic team smiling thank you for all the animation team for all the atmosphere day and evening 🥰🥰🥰🫣  The room is clean .. the smiling housewives   The restaurant is good but lacks a little more choice  The hotel staff is very attentive  Thanks to everyone  I recommend❤️❤️❤️

reviews.review_title: Hotel to escape for a good holiday
reviews.review_text: So there's a big bravo tourism 👏👏👏 This is ironic null null null!!!! Then a hotel to escape if you have already traveled a minimum  Warm food when buffets are not empty.... The waiters hide to not set you a table .... They serve you in a dirty glass seen with my eyes recovering at the storage table behind us... When there is the welcome cocktail do not expect to have a drink at the bar there are more.... When you have two bedrooms and in both the towels are missing to shower and you manage to have other ones but the moor when the maid makes the room she does not replace her .... Very good hotel, lovely staff, very clean premises and beautiful and atypical room. There are many very good activities and the facilitators are great and very professional. The choice of food and varied and well presented. I will go back!!

Good stay at the hotel lella baya Hammamet  The architecture is too beautiful  Very good atmosphere with the animation team day and evening thank you very much to the entire animation team  The room is clean  Perfect restoration  The staff is friendly  I recommend ❤️❤️❤️🇹🇳🇹🇳🇹🇳🇳🇹🇳

Lella beya   is great hotel we loved our  room with a pool and sea view the service is a 5 star hotel service reception team are very friendly and the food is excellent the bar team is so professional and make really good cocktail... we would like to give a big thanks to the assistant manager Mr mohamed yehya who is making sure all the guests have a perfect stay at the hotel lella beya and have the best holiday of their life.

name: Hotel Bel Azur Thalasso & Bungalows
description: The Bel Azur Thalasso & Bungalows Hotel rests in a 15 hectares flower orchard flirting with the Azure of the mediterranean sea, close to the antique medina of Hammamet. Renamed for its beautiful gardens, this hotel offers everything you need for a fantastic holiday: great food, a host of relaxing facilities, and warm hospitality. Bel azur has one of the most enchanting beaches in the region. The Bel Azur Hotel has 250 rooms with private balcony offrening panoramic view, and 80 garden bungalows that are comfortable with all the amenities you would expect from a hotel in its class. It has also one of the most beautiful thalasso in Tunisia. Guests at Hotel Bel azur will feel at home and amongst friends in a setting where regular visitors and newcomers can mingle with simplicity, elegance and discretion.Read more

reviews.review_text: I had a wonderful stay in the bel azur hammamet hotel. The food is amazing with various choices. Our room had a nice view on the beach and the sea. And a big thanks to the entertainment team which was our favorite part of this holiday especially the entertainer Mimo who was very kind and funny.

reviews.review_title: Amazing and Professional Animation Team, Thanks Roger!
reviews.review_text: We've recently arrived home from Bel Azur (A group of 4). From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we fully enjoyed our stay here. The hotel was clean, the pool was very inviting. There were a good selection of food to choose from at meal times, as well as pool side snacks during the day. And drinks were very well measured if you like to get tipsy - very easily.  But I'm a lightweight.  All staff couldn't do enough for you. Always greeting you with a smile. You could walk alone within the grounds and beach feeling safe without any worry.   Personally the Animation Team made my holiday. There were plenty going on during the day to join in with. They made their way around the pool to say good morning  to all guests which set your day up feeling happy. A  good personal touch! In the evenings their shows were performed to a high standard, very energetic and fun to watch.  Plenty of dancing too!  I have to say a massive thanks to Roger for all of his hard work. Always putting in 100% and with the running of his team.  A true professional!

reviews.review_title: A memorable holiday, thanks Bel Azur, Tunisia.
reviews.review_text: I've only gone and booked to go back again. What a fantastic hotel, all the staff are friendly, polite and couldn't do enough for you. A big shout out to Simon yet again he made my holiday memorable putting me at ease to join in on the activities, he is a real credit to the hotel. I had so much fun, I'd like to thank Simon,  Naz, Zizu, Mimo, Dido and Paulina  from the entertainment team, they made my holiday special.  Wow Tunisia is gorgeous. The food was really enjoyable, plenty to choose from, never went hungry.  Can't wait to go back. Bye for now.

Absolutely wonderful hotel. From the food to the animations!!! Wonderful, friendly people, very willing to help and answer any questions. The food was fresh, very varied and delicious. Lots of fruit and sweets. Fantastic animators!!!!!! both for children and adults. Great fun for everyone in a nice atmosphere both by the pool and in the hotel. Evening shows are great, something different every day, lots of laughter and fun. Great swimming pools: both outdoors and an indoor pool with a jacuzzi inside. Beautiful beach, clean, well-kept rooms. My son and I are delighted and will definitely go back there .Thank you very much for the best holiday in years.

I had an amazing time at this hotel. I can't write a bad word about the hotel. They truly catered and looked after me so well. Even in middle of the night I woke up hungry the receptionist wrnt to the kitchen and found me something to eat 😄. The entertainment team were amazing. Especially Simon he was so outgoing and full of energy. 10/10. They were amazing with the children as well as the adults so thankyou Simon for making my holiday so special. Also want to mention Sammy. He looked after me so much whilst staying. Always making sure I had everything I wanted. So caring. Highly recommend.

The Hotel is amazing, the food and hospitality was great, the facilities were amazing, we was made to feel very welcome by the entertainment team especially by zizou, abir, Mimo and Dido who always made sure we was having the best time, Enjoyed very much

Had an amazing stay, hotel was clean and tidy, always found something to eat, only thing that could be improved was the labelling of the food especially for those with allergies! The reception staff could be more approachable but I didn’t go on holiday to talk to reception so wasn’t a big problem.  The entertainment team were amazing and attentive and put on a variety if activities suited for everyone and the shows in the evening. There was always something going on! Special shout out to Simon, who interacted well with everyone and made all the activities even more fun! Very attentive and made was such a positive and friendly person who made us feel very welcome and safe even when going outside the hotel! Don’t think I saw him without a smile on his face! Would definitely return

I'm really looking forward to my next vacation in July! It will be the 4th time for me at Bel Azur, but the first time there with my daughter. We are really looking forward to seeing Simon and his team again, as we have known him from another hotel for almost two years! We are so happy to have met him and feel welcome and supported and would travel anywhere he goes. He has such a friendly, unobtrusive and very helpful manner...my daughter is always very happy about the animation team's t-shirts :)!  All day long you can take part in activities such as Zumba and yoga and dance classes...or table tennis and darts...also volleyball in the summer. But if you just want to watch or relax, you won't be pressured, but it will be accepted and you can watch or just enjoy the peace and quiet.  The special highlight is always the evening shows, in which the team can show off their skills! The management is also very accommodating and helpful. For example, I contacted the hotel in advance to get a specific bungalow with a sea view and was very pleased that it went smoothly. If there were any problems, everyone was very helpful. You just feel very welcome.  I would immediately recommend the hotel to anyone who wants to spend a nice, relaxing holiday, in a very beautiful spot, with a wonderful sea view and with great, friendly staff!❤️

Had an amazing holiday at this hotel. The hotel itself is a little dated and could use a refurb and some more toilets !!  The food is a bit hit and miss but we generally found something to eat. The waiting staff were amazing and kept us a table every night and our glasses topped up!  The animation team are the best I’ve ever come across. The evening entertainment shows are brilliant and wonderfully choreographed.  The guys work so hard and are so friendly but not pushy if you don’t want to join in, they don’t push you to. Special mention to Simon who was so friendly and always stopped to have a chat an a laugh with us. He was always happy to help with any problems, generally a great guy!   Definitely recommend this hotel and we would return  ❤️

Went for a family holiday, food was great and rooms were lovely. Entertainment was amazing and the staff tried to get everyone involved especially Simon and another gent whose name begins with M I can’t remember it unfortunately. Will definitely go back we all loved it

reviews.review_title: Good but scared of drunken aggressive guests.
reviews.review_text: We arrived at hotel topd room not ready till 3 go have a drink food. We went back later to be told you have choice of 2 rooms 1st no balcony so 2nd was over looking pool and sea. Room was dated but clean.   Food was ok found something every day. I didn't like the papper cups at breakfast for juices. Lunch and evening meal you had bottle water. For myself not enough serving spoons food was getting picked up by closest server spoon tongs. Bread is hard for toast. Also labeling is not correct says chicken and ws cheese 1 day. Choice between red white wine beer or pop. Plenty salad soups wasnt to my liking bit bland.  Drinks vodka i liked no issues hubby liked beer, they did diet drinks as well as full sugar.   Entertainment was good day and night they didn't pester you if you said no. The animation team are good ..   1 massive thing was they allowed a very ignorent man in hotel always drunk and was swearing and threatening people. I reported him to head manager after a issue.  I was not only person to complain but was over looked and they still gave him beer when he was threatening people and bad language. I was looking over my shoulders all time.   Reception staff need to be addredsing ressed rude and don't speak or understand lot of English.   I personally will never return to this hotel.

name: Iberostar Selection Diar El Andalous
description: The Iberostar Selection Diar El Andalous hotel offers its guests all the charm of Port El Kantaoui, Tunisia, as well as a fun, comfortable holiday at a 5-star hotel. Located on the seafront in Port El Kantaoui, this hotel has spaces and special services for families with children such as a Star Camp, children’s playground, custom pool, workshops, entertainment and games, etc. There’s a bit of everything to ensure the little ones never get bored. Besides services for children, the hotel features the Star Prestige service which includes a VIP zone with a chill out terrace and Balinese beds, as well as its exclusive services such as its flexible check-out, Open Bar, or whirlpool bath in your room. The Diar El Andalous hotel is the perfect place to try a range of culinary delights. It features four restaurants that serve local cuisine, international dishes, plus a buffet. There are also six bars to enjoy whatever the time, day or night. You can try out the SPA Sensations at the Diar El Andalous hotel with its selection of body treatments. Meanwhile there’s entertainment for guests of all ages, free Wi-Fi, two outdoor pools and one heated pool, meeting rooms, and the marvellous sandy beach that’s located next to the hotel.Read more

reviews.review_text: Really relaxing holiday with very hard working staff. Hotel was calm and suited what we wanted. Buffet was good with choice and not hectic staff excellent at wanting to help. We also got moved to a more suitable room due to my wife breaking a bone in her foot just before arriving. Our maid was brilliant going above and beyond (Farida and our room was/still is at present 115) she always has a smile on her face and works very hard. Entertainment team good and remembered our names which means a lot to children.

I booked this hotel based on the numerous positive reviews, but was disappointed in almost every aspect. The service leaves much to be desired. While the staff appears to make an effort, there is a lack of genuine attentiveness and professionalism. Waiting times for service are often long, and inquiries are sometimes ignored or answered reluctantly. The service staff is  friendly.  The food is mediocre at best. The selection is limited, many dishes are bland, and the overall quality feels like mass-produced catering. The atmosphere in the dining area was particularly disturbing: during meals, there was often a lot of noise and unrest. Muslim children ran around the buffet area unsupervised, throwing food on the floor and playing loudly. Unfortunately, the staff did nothing to address the situation, even though it was clearly unpleasant for many guests.  We booked an upgrade for the Starprestigue Room and additional space in the hotel and outside. But even with the upgrade (€€) we felt like a normal guest or even less seen than others. Sure we understand that tips are very common and seen and we also give more when the service ist good at the start (first looking how good the service is). It was not really relaxing sadly. We were like transparent. You don't give since day one something youre out. Sadly. But even with an upgrade - which costs extra - you have no "extra" Extra.  In addition, the hotel is in urgent need of renovation. Many areas feel outdated and do not match the standard advertised.  Anyone seeking peace, relaxation, and a premium vacation experience will likely be disappointed. I cannot recommend this hotel and will advise my travel agency to stop recommending it as well.

We stayed in room no 394. It is our last day today. From the start to the end, there was nothing but amazing service by hotel management and staff members. I want to give special credit to the Rawdha room cleaner, who gave us amazing service with a smile. My check-in reception  staff, Salava and Marvin, was very professional and polite. Snack bar near the swimming pool Nadia and her manager were excellent.  Nada worked very hard and constantly provided good service and her men  manager who look after us ist day with issue staff placing used serving spoon after eating  from dish which was on display for guest. That was unacceptable; I think this member of staff may have been given a break to eat and decided to help himself. I am sorry for mentioning that as it does matter to all the guests.  At restaurant  waiter I took picture with was excellent  above and beyond of any expectation. I forgot name sorry. Special mention to Abdul , the one always with smile and helpful. My ring donut lady made special effort to make yummy ring donut for me. Tall men at omlate station went extra mile to give good service.   In short most of staff is gems to  hotel. Just want to let everybody to be aware they serve only local alcoholic drinks if one is fussy they bring their own. Waiter who served us drinks yesterday need special mention for his service.  Well done Ibrostar, we will be back.

Brilliant Holiday Fantastic hotel room spacious clean and always tidy clean towels every day Meals fantastic choice unbelievable choice and brilliant staff   Evenings in very large lounge, entertainment every evening all drinks brought to you by an army of waiters Pools 2 always beds available, beach front the softest white sand stretched for miles crystal clear blue sea   Short walk to harbor area the locals always friendly and polite  would give this holiday 11/10 no complaints what so ever

reviews.review_title: Staff are so good they made our holiday memorable. Hope to return soon.
reviews.review_text: My husband and I returned last week from an enjoyable holiday. Staff were very attentive helpful and friendly.  We stayed in room 172 nothing was to much for the staff.Food in restaurant was excellent. Lots of choice. Had ground floor room with garden view .

reviews.review_title: A very good stay to do again.
reviews.review_text: A Hotel access on customer service, room (207) is very clean , Thank you Nadia. The complex is great, excellent food.  All the staff is very attentive to you. At the pool level if you need a deckchair or umbrella we place it for you. Waiters come to serve around the pool. We feel VIP. Thanks. Christel and Matthew.

I stayed here in April with my Mum for her birthday.   From the moment we arrived through to checkout the service was exceptional. Marwen the manager we spoke with and all staff went over and above  and surpassed our expectations.   The beach was lovely.   The food and show cooking was fabulous.  We did have dinner in Tunisian al a carte but this wasn’t as good as the food on the buffet restaurant.   The terrace waiters constantly brought us drinks.   The bedding and rooms cleaned to a very high standard.   We will definitely be back. Thank you for a lovely time

A beautiful place, made for people with reduced mobility bravo! A pearl named Farida that makes us our impeccable room always with a note of fancy chbre 110.A big thank you for your smile!!! See you soon.

reviews.review_title: Hotel looks a little tired however………
reviews.review_text: We’ve had a lovely relaxing stay. Not on par with other 5* hotels and Iberostar could do with injecting some money to bring it up to the standard of its sister hotel the Kuriat Palace however some of the staff exceed 5*. Najua our housekeeper kept our room very clean with beautiful bed art. Kamel in the star prestige area deserves a shoutout along with Raouf (bartender), MedAli (waiter), Marwen (front desk), Ayman (bar tender in lobby) and Lassad (bar manager), these people have made our holiday and have shown consistency in there service to ensure us a fabulous stay. Thank you, we will be back.

reviews.review_title: We had such a wonderful time we’re coming back next year
reviews.review_text: Trip advisor  This was our annual girl’s trip away. On arriving at the hotel we were greeted by Houseem who took care of us during the whole trip. We upgraded to a star prestige room which was lovely. The room had a super king bed, coffee machine, mini bar and had been beautifully cleaned and prepared by Rahma. A Star Prestige room gave you free sun-bed towels, 25% off the spa, private sunbathing area and access to a roof top sunbathing terrace, this also had a hot tub and there were a selection of pastries and sandwiches to help yourself to. Mohamad was on bar duty on the rooftop and looked after all the guests amazingly.   In the buffet restaurant we were looked after by zadine who found us a table each afternoon and evening. The food was great with a variety of different cuisines to choose from. There is also a restaurant which serves Italian or Tunisian menus on different nights, this can get busy so best to book on arrival.  There were a couple of organised trips you could go on- to the Madina, on a catamaran or quad biking. We went on the catamaran. We pre booked the spa in advance as last year it was fully booked and had 2 treatments during our stay and made full use of the gym and swimming pool.  Each evening a different cocktail was served in the bar and entertainment was put on.  A huge shout out to our waiters Aymen and Oussama, they were great and looked after us during our stay  A huge thank you to the staff. This was the second year we have stayed here and  yet again we had an amazing time. We have already started looking for our visit for next year. See you all in 2026 xx

Perfect hotel, very welcoming staff, our housekeeper LEILA exceptional, attentive, we were in room 286, our room always very clean. We came with family and friends for an unforgettable birthday 🎂  A big THANK YOU ☺️ to all the staff

reviews.review_title: Just a fabulous laid back hotel set on a stunning bit of beach sea is amazing and the staff make this hotel what it is x
reviews.review_text: Superb hotel stayed in room 434 a prestige room was fabulous the cleaner was excellent in fact all the staff are so lovely waiter service in all the areas pool beach and hotel bars cannot do enough for you definitely coming back next year xxxxxc

Great hotel. Everyone is super welcoming and warm. Very good atmosphere, with entertainment throughout the day and evening. All staff are available and service at any request. Beach 2min walk, superb pool. Room service at the top, with pretty decorations every day on the bed (room 474, Thanks to Najoua) Cleanliness at the top, sea view from the balcony. I highly recommend.

Our first visit to Tunisia and wow we were impressed. Firstly we want to thank the staff, we stayed in room 339 and Saeeda our housekeeper kept our room clean and spotless. Second, Yassine by the pool looked after us and kept bringing us drinks without even asking. Next was Abdelaziz and Hitchem in the restaurant who were lovely and so friendly. Next we want to mention the food, the chefs really cooked outstanding food, we were amazed how the lamb, beef and chicken were cooked perfectly especially when it was batched cooked! (There are plenty of veg options such as salad bar, vegan corner etc) The food that stood out was the Tunisian food and sweets. The all inclusive drinks had a very large choice including alcoholic and non alcoholic to cater everyone. Entertainment were very hard working and didnt badger you if you didnt want to join. One small criticism is we hoped for more Tunisian inspired shows etc and less of cruise ship inspired acts. Overall, a wonderful holiday we did not want to end and we will definitely be back to Tunisia in the future. À bien tôt!

Stunning hotel with incredible food, facilities and service  We are staying in room 337 and Saeed (our cleaner) has been superb and fridge stocked every day! Thank you!  Big shout out to Yassine who consistently greeted us every day with a smile by the pool and kept us hydrated  The staff here are all incredible  I recommend this hotel to anyone, couples, families or friends travelling together  The perfect base for a relaxing week in 5 star hospitality

Hello what about this hotel? it is beautiful the staff is very kind always to the little care for we have a pleasant stay server at the top reception also at the top and what about the lady who looks after our room number 106 Farida always smiling and a kindness, you can come to this hotel with your eyes closed

Excellent Hotel, perfect cuisine, perfect cleanliness, women, room very well also, we are accommodated at the 106 It is Farida who takes care of us she is great of a kindness we recommend this beautiful hotel everyone is taking care of us

name: Riadh Palms Resort & Spa
description: Set among a realm of palm trees right on the edge of the most beautiful beaches in Tunisia, the Riadh Palms is located at the heart of Sousse. Riadh Palms Resort & Spa is a cosy and modern hotel, it offers a range of facilities and services to make your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. You can take a dip in the large outdoor pool, relax in the sauna, stay fit in the fitness center, pamper yourself in the Spa center, get a new look at the beauty salon, and dine in one of the many restaurants and bars. A night-club, a snack bar and a coffee and tea lounge are also available, along with a shopping gallery. reviews.review_title: Wonderful stay at Riadh Palms in Sousse Tunisia
reviews.review_text: This was my first visit to Tunisia. This hotel was recommended to me by a friend who lives in Sousse. It was a wonderful stay! The room was large with a nice balcony! The only issue at the beginning was that the room was warm, but they said the a/c wasn't turned on until June 1st. After I got a small fan, the room was very comfortable! The biggest plus at the Riadh Palms for me was the staff there. They were so welcoming and friendly! Fadhel who worked at reception and handled currency exchange was super nice and helpful for me, especially when I couldn't get the TV remote to work. Also, Isra, who worked as a hostess at the hotel restaurant couldn't have been more kind!! During my 6 day stay there I mostly had Ali, Anwar, and Anas as my waiters at the hotel restaurant and all 3 were so kind and entertaining and attentive to any needs I had. Great job! Lastly, Ola and Odel, who both worked in the reception area were very kind, and Ola helped me set up an excursion to the city of Kairaoun. I highly recommend this hotel!

Our stay at this hotel was unfortunately a consistently disappointing experience. The hygienic conditions were unacceptable: So we were served drinks bottles that had bird droppings on them, and the tiles in the room were also damaged. The indoor pool was heavily polluted and looked very run-down overall. Also the cleanliness of the room left much to be desired, as fresh towels were often only provided after multiple requests.  The culinary offer also did not meet our expectations. The food was low quality and the choice in the all-inclusive offer very limited. We also had to pay additional fees for almost all other services, even though we had booked all-inclusive. There were only two ways to get free drinks, which were also only open at certain times.  The experience at the à la carte restaurant was particularly disappointing. We were assured a voucher for dinner after a conversation with the hotel management, but this was not accepted during our visit. Instead, we only received a limited menu, as is also offered to regular all-inclusive guests. Our demand was ignored and we felt mistreated overall.  Also at the reception we received no support in solving our problems. Finally, we had to go to the buffet restaurant with our children, where they suddenly paid conspicuous attention to our table after our situation had probably become known.  Another problem was the defective elevator, which made it very difficult to use the hotel with a stroller on the third floor.  Overall, this stay was a great disappointment. Our expectations for a relaxing holiday have been far exceeded, and we have felt greatly frustrated by the repeated shortcomings and poor service. We can not recommend this hotel.

Very nice hotel where you will spend a peaceful holiday. We particularly enjoyed the Kids Club (entire dedicated building) with facilitators who are caring for the children. Congratulations to Assia, Ayda and Essia. The service at the bar (Lahzar in the morning and Houcine in the evening) is excellent. The buffet is varied and changes daily. The rooms are nice and large. Points of improvement should be noted: wine list to review. Wine ageing and not up to standard. The Tunisian restaurant Flamingo is a disappointment. The service was slow and disorganized. Cleaning in the rooms is done quickly. No vacuum cleaners, so carpets aren't made... The spa and treatments are very nice.  Note that we were able to take 2 beautiful horseback rides with Mohsen (independent) on the beach in front of the hotel. He is trusted and his horses are well fed and treated.  The pool is huge and the staff is helpful, offering towels, deckchairs and cushions at will.  Evening entertainment (concert) is not exceptional.

name: Hotel Le Sultan
description: Le Sultan has a quiet setting on Tunisia's Hammamet coastline. You'll be a few steps away from the small hotel beach, where you can swim. The whitewashed hotel overlooks its own pool area and out towards the Gulf of Hammamet. Days can be spent relaxing on the terrace or unwinding in the spa, which has a indoor pool. Children can play in the kids' pool. Le Sultan has tennis courts, table tennis and mini golf. There's a golf course a short drive away, and the hotel puts on a shuttle bus. You can also go horse riding along the beach with horses from the hotel's stables. For children, there's a playground as well as a kids' club where they can get involved with organised activities throughout the day. The hotel has several restaurants and bars, where you can get meals, snacks and local soft and alcoholic drinks. 2019 the hotel was renovated in following areas: new beach, extended pool bar, playground and pastry lab, renovated rooms and pool decking.Read more
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_text: I arrived at the hotel around 11.15. and was greeted by Marwa who was so friendly and has a lovely smile. While the checked us in we were sat down and given a lovely lemon drink. The porter took our cases to the room,so no waiting. The hotel is fantastic and I can't then the staff enough. Adel my personal waiter looked after me every day having a table ready for me and a glass of wine. The animation team excellent well done Zizu,Dino and the rest of team.allthe staff were very friendly and helpful. The only downside is there is nothing outside the hotel. I will definitely be back. Well done Le sultan

Very nice beachfront hotel.The site is mainly located around the pool because very small beach. Air conditioning is insufficient 24c at best and available between 10am until midnight. Nothing else to say. Clean, comfortable, welcoming.

reviews.review_title: Family stay - great for relaxing and spending quality time
reviews.review_text: It was a very Beautiful resort with scenery to die for, right on the shoreline. attentive staff, waiter service to your sun lounger all day by the beach and pool. Resort was clean, great food. Buffett had variety which was good for 2 weeks. Great karaoke as well, I even got a certificate! Enjoyed some great massages in the spa as well. Great value.

We went for rest and relaxation and that's what we got. Stunning views of the beautiful sea every morning when we opened our curtains. Staff are very polite and attentive. Bar staff try to keep you happy and keep on top of your drinks, even when your lazing by the sea!  Darts at 11:30, such great fun with Mo & Omar! Archery at 16:00 with Zezu and Omar, never played it before and really enjoyed it! I had my nails done in the spa which was a nice great, manicure and pedicure. A friend said she'd enjoyed a full body 2hr massage adhd it was the best she'd ever had! The weather was variable when we were there but the spa pool is lovely and warm so a bit of cloud on a cooler day means you can still enjoy the water. Entertainment, food, drinks, gorgeous setting, we couldn't have asked for more! One l'il tip. There are coffee making facilities but only powdered milk, which changes the taste but it still looks like you're drinking black coffee. You can get cartons of milk from the shop up the road, a short walk away.   Thank you for having us!   P.S please leave the swift nests up, I was really sad to see one had been knocked down while we were there, but the clever birds rebuilt it!

It is a very nice hotel where everything is nearby.  Tunisian food is excellent and varied.  The staff is great and attentive.  I recommend to all.  Know that the hotel managers make your stay an unforgettable and facilitating one.

reviews.review_title: Week of relaxation in a beautiful hotel
reviews.review_text: We spent a week at the Sultan and this hotel deserves a visit. We are difficult but everything has been good. Beautiful room (225) with a comfortable bed and a beautiful bathroom with walk-in shower. Flat screen TV and Wifi. Very good food with a wide choice of dishes...Breakfast at the height with fresh orange juice pressed in front of you. All the staff is smiling and very nice. Finally, a responsive and professional reception, thanks to Hela, Caroline and Tarik. We will definitely come back...

reviews.review_title: The top of the welcome and kindness
reviews.review_text: The quality of the hotel and the service.Special mention to Mr Mariani Tarak and Caroline for the excellent service. Very warm welcome from Imed, the waiter as well as the room staff. Brahim's pastries are breathtaking! The chef is also at your disposal. We will return as soon as possible with regret to leave this magnificent hotel.

From the moment we arrived we were met by the most friendly staff. Hotel is immaculately clean, rooms and beds lovely. Beach is just lovely. Wasn’t expecting much from food but the choice was fantastic always fresh, hot and tasty. One of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at. What made this holiday extra special was the staff, all amazing but special mention to Zizu, Mohamed, Ramzi, Sofiene, Aziz and Finas. We miss you already and can’t wait to come back.

Today is a last day of our holidays in this wonderful hotel. Thank you all staff for beautiful memories. Aqua class with Zizu, yoga with Omar. We were never short of food or drinks! All very delicious. Katamaran paddle boarding with Hassine! Clean rooms , beach area , pool & heated pool was spectacular! We felt always welcome and cared for. We loved Le Pirate meal, all fresh and well presented. We felt secure and look after by security they went above and beyond.We will highly recommend this hotel. It was our second time in Le Sultan but we will be back again!  We wish the staff all the best & hopefully health permitting see you next year!  Love from Ewa & John  Ps for those complaining about football during entertainment “get life “ it was Champions League semifinals hihihi regards from football fan!

A couple visit to celebrate my wife's birthday. An error of the booking date on my part but with exemplary professionalism the error was rectified with a big smile from the front desk manager with an upgrade. Thank you for everything you do to make my visit a real pleasure. Bravo and good continuation  I recommend the best hotel in Tunisia without doubt 😘

Third stay in the Sultan and still warm!  The rooms are very spacious and the bathrooms have been renovated.  The buffet is exceptional, many Tunisian dishes every day and very good quality and friendly staff.   The pool is very well maintained, a quality SPA with real professionals for the hammam and massages.  We'll be back again...

reviews.review_title: We went as a couple to the hotel the Sultan of Hammamet in May 2025. Everything was perfect for us
reviews.review_text: Very nice hotel. Well located sea front room very spacious cleanliness at the top, whether in the room or common areas. Quality catering with very varied buffet. Very nice staff. Garden and seaside. Very nice.

A great disappointment a hotel below average dirty poorly maintained carpeting in very bad condition old furniture food very medium old animation. People who have put positive reviews I think we are not talking about the same hotel

AVOID LIKE the PLAGUE! We were all bad the first week as were many other guests we had got talking too! Staff really rude and ignorant! Breakfast dinner and tea was the same every single night! Not even a chicken nugget or fish fingers for the kids! Cereal was stale every morning too! Staff stand and stare at you while eating, some standing right behind you while your eating! Made me feel really uncomfortable. Ordered panini at snack bar French lady came and ordered after me soo the worker stopped making my panini and served the French lady first! Overall food, drinks and snack bar is disgusting I was going to the shop over the road for some super noodles that’s how poor the food is! Cocktails are vile too.  ENTERTAINMENT  very poor nothing on same shows repeated every few days had football on for 3 nights in a row and stopped all the kids party dances for these nights.  ROOM cleaners were lovely and room was cleaned everyday however the passage and our room stunk of sewage! You only get 1 key card so can’t leave nothing charging while your out! Beds very uncomfortable our shower was also broke no drinks in the fridge which I was surprised at giving it’s a 4 star hotel!  Staff hang around you waiting for tips constantly!  Only positive I have is muna and the 2 young girls at kids club they went out their way to play with my daughter at the park and on an evening. They are the only staff that have manners and respect for their guests unlike the others! So big Thankyou to the 3 girls  We left the resort once and we were told put your phone away otherwise you will be robbed I’ve never felt more unsafe on a holiday in my life was counting down the days to go home Overall I would not return didn’t feel safe or welcome here. This hotel is not a 4 star more a 2/3!

name: La Badira
description: La Badira, member of the Leading Hotels of the World, recounts Hammamet's illustrious past, since Paul Klee's trip to Tunisia in 1914, followed by dozens of artists, such as André Gide, Arletty, Oscar Wilde, Jean Cocteau and Sophia Loren. All came to Hammamet in search of the rare quality of its light. La Badira has 130 suites of 45m² to 160m2, five restaurants combining tradition and innovation, and the only Spa by CLARINS in the country. Intimate spaces have been created in and around the hotel with a library, an indoor fireplace, La Badira cocktail bar, and jasmine and bitter orange scented lawns. The shop, dedicated to local craftsmanship, illustrates the authenticity and charm of Tunisia. Like travelers, writers and adventurers of the last century, guests feel at home and with friends. La Badira represents all the charm of yesteryear revisited with a modern approach, a place where regular visitors and newcomers can mingle with simplicity, elegance and discretion.Read more

reviews.review_text: Very pleasant stay, rest and elegance and this in all the hotel facilities, a cocan away from the everyday and escape any comfort. Hospitality, service , breakfast and five-star staff. Beautiful escape in a corner of elegance.

reviews.review_text: For years this hotel convinces with great service super restoration. Nice rooms a great view great pools and a nice beach for swimming. The whole is crowned by a modern and creative architecture of modern and typical cultural influences.

Very nice hotel.  With impeccable service.  A hotel to recommend. Very nice infrastructure.  Perfect staff.  Very easy access, I'd probably come back. Pool with extraordinary views. Efficient room service.

"Perfection is not of this world!".Hotel La Badira is not far from making belie this quote.Very nice location in front of the sea.Very nice medium sized hotel.Very nice suites very comfortable and perfectly maintained.A la carte restaurants offering excellent cuisine.Exquisite breakfast.Spa of very high quality.Gym with coach.The staff is very attentive.I thank all members with a particular mention to:Oumaima at the reception,Kenza (Guest Relations),Olfa the queen of omelets and pancakes....,Khalil of the international restaurant,Sirine of the Tunisian restaurant,not forgetting Yassin of IT who helped me a lot. In short a stay in the area,as far as I am concerned, is automatically synonymous with a reservation in La Badira. Thank you again!!!!!!!!! Alain

reviews.review_title: Go to The Radisson next door instead
reviews.review_text: Embarrassment of a hotel. Incapable management, broken facilities, lacking in every way.   Even when we discussed our issues with the hotel and Expedia they didn’t care. The hotel has offered a refund then the manager walked away and left? The lack of education in the country is outstanding, but a five star hotel has a responsibility to provide adequate management so despite this being sad, it’s not the guests issue to manage.

I don’t know who could consider this a five star. I’m here now and I’m going to sleep hungry. I just had 2 ceaser salads delivered to the room ($60 or so US) that I’ve had to send back and now I’m going to bed hungry. Ordered a steak yesterday, paid the $40 and left it on the plate. Going on a five star holiday is senseless if the food is inedible.   The internet has not been working. I’ve missed 3 days of work. They brought a new router today but it’s too late.   The staff is lovely but it doesn’t matter if you go on a holiday and, despite being willing and happy to pay whatever price, you can’t get anything edible and you can’t complete obligatory tasks. I wish I could go home early. We’ve had maybe 9 dishes so far and not one has been actually good. Burgers are tying us over, but my god why would I go on a holiday to stay barely satiated to get by. I’m not a picky eater with this in mind, it’s just not good.   I’m ready to leave.

reviews.review_title: well-being in harmony with the very nice Mediterranean nature
reviews.review_text: Very refined hotel with its architecture and scents, calm and very soothing. Each time equally satisfied. Hoping to always return to this very exceptional hotel.High-quality service. An eco-friendly atmosphere that respects nature. Sample refined Tunisian cuisine.

A great stay in La Badira!  Exceptionally warm and supportive welcome in a hotel decorated with taste.  From the moment we arrived, we were taken care of with great professionalism.  The hotel is huge, which presents a real challenge on a daily basis, but the team shows great dedication to ensuring customer satisfaction.  The rooms are spotlessly clean.  We would like to thank Mrs. Nadia, the governess, and more specifically Mrs. Monira, and Mr. Khaled for their seriousness, their responsiveness and the quality of their work. A real professional!  The staff at the front desk is equally impressive. A big thank you to Mr. Maher for his professionalism, availability and service. A big thank you who warmly thanks us.   The food was excellent, varied and extremely well presented.   I'm grateful to the whole team at La Badira.  We will gladly come

very nice hotel with a beautiful beach and beautiful amenities. spacious room and excellent bedding excellent breakfasts with lots of choices excellent welcome and friendly staff during the stay Hotel of modest size compared to the offer in Hammamet

Spent a few days as a couple in this beautiful hotel, ideally located with an exceptional view. Calm and serenity are masters in these places. The cleanliness impeccable as well as the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Have dinner at the Tunisian restaurant, quality meals and Tunisian musician to not spoil anything.  Only downside when you take the stairs rather than the elevator, smells of garbage cans probably come up from the basement...  For the rest, we are conquered, during our next stay in Hammamet, it is of course to the Badira that we will return 😊

Enjoyed a fabulous Mother/adult Daughter get-away at La Badira. The amenities, service, and entire experience were amazing. Staff were extremely professional and attentive. The spa was incredible. The food delicious both at breakfast and the restaurants. Very comfortable beds too.

Excellent hotel Haven of peace, very relaxing stay with my wife we even extended by two days, I highly recommend and for the rest I let you make your own experience. The room fell sea view and swimming pool with a magical sunset the calm and clean atmosphere, service to small care and super secure hotel, special mention Ala availability of staff and managers.

name: Marhaba Club
description: Looking for a place to stay in Sousse? Then look no further than Hôtel Marhaba Club, a family-friendly hotel that brings the best of Sousse to your doorstep.Guest rooms offer air conditioning and a refrigerator, and Hôtel Marhaba Club makes getting online easy as free wifi is available.In addition, guests can enjoy a pool and a poolside bar during their visit. As an added convenience, there is free parking available to guests.While staying at Marhaba Hotel, visitors can check out Equestrian Statue of Habib Bourguiba (1.4 mi) and Ribat (1.6 mi), some of Sousse's top attractions.Sousse has plenty of barbeque restaurants. So when you’re here, be sure to check out popular spots like Farmers Steakhouse, The First, Coffee & Resto, and Restaurant la Gargoulette, which are serving up some great dishes.If you are looking for something to do in the area, Eglise Saint-Felix (1.0 mi) is a popular attraction that is within walking distance of Marhaba Hotel.We’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay at Hôtel Marhaba Club as you experience everything Sousse has to offer.Read more
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_text: Quick summary.  Not so good bits - Rooms dated. Beds were firm (I struggled to sleep). Restaurant temporarily runs out of plates mid service (little frustrating).  Good bits - Pool areas and private beach area fantastic. I found the range of food really good during lunch and evening (however breakfast was really limited for anyone with an english breakfast expectation). All the staff seemed friendly and decent. The entertainment crew were also fantastic and really do make a difference around the pool during the day 👍🏻 Option to use the sister hotel (The Occidental) pool and slide facilities (and the all inc pool bar) Few shops and Pharmacy within a five minute walk as well as a few restaurants all reasonably priced.   In all honesty I would not class it as a 4 star more a 3.5, but I think holiday companies now base the star ratings on the features available and not the quality of the facilities etc. This may just be me.   What I will say is although with everything summarised we had a great holiday and made the most of what we had and what we were offered.   We also booked two excursions from the local provider in the hotel (Alibarba), we did Camel riding and quad bikes. Both great value for money (expect to get mega dusty on the quad bikes and take sun glasses. We took age range 8 to 60 on both trips and all enjoyed them.   If you book here I hope your overall experience is as good as ours 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻   We came at the end of May and had between 26 and 32 temp throughout the 10 days, all sun no clouds (apart from one random down which was overcast with showers).  Over all great holiday 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

Beautiful hotel, pool areas always kept clean, rooms are nice, bars are good especially the swim up bar in the main pool, entertainment is good throughout the day and night, animation team are very good and friendly with all people especially kids

Came here last December for the new year . Had a fantastic time . The new year eve party was amazing . Rooms are clean and cleaned daily . Location is great near to Sousse and port El Kantoui. Most staff are very friendly and can not do enough for you . A small tip goes a long way . Although there was a few staff members in the restaurant that ere neither friendly or helpful and made you feel like you was not wanted .The hotel is great value for money . The bar staff in the lobby and beach bar was great . Reception staff were very helpful and friendly.  The rules say that you was not allowed to reserve sund beds with towels and towels would be removed . Thus was not the case and sometimes it was difficult to get a sun bed . Apart from that we had we a had a lovely time and would return

Very clean and safe with great facilities. Fish foot spa recommended and Ali is great! Good access to the beach and family friendly. Good location close to the airport and the main city Sousse. Lots of food and drinks available all day. Entertainment every evening.

Upon arrival, my partner realised he left his rucksack on the transfer and the reception staff were amazing and called the bus company to arrange for them to drop it off, making several calls throughout the day to sort this for us. The room is adequate. The beds are large but the mattresses a little firm as well as the pillows. The air conditioning practically useless, however we have been told by other travellers that the hotel will not switch it on until June 1st. The pool bar is a great feature although the pool itself is slightly on the small side and according to our teenage children; not deep enough. There is an idiot pool at the sister hotel next door (Occidental) which is deeper, however it is very stuffy in there. When you are sat around the pool you do get a lot of different staff walking around trying to sell you treatments and trips and you have to be firm when you do not want them as they will return and continue to ask. We have not used the gym so cannot comment, however looking at it from outside; it looks very modern and is always in use. The spa is very relaxing and the treatments are great; however you are asked several times that you leave a good tip.  Drinks are pretty standard for all inclusive. Food has been one of the best all inclusive we have experienced. There have been traditional staples daily plus a good variety of other dishes suitable for both adults and fussy children. One evening, the restaurant even provided live entertainment in the form of a saxophonist, alongside a feast of sushi and fresh fish dishes. The staff in the restaurant are incredible, they make an effort to get to know your drinks order and sit you at the same table and cannot do enough for you. The entertainment throughout the day is your usual mix of water aerobics and competitions such as darts and archery for the whole family. The evening shows have been mostly outdoors in the sister hotel and have consisted of mini disco and a show afterwards. Not all have been great, however the entertainment team are always incredible. They are engaging with everyone and bring a lot of fun and energy.

Great hotel close to town and  amazing animation team, go out there way to keep you entertained all day and night. Max and risco were great and kept kids entertained. Great value for money! Beach is clean and tidy with great views. Would recommend staying here!!

This is a great place with a good location and facilities availabilities. Extremely safe Local Tunisians and the staff members are very nice people you just need to smile and talk with them the best you can even if there’s a language barrier and they will look after you as they do in general. The reception has amazing staff and very helpful, the people outdoors are very entertaining lively people. Food is amazing with various choices and you’ll always find something you would like. The views are amazing to take pictures and look at.

I came to Tunisia, the weather was 3 days bad (cloudy, rainy) and 3 days was nice weather - sunny, 29 degrees of Celsius. The food was absolutely fantastic, a lot of variation. Animation - Max, Rico, Mino were really funny, they spent a lot of nice energy to the hotel. They offered a lot of activities - football, water polo, darts…thank you!

Marhaba Club in Sousse, Tunisia, offers a welcoming atmosphere with a blend of strengths and areas for improvement.  Pros:  Friendly and Attentive Staff: Guests consistently praise the staff for their hospitality. Receptionist Mr. Khaiss and housekeeping staff like Essia are highlighted for going above and beyond to ensure guest comfort . Tripadvisor +2 Booking.com +2 Tripadvisor +2  Entertainment and Activities: The animation team, including Max and Fufa, provides engaging activities from morning till late, ensuring guests have a lively experience . Tripadvisor +1 Tripadvisor +1  Beach Access: The hotel boasts a private beach with free sunbeds and an all-inclusive bar, offering a relaxing seaside experience . Tripadvisor  Cons:  Room Condition: While clean, some rooms are noted to be outdated, with issues like peeling paint and broken fixtures.  Food Variety: The buffet offers a variety of dishes, but some guests mention that the food can be repetitive, especially if not arriving early . Tripadvisor  Noise Levels: Evening entertainment can be loud, with music continuing until late, which might be disruptive for light sleepers . Tripadvisor  Conclusion:  Marhaba Club is ideal for travelers seeking a lively atmosphere with friendly staff and beach access. While the rooms and food could benefit from updates, the overall experience is positive, especially for those who enjoy vibrant entertainment and social activities. Booking.com +3 Tripadvisor +3 Hotels.com +3  Źródła

Fantastic place, food is brilliant and entertainment is fantastic and would recommend, rooms are brilliant and it’s very clean and comfy. Very safe place to be here.  Entertainment on a night time is brilliant and you must fetch cash with you

Stayed at Marhaba club in Sousse. The hotel is not 4 star, 3 at best. Rooms are old, tired and dated, bathroom has tiles and discoloration to edge of bath and inside. Beds are not double but 2 singles pushed together. Food is edible but limited everything is repeated daily, the egg/omelette station is below par and the juices are terrible not fresh at all artificial tasting and really disappointing. The all inclusive alcohol was like water they used the cheapest vodka/rum/gin and brandy they have in their supermarket which I saw was 17 dinar (£4.20) and you cannot feel the effects. The gin isn't gin tastes like vodka and the glasses they provide are about 250ml. People bought large cups to get it filled. Deposit of £12 for the towel per one needed to be paid. We bought towels from gift shop as was only £3.50. and kept. One of the annoying things was in the morning before 9am cleaners will come in the room even if sleeping to take the towels away (have no idea why). Not to clean room. We would come back after breakfast room not clean and towels not back until late afternoon every day. No do not disturb sign either. They didn't clean the rooms they made bed and emptied bins. There was hot chocolate stain on table for 4 days up until we left that wasn't wiped off. Mosquitos so bring repellent as air conditioning not switched on until June. The access to swimming and gym is at the Occidental hotel which is a bit of a walk away. The snacks were a few cakes at the lobby. The beach bar serves no spirit just beer and wine On the positive the people were nice and attentive, entertainment was ok. If you like table tennis bring your own balls as you would hardly find any.

Great hotel with large grounds. Never had a problem getting a sunbed by the pool and beach. Excellent choice of food. All staff so friendly and welcoming. The only negative is staying in a room that is close to the main road and hotel opposite that all  you can here is the boom boom of music at night even with closed patio doors. Kept me awake until 2.30am. Bring some earplugs and ask for a room nowhere near this and you will have a great time. Very clean everywhere and again all staff fantastic

reviews.review_title: Very enjoyable place,don't believe negative grumpy travelers.
reviews.review_text: Holiday in Marhaba Club resort is a real treat. Rooms are clean,with new towels every day. Staff always happy smiling and ready to help people to enjoy their holiday to fullest, going extra mile and advice on anything. Food is what you expect on all inclusive holiday, enough variety of different kind of foods and treats including ice cream at lunch and dinner time to satisfy anyone. Animation team on our side 3 lovely guys Rico,Mino and Tores joined by some other lovely animators at times are amazing, engaging and hard working people who entertain guests by the pool every day with games, activities and pool parties. Putting up entertaining show every night. Some in hotel lobby some bigger shows outside on other side of complex. Now I would like to comment on some negative reviews I seen before I visited. I did not experience any of stuff some people write in those,to the point I have to ask why people like this even go holidays. Hotel resort is beautiful and right at beachfront,just the short walk on path leading via resort will easily lead you there. Some people don't appreciate good place and hard work hotel staff do even if they were given holiday for free. Of course with busy place like this you will have to sometimes wait few minutes to get cuttlery on your table and plates don't just vanish the second you finish eating and who cares if there is no tea bags in the room. There are some buildings around currently not in use,but they obviously work on renovations and improvements there same as painting everything to make sure place looks nice and clean, I see management walking around planing where and what needs to be done,but it doesn't just happen over night logically. The people who work here are on their feet 12 hours a day, 7 days a week, have to deal sometimes with grumpy and rude guests,as I experienced on my own eyes. And that's the kind of people who write bad reviews. I was on few different holidays in different countries but this place convinced me to come back with my family. So big thanks to all staff in the hotel,you are doing great job.

reviews.review_title: I enjoyed my stay it was  anice holiday
reviews.review_text: The Hotel is very good ist quiet it's a 4 🌟 hotel but it's looks like a 5 star🌟 hotel . The most important The front Manager is very friendly. The food is very good, the rooms are clean, the service at the restaurant are perfect. The pool is very clean the Animation teams are doing a good job the pool for the children is also very clean that hotel is 200 meter from the beach

Overall the whole stay has been awesome looked after by staff as it is our second time here and a lot of the staff remember us, quality of the room is been in point one or two things not a big deal, animation team is great they make the place hyped constantly engaging people to take part in activities and much more, great place for families enjoyable would be back anytime

Second time returning. Second time even better than the first. Great holiday, great food, staff in the restaurant always helpful and animation team were fantastic - Ricko torest mino and foufa Cleaners are great and everything is spotless

reviews.review_title: Great hotel for a sun bed holiday
reviews.review_text: Hotel is very clean and staff are friendly and helpful. The pool area is very spacious with plenty of sun bed’s available.  The beach area is also very good and the security staff keep the beach sellers away from the area. Max and the animation team are excellent.

name: Tui Blue Manar
description: If you’re looking for a family-friendly hotel in Hammamet, look no further than the TUI BLUE Manar. The rooms offer a flat screen TV, a minibar, and a refrigerator, and getting online is possible, as free wifi is available, allowing you to rest and refresh with ease.Read more
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_text: Amazing hotel Norah and all the staff are the best we have experienced. We were here for the month and didn’t want to come home. Clean modern and comfortable hotel. The spa was wonderful too thanks to Sabah and Rabiaa for helping the aches and pains ease with your amazing massages.  Momo and all pool staff are so helpful and friendly. Security always around polite and attentive.  The bar staff soon get to know u and are so friendly, thank u all! The food is amazing and the al a carte we had to return the best!!  Entertainment the best we’ve seen in Tunisia if not in any hotel!  Any requests are dealt with so quickly by Norah nothing is too much just ask!  Hoping to return ASAP thank u for a second wonderful holiday.

reviews.review_title: Thank you for a wonderful holiday
reviews.review_text: Excellent staff so welcoming food outstanding and I am a chef  shiatsu massage every other day for treatment few cold beers footy on big screen family friendly  some trips if you want to get out rooms cleaned daily  cool beach great  2 nd visit coming again

We travelled as a family of 8 (parents, grandparents and children). We have had the most amazing holiday.  The entertainment team are fantastic and the children love them. Shout out to Emeny and Madi ❤️ the shows have been amazing and some of the best we have seen abroad!  The hotel is lovely and clean. The pools are lovely and there’s activities going on all day and night, no pressure to join which we have liked.  Thank you all for a great holiday, we will definitely be back!

reviews.review_title: Very friendly staff. Amazing family stay
reviews.review_text: We arrived late on in the evening and there were meals available in the restaurant late on.  We found the grounds to be very clean and very well maintained the gardens are simply beautiful with safe areas for the cats to rise gardens and herb and spices garden. Plenty of pools and slides to keep the kids and big kids happy and best of all they have a pool bar to sit and chill during the day as it’s important to hydrate!   Staff were very  friendly and always say hello and are great with the kids! The entertainment staff well what can we say they are an awesome bunch always have time for you and very friendly especially Ameni who always made our children feel involved and welcome at every event she really does work so hard!

Have stayed in luxury hotels across the world and this has been one of my favourite holidays. Rooms are simple but clean and comfortable but it was the staff and resort facilities that made it so great for my family. Felt so safe letting my kids be independent and move around the resort freely. A great size with all the facilities so well laid out, perfect for our boys who were 7 and 8. The kids foam party was one of the most fun things our children have ever done on holiday and so well organised and manned. Staff were always kind friendly and welcoming, Ziko from the entertainment was brilliant and the beach security Rafik, his colleagues and life guards went above and beyond to accommodate us, have fun with our kids and provide fantastic service. Food was a little repetitive but always great quality and selection, pastries were incredible and a cheese panini from the sandwich corner was always a winner at lunchtime. Dinner at the Baia restaurant was also phenomenal, couldn’t fault it. Can’t wait to return to tui blue manar!

reviews.review_title: Zied - the man of many UK accents
reviews.review_text: This is more of a thank you to Zied who was part of the waiting staff at TUI Blue Manar. He went above and beyond each night, was super friendly and welcoming. Gives such a positive vibe when coming for dinner. I hope he sees this and gets recognition he deserves.

reviews.review_title: Carpet shop tout in the hotel grounds.
reviews.review_text: Dear Mr Walid Gharbi,  Thank you very much for our enjoyable holiday in Tui Blue Manar. Ananda B has written a review, 5 star, for the family experience (family of 8, 4 double rooms). I would like to comment on one unpleasant aspect encountered in the hotel. We took the trip to Bazar Tapis La Brise that was offered by the one of the two vendors who operate in the grounds of the hotel. Points to note: 1) The vendor made out he was associated with the hotel - not true. 2) Vendor stated that hotel cars would be used for transport - not true, two UNSAFE private vehicles were used. 3) Vendor stated that visit was to a carpet factory - not true, visit was to a shop. 4) Vendor stated that factory was Government owned - not true, a private shop. 5) Vendor stated that Bedouin women would be viewed making carpets - not true. One women in the shop gave very short demonstration. 6) After our visit I found that the shop had one star reviews from French tourists stating their bad experience. Shop name Bazar Tapis La Brise in Hammamet. 7) After our visit I reported the above to the Tui representative who then discussed this with her manager. 8) On the following day I was approached and questioned by the vendor in an unfriendly, intimidating manner (something had been said to him by the hotel). Due to this I did not raise the issue further until I was safely home. A good hotel full of very pleasant and friendly staff let down by one vendor (tout) allowed to operate in the hotel grounds.  My strong advise to guests is do not engage with the tout and do not go on the carpet tour. If you want a Tunisia carpet go to a reputable shop. Mr. Walid Gharbi, thank you for our stay in your hotel and I will let you consider the tout who adds nothing but takes away a lot. Best regards Robert B

Nice clean and neat hotel. Beautiful swimming pools arranged for children (very numerous) and a swimming pool quiet area. Sufficient sun loungers. The restaurant is similar to a canteen room!!! No tablecloth or set cutlery placed on a thin paper towel at noon! In the evening an unironed and often wet fabric towel.  Food in glut tasteless not seasoned! I've never seen so much garbage thrown away by waiters, especially scavengers! The wine is undrinkable! The restaurant is unworthy of a so-called 4.5 star! The few dishes served at the little pool self have not changed in 12 days!!! You have to fall back on pizzas that are very good. On the other hand the breakfast is excellent in choice and quality!

Cannot find one fault with the stay!  The hotel and grounds are exceptionally clean and all staff are friendly and attentive. Food in the restaurants are good quality with a wide selection to choose from and the Baia Restaurant was exceptional. Lots of space inside and outside to suit your needs. Momo does a great job at keeping the Relax Pool for relaxing!  Plenty of activities provided by the entertainment team during the day and the show at night. In particular, Madi is super friendly and makes all the activities fun with his high sense of energy. The fitness team, Chiheb and Taher, will lead a great workout whilst still keeping a smile on your face.   Overall, a wonderful experience.

Very welcoming staff, superb hotel, very clean, the food is excellent the buffets are stocked with lots of choices, the staff with little care. The hotel offers a multitude of activities, several clean pools, slides... , direct access to the beach which is beautiful. the culinary restaurant and excellent. The spa offers interesting services, I spent a good time there. Very pleasant family stay everyone enjoyed.

What can I say About this hotel.... I couldn't fault a single thing.   From the moment we arrived we fell in love. Every member of staff from reception to waiters/bar staff to house keeping to life guards were the most welcoming friendly people I've ever met. Big shout out the Marwen the lifeguard, he kept the pool area so clean and tidy, went out of his way to help us and keep everyone safe.   The food was amazing, so much choice at every meal time. Snack bar and sandwich corner was great to grab some food if you're by the pool or beach.   Pools were so clean and nice, foam party was so much fun.   Beach was immaculate, soft white sand and clear blue water.    Our rooms was spotless, house keeping came and cleaned everyday and done an excellent job.   Entertainment was great, 7 year old loved it.   We left the resort twice to go to yasmine and Naubel, reception called taxi for us each time, always felt safe and loved exploring.   We were so sad to leave, but booking to come back in september. We have found our new home <3

A magnificent hotel, a staff with little care and always with a smile, during the day it is difficult to make a choice between the beach or the je ne sais quoi number of swimming pools either equipped of course with bars, sunbathing with mattresses and umbrellas. On the food side the cuisine is so mouthwatering that I will have to lose 2 kilos! Anyway, don't hesitate, rush!

Excellent stay, a professional and kind team.  The activities are extraordinary, clean and full of life hotel with a friendly and warm atmosphere.  Personally I recommend, a very pleasant stay with lots of good surprises.

Fun animation activities  Very fun holiday Staff are very nice and welcoming  The food is excellent  I will definitely come back to this hotel and I recommend it to everyone going to Tunisia and the room very good............................

Great Hotel . lovely people . great time  Nice experice with crew animators 🇹🇳💪 Close sea and swimming pool 😎❤️ Weather was great. 😘 wish you all the best 🇹🇳 very good hotel lovely ................................................

The best animators ever, very nice and they make good entertainment. It is beautiful beach, good food and we spend the best time as a family with two small children. And habib good work in the hotel and good work dj his play every music in night club

reviews.review_title: To escape unless you are deaf, or fans of carnivals
reviews.review_text: Very decent hotel, welcoming and friendly staff. Comfortable rooms. However: - impossible to settle at the pool, except to reserve his place before 7:15 am - Very loud sound around the pool  - in the evening 75 decibels measured in the room, closed bays, carnival style Fortunately there is the quiet beach The name “palace” is a disgrace We came to rest, impossible To flee

A week to decompress, objective achieved. A smiling and available team. A comfortable room and a view of the pool and the sea very pleasant on awakening. A varied buffet and as soon as congratulations on the salads of raw vegetables. I recommend without hesitation

reviews.review_title: An unforgettable family stay – Thank you from the bottom of our hearts! (From May 19 to May 25, 2025)
reviews.review_text: We stayed at Mouradi Palace Sousse as a family of 6, with members of all ages – including an elderly parent with reduced mobility – and a variety of needs and expectations. The hotel exceeded them all with grace.  The setting is beautiful and calm, the cleanliness impeccable, and the food both delicious and varied. But above all, what truly stood out was the dedication, warmth, and professionalism of the entire team. We want to sincerely thank Mr. Bayrem and Mr. Lotfi at the reception, Mrs. Hada from housekeeping, the restaurant team, and also the gentleman who helped us with our luggage at the hotel entrance – always helpful, friendly, and full of care.  Thank you for turning this stay into a beautiful, heartfelt memory.  We’ll definitely be back!

Very friendly staff, good animation team. Great team happy to help and participate with anything. Good entertainment in the evenings for kids and adults different shows every night starting off with kids shows first then adults after 9:30 till late evening

Very good hotel amazing hotel the staff are really kind and are there to help always l really recommend the animation team is extraordinary we will come back againe the food very good really nice thanks for all the team very good hotel ,,,,,,,

Customer relations she went out her way to help. A lot of people where complaining about the rooms my fridge did not work ,dirty beech towel, the photos on the web site are not what rooms are this is a 3 star at most no kettle in rooms only good thing where the staff who where helpful

Pool is nice and big, doesn’t get too busy. Rooms are standard clean and nice. Food is good and the same every night. Staff is very friendly around the pool and the evening entertainment is good. You can head into Sousse in a taxi for not too much.

Good staff, food was good all very friendly,   Room was a little out of date reasonable size and good sea front view, pool was good size with a lot of sun lounges. Wether was great also had a private beach which was great clear water and even activities.
