reviews.review_title: Very disappointed: stay cancelled one week before departure due to work
reviews.review_text: We had booked this hotel several months in advance for a mid-May stay, attracted by the setting, reputation and services advertised. A week before departure, we were informed that our reservation was cancelled due to work in the hotel. We were relocated to another establishment that had nothing to do with the standing of the Iberostar Selection Eolia Djerba, which did not correspond to our expectations or our travel habits.  It is impossible for us to postpone our holidays at the last minute, nor to find an equivalent stay. We therefore preferred to cancel everything, deeply disappointed.  This is the first time that this situation has happened to us. The work is not decided a week in advance: the hotel or its partners should have warned us much earlier, out of respect for their customers.  This lack of anticipation and consideration means that we will never book this hotel again, despite its beautiful appearance on paper

Superb establishment  I arrived on the opening day, we were well catered for. This establishment is a palace in the true sense of the word due to its infrastructure (modern swimming pools, huge rooms, luxury refinement but also authenticity. The beach is superb and the animators are very friendly. Their activities brightened our stay. But the great plus of this establishment is the food, cocktails and especially the professional who is incredible. This is my third stay and I plan to come back in August!

Although there was a wait to enjoy our stay, we are very happy to be in this Hotel. We thank Rym at the reception for his investment in getting us out of our waiting accommodation (The Royal Garden Palace) to enjoy our stay at Iberostar Eolia. She is a person who is very invested in her work and deserves our full appreciation.   On the other hand, when we arrived on May 21, we were welcomed with a kindness. Here all the staff is smiling, says hello, is available when necessary. In short we will return with great pleasure.

Booked on the Iberostar website two and a half months ago for a stay from May 17 to 24 at the Eolia Hotel. 4 days before our arrival we receive an email stating that the hotel is under renovation and that they will not welcome us. We are transferred to the Iberostar Mehari, a 4-star hotel with different services but for the same price. No commercial gestures, no upgrades.   This is definitely the last time we book an Iberostar hotel.

Too bad the hotel is cancelled 1 month in advance... for unfinished business.  So I do not understand the opinions that date from a similar period.  We were disappointed because Iberostars fan, this misadventure stays in our way.  Finding a hotel in a panic spoiled the fun.

A hotel that deserves its 5 stars!!! Home,room,cleanliness catering nothing wrong. All the staff and the animation team of an exemplary kindness. Very satisfied with my stay I return in June. Can't wait to be there again!!!

We had an incredible week .I thank the maintenance workers for their seriousness and kindness towards their customers .The team of animators was funny and warm ,always new activities to offer us .The dishes offered were various days and appetizing .Again thank you!!!

The hotel is worth going to!  Nice rooms! The food was fine, and the most delicious Crepe Suzette (flambéed with zest of lime) I ate here! Most receptionists were very helpful and friendly! Actually, they should all be! Most people in the ministry were okay, but really not everyone, unfortunately! Someone who jumped out for me in a positive way and ran his legs under his body was the waiter at the pool and the beach, Abdellsalam! Many compliments to him, because he worked extremely hard and tried to please everyone! Also the gentleman, I do not know his name unfortunately, from the teahouse was a sweet and pleasant man! If I ever want to go back to Djerba, I would choose this hotel again!

Beautiful stay, very nice hotel. Thank you Lamia Tarek always listening and Me Feriel head of reservation and thank you to Mr the director always present .. We look forward to reopening!! Congratulations also to the staff always pleasant...

reviews.review_title: IBEROSTAR SELECTION EOLIA DJERBA TUNISIA, Excellent stay.
reviews.review_text: IBEROSTAR SELECTION EOLIA DJERBA TUNISIA, stay in November 2024.  Free parking. Nice hotel complex.  Beautiful hall, lots of charm, well arranged. Beautiful and large outdoor pool well appointed, direct access to the beach secured. Nice indoor pool. Very spacious nice rooms, seating area, terrace. In our two bedrooms the safe was not fixed. Nice restaurant room. as well as the outdoor terrace. Beautiful installation of the buffet, see luxurious. Excellent lighting throughout the buffet. Nice presentation, cleanliness, choice, quality. Reception staff can friendly, see highin. Just like catering. You wave and no one answers you. Very pleasant stay.

A new stay in this newly renovated 5*. My stay is unforgettable, the welcome, the availability of the staff everything is done to spend a dream stay.  Cleanliness of the premises and rooms is impeccable.  At the restaurant level the food is varied, fresh and excellent. At the bar there is something for everyone!  One thing's for sure I'll be back next year. Do not hesitate you will be delighted by your stay!

name: Marhaba Palace Hotel
description: With spacious rooms, completely renovated and enjoying a unique location, in the heart of Port El Kantaoui, at 2-minute walk from the 36-hole golf course, Marhaba Palace5* is perfect for those looking for an luxurious option, very family friendly for spending the holidays. Designed with character, the 5-star hotel complex creates a positive atmosphere thanks to the customer-oriented service and its amenities : a varied and refined All Inclusive buffet, entertainment and fitness options, 5 swimming pools including: 1 Indoor swimming pool heated in winter, 1 Indoor Tonic Spa swimming pool heated in winter, 1 freshwater swimming pool, 1 outdoor seawater swimming pool with Jacuzzi and 1 separate swimming pool for children, day and night entertainment for adults and children throughout the year, free WiFi and secure parking. When it comes to catering, the gastronomic diversity stands around a main restaurant with terrace and an à la carte restaurant. The lounge bar with terrace plus an infinity pool bar and a barbecue bar, open only during the high season are ideal for a moment of relaxation over a drink. The beautiful sandy beach completes the premises of a great travel experience. For your congress, seminaries and meetings, Marhaba Palace 5* has 5 rooms equipped and adapted to your needs, with a capacity up to 300 persons.Read more
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_title: A Great Time Was Had Again
reviews.review_text: As always had a great time at the Hotel. All the staff were great, nice friendly and helpful. The lady who cleaned my room Sassia did a great job, room lovely and clean every day.  There was a great choice of food and drink, and the restuarant staff were great as always, espicially James.  I would like to thank the guys who served you round the pool, they were always very busy but got on with it with a smile even in the very hot temperatures. A special thanks to Maher who really looked after me and also a thank you to Wissam. Ben in the main bar also done a great job. Unfortunately i can not remember everyones name, sorry.  The animation team done a great job, very busy every day, unfortunately i can only remember one name and that was leo.  I cant wait to go back and have a great time again.  So i would like to thank all the staff again from the Management to all the other employees who all did a great job.

Amazing hotel with fantastic staff who can not do enough for you. This has been my 3rd visit now and honestly can say I have never found fault but certainly this time around it feels the service has gone up a notch. There are staff and managers everywhere!! Always checking if everything is OK. If you need or have a problem it's sorted within minutes which is very rare in this day and age. The rooms are spacious and definitely recommend a sea view room. No hidden extra costs either as safe, bathrobes, slippers, beach towels, sunbeds on the beach are all free!! Rooms are cleaned daily to a high standard. Great choice of food and drinks also. Daily activities and entertainment is very good and definitely worth a watch!! All the staff work extremely hard and make the whole holiday enjoyable. Spoke to many single female travellers which just shows how safe they feel. Highly recommend this great hotel. Many thanks xx

Great hotel, animation team perfect food ok bar staff are really good, my chambermaid was absolutely great. Also one of the animation team members, Mimi, was absolutely great she went above and beyond to make my stay enjoyable she is the best!!!

Incredible hotel food 5 star rooms 5 star grounds 5 star Beach excellent all staff really friendly unfare to mention any by name as they are all excellent and a credit to hotel .It was our first time here but will be definitely be back ,little tip tea and coffee making facilities in bedroom but no milk no problem go to inside bar and you will be given some  A la carte is fantastic you have to book with restaurant manager in main food hall some of the Tunisian dishes are superb be daring and give them a go only downside for us was bed too hard and pillows too high but that is personal  preference not a bad  comment for hotel TUI rep fantastic has some great tips on going out and getting  a bargain at the port all in all a wonderful time in Tunisia spent with the wonderful  Tunisian people so friendly polite  and helpful

This hotel is Amazing !! If i could give 10 out of 10 certainly would. Staff are brilliant. Room was spotless. Food was good, so much choice.  Pool area/beach spotless. We were made to feel welcone from the minute we arrived by all members if staff we made contact with. Already looking for next year .

Brilliant hotel. Staff are amazing. Plenty to do on the resort. Fantastic animation crew and entertainment. Would definitely recommend anyone old or young. Everything within walking distance and if you want to venture out of the complex, there is plenty of excursions to do.

We were 5 friends and were pleasantly surprised by this hotel, the rooms, the service, the food, the shows, etc...my maid Somaya always added a little personal note to the decoration, our evening waiter, Hamdi was very professional and attentive to our every request, a special mention also to Aziz for the day service, always smiling and eager. We also met with Terratours representative Mrs Dora who was very helpful and kind, and our guide Yzed was very knowledgeable and attentive to our needs and questions. We greatly enjoyed our stay. I strongly advise him.

Hotel top! Great atmosphere!  Spa top! Very good massages! Attentive staff!  Nice place! Proximity to everything!  Welcome to the top!  Fish spa: mention for Yousef! Unmissable!! I recommend for who wants to get beautiful feet, even if it is thought that this is not necessary!;

Bel hôtel, I recommend the foot treatment by Fisher spa! A very pleasant experience and especially a human contact with Youssef! As much as the feet are delighted, but the exchanges are even richer! After a wonderful massage, the foot treatment was magical!

The best holiday at the hotel Marhaba palace.  I recommend soon thanks to the animation team. I really like the atmosphere is especially sports activities like ( aquagym , yoga, zumba .. ) very varied evenings ..  See you soon

Lovely hotel and staff .. thoroughly recommend it.. genuine value for money .. especially Yusef from the Fish Spa by the pool who worked hard to promote his business in a very friendly and funny manner. Lovely guy - good value and great treatment.

We have recently stayed at the Marhaba Palace Hotel. Well we are leaving today, pity.  The rooms are great and cleaned daily only fault is for tea and coffee facilities, they leave an assortment of tea bags, 2 sachets of coffee and sugar. No milk, strange. Bottles of water are left daily.  The hotel it's self, might have been a 5 star in the beginning now it is low 4 high 3. Needs some work to bring to a higher class.   The food is great, there is something to eat for everyone. Just remember it isn't English food. You want English food, stay in the UK or go to Spain. There are plenty of choices. The restaurant staff are fantastic and friendly. Can the cats be kept out of the main restaurant. Not everyone likes cats rubbing their bodies against you while dining.  Bars. The drink is plenty full, local spirits and beers. A small cocktail list though pre-mixed. Staff again are very friendly and attentive.  Pool, plenty of sun beds, why do people go down at 06:00 put towels down then not go back for hours. The pool bar could do with an update, currently half is in use. Weather they increase it in the summer, not sure.   Animation team. Good entertainment,they don't go bugging you while eating or sun bathing. Yes they come past and ask, say no. They leave you alone. No pressuring to join in, no nagging to buy bingo cards. They do their best to keep you entertained. The usual water aerobics and games.   Over all a very enjoyable holiday.

staff so friendly and welcoming, food amazing food selection, room service in every day all cleaned ,  went to the foot fish spa with yosef.  amazing session made my feet feel so energised and smooth. yusef was so friendly and a good laugh was very informative and respectful explained every part in detail step by step. would definitely recommend.

Very nice hotel, the food is very good. The animation is not bad despite being out of summer period. I tried the fish spa, a very pleasant experience at an affordable price. Youssef is adorable and takes good care of his guests. My parents loved it too.

Lovely pool areas, plenty of sun bed & parasols. Rooms are dated, we had to try 3 rooms as issues with all of them, black out blinds don't close, shower tray leaked, safe & television didn't work. Air conditioning was working either, we ended up leaving the patio doors open. you can hear people  in the their rooms too, especially when they are moving chairs for some reason. Daily  room cleaners don't do great job, forgot to leave towels & water, empty bins, basic stuff which you would expect to be done. Staff are amazing especially in the restaurant, you get to sit at the same table most of the time, just to note that you have to choose if you want 1st sitting for dinner @ 6.30 pm or wait until 7.45 pm for 2nd sitting.  Food does get a bit repetitive & cold. If like salad & pasta you will be fine, French fries & bread plentiful. There is a guy who does fresh orange juice @ breakfast but be prepared to queue. Themed nights, not all food labelled so you don't know what you are eating until you try it & there is a lot of waste then, plenty of sweet treats & fresh fruit. Staff also in the bar areas are polite, friendly they get to know your drinks order. Good beach location & again plenty of beds, restaurant/bar there also so easy for drinks & late breakfast & lunch if you didn't want to go to main restaurant.  All communal areas are exceptional clean, including the toilets( be aware that you can't flush toilet paper down any of the toilets, put in the bins provided)  You can walk into the harbour area less than 10 minutes but be prepared to be pestered by the bar staff,  sales teams trying to sell you trips, to be honest wasn't worth the walk, the area very run down & full of rubbish!  Animation team work hard around the pool area all day getting you involved with games etc. Live music in the bar area, pianist was amazing & saxophonist  wasn't bad either, but again gets really busy in there, they had to take the tables & chairs from outside to accommodate people & this is not main season.  Wouldn't class this as a 5* maybe 3.5 at best, wouldn't recommend & wouldn't go back.

name: One Resort Aqua Park & Spa
description: Welcome to One Resort Aqua Park & Spa, your Monastir “home away from home.” One Resort Aqua Park & Spa aims to make your visit as relaxing and enjoyable as possible, which is why so many guests continue to come back year after year.Guest rooms offer a flat screen TV, air conditioning, and a refrigerator, and One Resort Aqua Park & Spa makes getting online easy as free wifi is available.You can also take advantage of some of the amenities offered by the all-inclusive resort, including a concierge. In addition, guests can enjoy a pool and free breakfast during their visit. As an added convenience, there is free parking available to guests.During your visit, be sure to check out a popular Monastir barbeque restaurants such as Safari Resto lounge & Soiree, which is a short distance from One Resort Aqua Park & Spa.Looking to explore? Then look no further than Musee Habib Burguiba, which is a popular Monastir history museum – and it is conveniently located a short distance from the all-inclusive resort.One Resort Aqua Park & Spa puts the best of Monastir at your fingertips, making your stay both relaxing and enjoyable.Read more

reviews.review_title: Hotel amazing and spa is unbelievable
reviews.review_text: Went to the spa and it was the most amazing experience ever, lovely people and feel so fresh afterwards, highly recommended, Olympe spa at the hotel! We got the 2 day treatment but wish we got 4 now! Hotel is beautiful well maintained and staff fantastic

Staying here atm and it's a absolutely amazing hotel from the rooms to the animation team they all worked really hard nonstop and get everyone involved it's honestly my favourite holiday so far the bar staff and the restaurant workers are amazing also there is something for everybody would 100% recommend this place entertainment team is amazing

reviews.review_title: Bad experience and shocking customer service
reviews.review_text: Shocking place they bug you to buy things and use your kids to make you buy them!!!! All Scammers and get snotty when. You tell them no and the spa is a joke and rude!!!!   Wouldn’t recommend Don’t book anything with Ali baba camels is a waste of money   Always try to sell stuff when you just want to chill

Just returned from a great 10 days stay away took my granddaughter. An she loved it so  many things to do the entertainment team are absolutely brilliant  the shows they put on at this hotel are great one of the best hotels in tunisa for food I've ever stayed in  an I've stayed in a few by far the best  this is a 24hrs resort so food drinks  all day an all night  my room was clean and fridge was stocked with water an cola an waters you get a  bottle from any of the bars here  all staff are so friendly  for the pool bar to the lobby bar beach  bar  u guys do an amazing job . An the chef in the restaurant was wonderful  could not do enough for us I've have a food allergy an he would cook me gluten free pasta  but to be honest  I found lots of food I could eat so much choice  I can not wait to return  I fully recommend this hotel  I honestly can not understand some of the reviews on here  try for yourself an go with an open mind  . One thing I must say give respect too get respect  .. I had a great time and was looked after very very well by everyone that worked there  . Let's not forget the reception team so helpful and approachable  the lady that's books the  A la carte restaurant is wonderful lady an couldn't do enough for you  Thank  you for a wonderful. Stay one resort aqua park and spa  .

Great hotel! Clean thanks to the housekeepers who are very present and kind! large and nice room it just misses a few takes! Several swimming pools a little cool but nice because you always find room! The meals are varied and good. The activities are great thanks to the animators of the mini club Mouna, Touta, Estefania and Maelys who make the holidays of the little ones magical and set the mood with their mini disco. At the spa you can do beauty treatments with Loubna she is great and also braid with Zeineb who is adorable and very gifted thanks again for my 2 daughters <3

Coralia team is a dynamic team that does several activities such as water polo, pétanque, archery and lunchtime play. The host Slouma is super nice. 😁  For the room, I think it's a shame the bed is hard.  As well as the pool hours that end at 6:00, it would be nice to extend it to 7:00.

Very beautiful hotel we had a great stay at the top it was great 👍  Very clean hotel the rooms are very good buffet very good 🥰 The animations are at the top a big thank you to the manager of the club Coralia ☺️ yassine and the animator of pétanque 👍😊

Super top hotel for children the family great atmosphere day and evening I recommend for families thank you also to the manager Yacine for his kindness and professionalism we had a great stay I tell you all soon

My partner and I had a wonderful stay in Tunisia. The hotel was on top. We loved everything!  From the welcome of the 1st day by the very nice and always smiling staff to the little touches in our room. The site is clean and the infrastructure tops. I recommend for families...We will come back next year with our children. The most of the hotel are the animators .Bisou des Belges

Best part of our stay was the waterpark, the room was fine for our stay. The only thing I would change is more safe places for baby’s to play, outside entertainment is on a high stage and one night was near the pools . No outside parks or inside play areas for small baby’s or children.

I’ll start with the positive- the animation team are lovely! Pool service is great and the lifeguards are on top of what’s happening. That’s where the positives end.  We stayed in rooms 110 and 111. Neither room had a proper working safe- this was a disaster trying to get sorted. The water didn’t drain from the shower in 111 either. Then we move onto the big problem!! We all got bitten while there- we thought it was mosquitos as there is definitely a problem with them around the Resort. Came home to discover that it’s actually bed bugs!! Fantastic!!   On checking out no room was available for us to keep on so we had to use the shower room to get changed.. I’ve seen better on “worlds worst jails” they are stinking of urine, the water is freezing and they have cctv cameras in them!   The food is questionable.. breakfast being the only decent meal. Then when you go to leave the hotel the taxi drivers try to rip you off! I’ve been to Tunisia many times and if this would have been my first time I would never return.   The hotel needs to up its game regarding food and pest control. Never ever again!!

reviews.review_title: One resort, one family, one love ❤️
reviews.review_text: Visited this hotel for the 4th time and literally welcomed back with open arms. I even got upgraded to a swim-up room, because of my loyalty. The staff is really the best I've seen, from the gardener to the director.  The enjoyment team is the best in the world ♥️ Except for one, you are all in my heart 😘

This hotel is for families, I wouldn't go as a couple. We were a family of 10, 6 adults and 4 children under 6. The rooms are nice, my daughter had an infestation of cockroaches but the hotel were on top of it. Our air conditioning and tv  weren't  working but within a hour they were both fixed, staff were very good, read reviews about not attentive unless tipped, didn't find this was the case, they couldn't do enough to help.  Entertainment team were very good.  Foam party in the pool was amazing.  Food was OK, could be better.  Everywhere was clean all the time.  Would we go back, YES, my grandchildren were crying on the way back to the airport as they didn't want to leave, they had a fantastic holiday.  Only down side is the mosquitos, take plenty of repellent and spray for your room. They were a bit of a problem, we all got bitten.

reviews.review_title: Enjoy your stay at ONE Resort
reviews.review_text: Good atmosphere, with lots of activities for all ages, very good value for money with decent rooms, the housekeeper makes small decorations with sheets and towels, good sanitation. The highlight is the animation. Do not hesitate to ask for ice cubes in the glasses 😂😂

Everything perfect thank you very much the animators are very nice and very welcoming the housekeepers are very nice also and very nice the medium rooms .. The highlights are the animators who do a lot of activities and atmosphere

Place is great, enjoyment team are one of the best we have ever coma across. Sam is really great with the teenage kids. He gets them all involved. All staff are wonderful & do everything to make your stay easy. Will come again!!!!❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

Everything was great here.Everyone was very friendly .There could be more seats in the outdoor area.Otherwise it is great here.It is here very paid attention to cleanliness.Food is also great here.The staff are very nice here.

One of the most fun hotels i’ve ever been to!  The animation team are the absolute best and are a credit to this hotel, they work such long hours, but make you feel so welcome and are always happy to see you. They put 100% effort into everything from 9am to 11pm with a smile on their faces  Big love to the whole team ❤️  The hotel overall is really clean and rooms are cleaned daily with towels washed and beds made.   The food is nice. I’m vegetarian so struggled a bit as not everything is labelled that clearly, but there is plenty to eat and they have themed nights throughout the week.  The beach bar is open for food and drinks 24 hours a day.   Tips really go a long way! Tip your waiter and they will save you a table and have your drinks ready, tip your maid and you get freshly picked flowers on your bed etc  Overall, the staff are lovely, so welcoming and there is always something to do/see.   100% recommend this hotel if you want to visit Tunisia 🇹🇳

name: El Ksar Resort & Thalasso
description: Capturing the magic and mystery of the Mediterranean Sea El Ksar Resort & Thalasso is located on a private sandy beach surrounded by generous gardens. The hotel offers plenty of activities such as mini golf, bridge, table tennis, Volleyball, tennis, shooting centre, jungle park, four outdoor pools, one indoor pool and many more. The beautiful yacht port “Port El Kantaoui” is only a few kilometers away.Featuring 552 comfortable and elegant rooms, junior suites and 1 presidential suite, inlcuding family rooms which interconnect.Read more
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_text: The best hotel I ever been. Amazing staff.rooms good. If you going with kids it's perfect place to go as they have loads activities for kids and taking care of them.every day something else to do for them. Big thank you for Gigi and Pipa for amazing job with kids.Kids gonna miss you.Perfect location. Very good cleaning service. Very good food.

reviews.review_title: Nice hotel & staff but beware of scammers in the town
reviews.review_text: The hotel was in a nice position on the beach. Close to shops, banks & cafés. The hotel itself was a little dated but spotlessly clean. Room was basic, the air con was useless. No plugs beside the bed. Only 2 plugs by the dressing table. Shower kept going hot then cold. Tip: take some extra hangers. Bed nice & comfy.  Beach bar wasn't serving any snacks or food until high season apparently. Only served wine, beer & soft drinks.  Pool area kept tidy. Sammi the pool attendant/lifeguard was an absolute star. Waiters are always on hand to get you drinks from the bar, especially Eshem & Falid. They went above & beyond.  Food in the restaurant was a bit samey but ok. Plenty to choose from though.  Snacks were served in the a la carte restaurant but looked like all leftovers from breakfast, lunch & dinner (bit disappointed)  The entertainment team was always around trying to get you involved in various activities.  All the Staff we encountered was very friendly throughout the hotel.  Tip: if you get a taxi into Sousse Medina, make sure you turn your wristband inside out before you get there. There are scammers that  say they work in the hotel & it's their day off, and they offer to take you round various government backed authentic shops. It's a rip off. Please do not be fooled.

Rooms are great, cleaning done every day  Animators are great except girls , great atmosphere great music at the pool , waiters at the bar are nice  Cleanliness is great, super good food  Thank you chico you are the best

the awesome hotel  the super good food the waiters in the downstairs restaurant are great the animators boy oh tooop average girls no smiles  activities are great especially when they play with us  very good atmosphere with music at the pool

Hotel very good , clean , maid of the 3rd floor very nice and helpful , in cooking especially pepper pizza , waiters of the restaurant at the top , nice .   The animators great nice team , the boys animators are the best , thank you Chico , Rio , sizo , zegi, biso , Diego.  Thank you hugs the team ❤️❤️

We had a great time staying there with family. For my part I had a room 4 people a decent double bed and 2 sofa beds with a mattress a little too firm but the housekeeper made it a little softer with a blanket. The room was spacious with great views of the sea and pool. The hotel in general is ok but some renovations would do him good. The restaurant was ok but the dishes a little repetitive with a limited choice on the other hand during the Tunisian evening the dishes were succulent. The undeniable strength of this hotel and undoubtedly the entertainment team that made our holiday just exceptional, my children loved the kid's club a big thank you to Pika and Gigi. The activities and shows were very funny and quality. I've been to all the shows and so have my children. A big thank you to all the animation team 👍

Good facilities. Very good animation team. Good environment. The food is repeated but varied. Beach and pool very close and very quiet. Good atmosphere among guests and very friendly service staff. Good cohabitation between the guests themselves. If

Beautiful hotel with friends as a couple or even as a family with lots of activities for children (kids club), swimming pool and impeccable services!! Direct access to private beach and entertainment at the top. Staff always listening and smiling 😃 Near Medina souk and El kantaoui port.

I just got back from this hotel, I am very satisfied, the service is at the highest level, the food is great, the rooms are clean, the sea is within reach, the pools, the animation is very nice, the bartenders are very nice, thanks to Hichem and Nuri, they made us feel like at home, I recommend it, I will definitely go back there

Another lovely stay in this hotel. I'm nver thisapointment. Animation team was going over and beyond to make all days amazing.Special thank  you for Hichem from bar who make ours stay unforgettable. Compare to other hotels in Tunisia this can offer what You can't find else vere: amazing food, lovely beach and swimming pool, nice clean rooms and the most imported very polite and helpful smile faces staff. Than You again. We will come back soon

reviews.review_title: The hotel is very good, the food is very good, the people are very good, the activation is very good and the work is very good.
reviews.review_text: The hotel is very good and well fed and the people here are very good and the activation team is very good and they do very well. I like the hotel very much. I might be back next year and it was a very good vacation and thank you. Diego and riou and bika and all the team will be back next year and we will find you at this hotel next year.

Friendly,rooms fine,animators fine,they knew us from last year and that was a warm reception of some,food was a little less,disadvantage ladder pool not yet made,activities plenty present,can laugh a lot and enjoy that's what counts

Good rest, fun animators, friendly maids. Good cleaning in the rooms,the restaurant has a large selection of dishes,delicious sweets and pastries.I would like more sea of food. Beach with sandy,you can swim in the sea .Clean pool. Animators from morning to late night at work.Sports games in the afternoon,disco,karaoke in the evening. It is possible to book out for shopping and other excursions and entertainment.  Sun, sea and friendly people what better way to relax.

We stayed only a few days in your hotel. We were very well received up to our room which is clean with a very nice sea view. Thank you!!!  We would also like to thank all the facilitators who are invested in their work. And especially mimi who it's a lot of fun with mia our daughter, and raina. But also Rio and chico with whom we had a good time.

Amazing Holiday. We booked this hotel after staying down the road in November. We would choose this hotel over and over again. The staff were amazing, super friendly. We had the best service from all waiters especially those at the beach bar (waiters and the security). Lots of friends and memories were made. Animation team super friendly and would take time to sit and chat during breaks.   Rooms were comfy and always clean. Our lovely cleaner would leave cool towel swans which was nice to come into after a long day.   i would recommend this hotel to anyone. We will be returning this year :)

name: Marhaba Royal Salem
description: Marhaba Royal Salem 4 * is a real corner of paradise, located 3 km from downtown Sousse and 5 km from the Aqua Palace Port El Kantaoui water park. The ideal location in the middle of an idyllic landscape of 7 hectares of palm trees and eucalyptus forest, makes the Royal Salem 4 * a wonderful complex for families. The rooms with modern furnishings are oriented towards the sea, the garden or the swimming pool and are all equipped with air conditioning / central heating, mini bar (filling on request and payable). The relaxed atmosphere is complemented by the 2 outdoor pools, 1 with slides, 1 indoor pool, a KIDS club, a stylish SPA and Fitness area and a magnificent private beach far from curious eyes. During the day you can enjoy exciting activities and in the evening entertaining shows. The variety is also present in restaurants and bars with 1 main restaurant, 1 central bar, 1 snack bar, 1 pool bar, 1 aqua park bar, 1 lounge bar and 1 Moorish Café. For your congress, seminaries and meetings, Marhaba Royal Salem4* has a fully equipped room with a capacity of 200 persons.Read more
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_text: Stayed as a couple a week ago. Hotel doesn’t look as flashy from the outside compared to others, when you pull up but the warmth of the staff and amenities make up for that. We stayed in the main royal building and had a distant seaview which was lovely and the room was spotless. Maids always cleaning everywhere in the hotel! The only issue is there’s only one plug socket in the room and the air con doesn’t come on til june (a Gov rule), which was hard as it was 38 degrees when there, so sleeping was hard. Quite noisy if neighbours are stomping about upstairs as no soundproofing. A nice walk in shower and quick lifts. Staff were lovely and we felt if you tip them (just a small amount to us)  you’ll get better service, so worth doing. We did a walkabout video on YouTube (badcrumblexxx) which may help you. We felt the hotel was lower budget when there but having looked at hotels since, it’s actually not. The food was really lovely for all meals with a good selection. I wish I’d used the gym (best I’ve seen in a hotel) as I put on lots of weight! Animation team worked very hard. We stayed by the small pool as it was quiet. The slide pool is salt water which wasn’t so good. Only thing is perhaps not so good for disabled people, no lift to lower pool or dining room. It’s a large complex so quite a bit of walking one end to the other. The spin class music was deafening which was annoying but only happens every so often and lots of smokers in the public areas which wasn’t so nice if you don’t smoke.  We had a fab stay and would def stay again but only when the air con was on! Special thanks to Said, Lotfi, Aziz and Alexander. All of who looked after us beautifully.

the best of marhaba royal salem .... the bar staff are so frindly and aymen  and they do great job ... and the animation team is really amazing 🥰 especially bob and leo ... and the room is really clean ... and the food is good xx i hope i will come back soon ❤️

I want to say this is not my first time here i come last time with my freand i relly like this hitel so much and thus time i come with my freand angin and i reely luke this stuff so much and big thanks for team animation there make cery good show every night to make u happy alwys i will be back soon agin

reviews.review_title: Fab holiday good and bad points.
reviews.review_text: This hotel as goods and bad points firstly we will go for the good the hotel is lovely all public areas are cleaned constantly and room was cleaned everyday fresh towels everyday the hotel is huge the kids pool was amazing and most importantly the staff are friendly nothing is too much trouble and fablous with the kids once you find your bearings around the hotel and it's sister hotel it's easy to get sround it's like it's only little village with all its little walk ways the down side for us and it  let down the most was the food it did have some positive like fresh made pasta that kids lived off and fresh pizza. The breakfast lacked options simple things like mushrooms and hash brown there wasn't lot of fresh fruit options and lunch and tea there wasn't lot of choice either lots of liver the theme nights had the best options also the beach bar there was lots of flies and really hard to find a seat. Also tye kids club could of been advertised more they didn't really come around asking if the kids wanted to go and what's was happening each day the animation team was lovely but felt it was more towards the adults games instead of both adults and kids. We would maybe go back again if the good options improved.

Very nice experience! The staff is so kind and helpful. Rooms are comfortable, clean, food is amazing. The best experience is Animation team! Mido is the best animator and trainer! Also, Marco, Patricia, Zaca… They’re making such a good atmosphere, feeling like I have been here many times before! Thank you guys, we’ll come back for sure!

Ian just back with my husband from this wonderful hotel complex both John and I are disabled and our mobility is not good when we arrive Riem booked me in and told me all about the hotel also arranged for mobility scooter for John from local English agent (advise to book before holiday as very busy) we got one delivered next day my only complaint is the ramps are very steep and no rails down them but the staff are wonderful Mohammed that looks after the foyers came and pushed or lifted scooter up front ramp anytime the waiters at the bar like Arbi and Jousef couldn't do enough for you either so friendly cheerful and always there to help at the quiet pool out the back alexandro and saif were amazing they helped me in and out pool moved our chairs just fantastic guys now the food if anyone says anything about the restaurant I don't understand why no one could go hungry there it's clean well laid out the waiters and management always there to help and explain different thing to you nothings too much trouble to them I can't thank them enough there is so much I can say even Adair the night time security guard was fantastic with us all in all I can't wait to come back it felt like an oasis in for John and I and we can't thank everyone we came into contact enough I'm sorry I can't remember everyone names but thank you from the bottom of our hearts please try this place

Entertainment is brilliant, beds are really comfortable and staff are fast and reliable. Food was lovely and overall an amazing accommodation. All the entertainment was on-time and happening all the time. Something for children and for adults.

My first time in Tunisia,  but definitely will not be my last. From check in to check out everything was perfect. Every staff member we came across was polite,  friendly,  welcoming and helpful,  nothing was ever too much trouble. The rooms were large and clean.  There were plenty of sunbeds always available, just ask the lifeguards and they will get one for you,  thank you to Ahmed.  The bar and restaurant staff were brilliant,  special thank you to Hamsa and Mohammed.  It is obvious who the leaders of the animation team were, but the other guys were the friendliest,  Momo, Foden, Sam, Chadou,  Bibo, Ziko and Patricia.  The food was plentiful and tasty, always such a selection and very fresh. Spoke to the guys at the fitness suite,  but declined to take part in a spin class, but Younes was very polite, knowledgeable and helpful. I am definitely hoping to come back,  thank you all again.  🙏

Bel hôtel  The spacious and very clean rooms The perfect facilitators  Meals not enough choice but very good. Too bad there are no aperitifs and ballroom dances between 9pm and  21h30 before the show👍👍👍👍👍👍Other great stay

Animation is brilliant and chaima is amazing and lovely we will definitely be back next year we loved it so much. Can’t do enough for you and the food is amazing so much choice, people who work there are amazing work so hard and are lovely !! Entertainment is brilliant and made you feel at home and lovely ❤️ 5 star need to come back don’t want to go home

reviews.review_title: An exceptional stay, faithful to Marhaba quality
reviews.review_text: As in every stay in the hotels of the Marhaba chain, I was never disappointed. What makes this property particularly interesting is its structure: several resorts, each with its own pool and bar. In total, there are three outdoor swimming pools, an indoor pool, three or four bars, as well as two restaurants, one of which is by the sea.  The room was spotless, very clean, with stunning sea views, everything is functional and quality. The drinks included in the all inclusive formula are excellent, and the food is tasty. The staff is friendly and always smiling. A special mention to Hamza of the bar service, which does a remarkable job at the pool – thanks to him!  I will definitely return to this hotel which really impressed me.

It has a good locationwl with a good stuff. The bar stuff and the qnimation team work so hard. Some parts of the hotel needs renovation, but the food and the drinks are awesome. Programmes are good and fit for every ages.  We had good days here. Highly recommend.

Everything is great I would definitely recommend this hotel to my knowledge Clean rooms Atmosphere at the top Everything is really good animators Super nice waiters Good food Super karaoke  Reception welcome  The animations are numerous

I want to say is not My first time i come here 5 time and i like the team Animation there work so hard to keep u happpy and smile always and big Thanks for midooo He always have nice smile in his face and He good man He help me for everything we need to now and Thanks for the bár stuff too

Had an amazing holiday the hotel was brilliant and the food was great!  The animation team were absolutely fantastic can’t fault them! Will defo be back!  The staff and bar are amazing always happy and quick to serve and the cocktail selection is great!

We stayed here for twelve nights we had booked a room with a sea view on a top floor which we sort of got was on the 4 floor but there wasn’t much of a sea view but you could see it the room was good and it had a bath with a shower in it. There is plenty of wardrobe space  and a nice tv but only news channels in English but that’s ok you do not get a information book in your room so you have to ask where things are in the hotel We found the food plentiful and tasty and the waiter’s are very good and friendly and the local drinks are nice the entertainment doesn’t start till about 9 pm in the evening there’s two places that have evening entertainment  We used to walk into Sousse and we got the train a couple of times once to El Jem and once to monastir which Dacia lot of money if you do get a taxi don’t get from the guys by the hotel get them on the street and ask the price  I think the hotel is good value for money and would go there again it just needs more information and to start the entertainment earlier

We came here for a short stay. So what I can say it was one of the best short stays in Tunisia .Bedrooms are very tidy .Staff are very friendly and helpful and if you need any advice what to visit in this little town they always there for you... One more thing food here... amazing .Love it ..EVERYTHING.

The hotel is very nice and clean, staff are so friendly. We had such a good holiday a special thanks to the staff and animation team especially Mido, Bibo and Marco for making our holiday the best ever! The food is amazing different variety and selection every night.

name: El Mouradi El Menzah
description: Finding an ideal family-friendly hotel in Hammamet does not have to be difficult. Welcome to El Mouradi El Menzah, a nice option for travelers like you.Room service and a concierge are some of the conveniences offered at this hotel. In addition, El Mouradi El Menzah offers a pool and free breakfast, which will help make your Hammamet trip additionally gratifying. If you are driving to El Mouradi Menzah, free parking is available.If you are looking for some good spots to eat nearby, you may want to check out Restaurant Sheherazade (0.2 mi), La Bouillabaisse (0.5 mi), or Golden Fish (0.1 mi), all of which are within walking distance of El Mouradi El Menzah.Should time allow, Yasmin Hammamet is a popular attraction that is within walking distance.El Mouradi El Menzah looks forward to welcoming you on your visit to Hammamet.Read more
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_text: Excellent entertainment  Excellent pool  Excellent beach  Excellent staff Slay  Staff was very helpful and funny  Very hygienic and clean  Food very sanitary and good  Amazing service  Beautiful views  Rooms cleaned professionally everyday  Slay

reviews.review_title: Sea view.. lack of hygiene, customer service, welcome
reviews.review_text: The El Mouradi El Menzah hotel is located in an exceptional location (facing the sea, in Yasmine Hammamet) but clearly suffers from a lack of maintenance and quality management. If you are looking for a quiet, clean and well organized stay, this is probably not the right choice. If you are flexible, the sea view and the beach are your priorities, and you accept very limited comfort, then this may be possible... on a low budget. Personally, I would not recommend it unless you get a very cheap offer and your expectations are really minimal. The "sea view" experience should not compensate for problems of hygiene, food or comfort. Good luck 💖💖

I don’t even know where to begin, on arrival was placed in a different hotel due to it being closed. Hotel room is mediocre at best. DONT get all inclusive there’s barely anything offered to drink and it’s all bottles poured into tiny drinking cups. All drinks are luke warm it’s terrible.  No wifi unless sat in the lobby of the opposite hotel.  Only one pool is allowed to be used- the slides seen in pictures are barricaded off and not allowed to be used. The hotel in the picture is not used for anything but sleeping they send you to another hotel to do everything else.  Hardly any communication if your English- if your french it’s a little better but hardly. Nothing to do all day sat by the pool.  Let’s get into the food/breakfast/dinner experience-  It’s like a swarm of wasps attacking something- I’ve never seen anything like it everyone is fighting for food pushing snatching food not even using the tongs provided- non of the food is labeled you have to guess what they are.  The food is not catered for British or European people- not that we was bothered but some meals we missed completely.  Along with the lack there of communication- finding where to go to get food or the toilets is a game of survival of the fittest. In the dining hall there are limited number of seats and they prioritise people with different wristbands and will tell you NO if you try to sit down but then if you try to leave with your food to eat elsewhere they will follow you shouting.  If you ask questions or ask for something IE cutlery or cups they simply look at you in disgust and walk away.  We booked to stay for one week and have never been so unhappy with the service and the hotels hospitality.  If you ask me the hotel is in need of proper management and hospitality training.   Waste of my money and time

Just arrived back home and couldn't wait to get home. Arrived late in Saturday night was allocated a room, no key, had to keep going to the desk and wait for someone to let us in. Room was very dirty. Was told a key would be available to us after breakfast... we had to wipe everything down before unpacking... went down on Sunday for breakfast... forget anything English. The food wasn't catered at all for British people.. couldn't even had a croissant as no butter, jams, cheeses or hams. Couldn't get drunk as the spirits in the all inclusive were watered down. The furniture in the room was battered and rotten. The balcony paint was flaking. Our safe wasn't working do was told a replacement was being sorted.. this didnt materialise. The beds are like sleeping on the floor and the pillows are like sandbags, I woke up aching every morning. The 2 good things about this hotel are the pool and the hospitality staff. The bathroom flooded everytime we had a shower as the shower curtain was letting the water through. Be aware when walking about as you will get hassled all the time to go in the shops. Cigarette but outside the lift for 3 days.. Avoid avoid avoid.

I had the opportunity to stay at Hotel El Mouradi.  The reception of the hotel is not very warm.  No drinks in the fridge in the room.  However, we were very well received by the animator Ahmed who accompanied us very well. Thanks to him

reviews.review_title: Great experience 3rd time on hammamet and frankly the animations the buffet the location super nothing to say.
reviews.review_text: Rooms a little old but frankly the pools service the animators Chacha especially for children frankly nothing to say. Highly recommend. Don't be fooled by negative reviews. The amazing super varied buffet...

reviews.review_title: Don't be fooled by 4 star! Dated and dirty!
reviews.review_text: This was classed as a 4 star resort. Definitely not!. Although  there are facilities.  The rooms are an absolute disgrace! Our first room upon entering. We noticed how dated the furniture was and how threadbare and dirty the carpets were. The balcony banister was rotting and unsafe to lean on. The bathroom bath had rust stains and the coating on the base of the bath had rotted away! Tiling must have been done by a chimpanzee! We complained and was given keys to check another room. This had a carpet that had a large section out and stuck back down. The carpet was absolutely filthy! Human hair balls matted into carpet! The third room we were offerd was habitable although the hairdryer was broken and there was only one plug socket to charge items! The hotel is massive with lots of pools and spa center. But needs A LOT OF MONEY spent to bring it up to 4 star! The maintenance staff need sacking as signs of shoddy workmanship everywhere! There seems to be lots of managers loafing around but no one correcting the faults within the hotel! Location is excellent, right next to beach. Could be an amazing hotel if money and proper management were spent on it!

reviews.review_title: Save yourself!! Although the budget is interesting
reviews.review_text: Totally to be avoided! Very old , filthy meal , very dirty and unmaintained pool at this time! No varied food the same every day without taste! The common areas are very dirty as well as the dilapidated rooms  The worst holiday in 10 years

The hotel lacks much maintenance: -The rooms are bad (defective shower, window does not close, no internet, no TV...) -The hallway is dark and lacks ventilation (bad smells) -Service is average especially in the restaurant. -The food is average sometimes good. In summary not to recommend

The Receptionists are friendly but politely rude. The food is in abundance but lacks quality. All meals are served with Dry rocky bread and omelets are full of egg shells impossible to eat. The inclusive deal covers the cheap low quality drinks while those who want quality have to use the exclusive side bar where you can pay for quality. The Hotel cash point charges interest rate to use on top of a commission of 10 Dinar on each withdrawal. One can only withdraw 300 Tunisian local currency at each time. The agents authorized by the hotel to organize excursions charge ripoff fees. If you are stupid enough to ignore my comments and still book a trip to Tunisia please arrange your preferred tours from home before you travel. Also carry enough money to eat from out, unless off you love oranges. Those reading after booking good luck.

This has to be one of the worst hotels I’ve ever experienced. Staff are rude, the entire hotel is run down and needs a complete renovation. Says it’s a 4* hotel but in reality more like 1*.   Rooms are awful, beds rock hard and pillows are lumpy and full of stains.   The all inclusive food on offer is quite simply vile. No options for children. We have eaten out everyday which defeats the purpose of booking an all inclusive. The dining hall is rotten. We was violently sick 3 days out of 5.   We couldn’t wait to leave and fly home. I would never visit Tunisia again. Love Holidays should take this hotel off their option list.

reviews.review_title: Abysmal hotel. Ruined the holiday. Never returning.
reviews.review_text: I hope you are seated with a cup of your favourite beverage to hand...  First time writing a review for a hotel stay. El Mouradi El Menzah  No safe in room so had to carry all valuables with us all times  Hair on floors and bathroom sink Broken shower handle so the head did not stay in place  Key stopped turning on second day No telephone in room to call reception so every problem required a trip downstairs and back  Telephones are for show and connect to nothing!  Shower gel not replaced so had to keep asking daily  Poor wifi in lobby and none in rooms Second floor call button in lift stopped working on second day  Very old and dated decor which needs serious renovation. The next door hotel looked much better.  Food was bland or unusual tasting. Few options for children. Not much variety and there was always a long queue for anything you wanted. They need more food stations and service staff.  Second day a very large group of youngsters from a football academy came for their stay. Oh boy! Dinner was like pigs rushing for the trough. The restaurant didn't use both sides of buffet to speed things up. Plates ran out and one man almost fought the restaurant manager on duty over it. Tables were short and guests were nicking chairs from other tables, at one point some guests were eating standing up! Guests had to clear their own tables because the servers were so overwhelmed. There was no consideration of the extra 100+ generally-always-teenage boys that would be coming to dinner. One of them got so cross with a granny trying to cut in that it looked like he might shove her to the back of the line! Chaos is not the word but I do not what is.   Same plate shortage happened on day. Abismal

reviews.review_title: What a filthy and western unfriendly hotel absolute disgrace
reviews.review_text: Awful place, the hotel is tun down, food is dreadful, a very nousy place to stay, there is no considerarion for western visitors so if you are dont be suprised id you have to eat out,   The entite place is filthy dirty, ants bugs, never ever will i visit this place or indeed tunisa the vast majority of the country is filthy and litter ridden

Hotel that must have had its glory days.  But it's time to review everything. Everything is in decrepitude, rooms , catering, swimming pools , slides.... Everything is in ruins, dangerous limit.... Tunisia welcomed us in better conditions a few years ago. Very disappointed and sad for a country that deserves much better....

Charming staff and care, ready to satisfy us at the home level, ultra kind and hardworking catering staff so knowledgeable at the hotel s central bar ready to satisfy you   On the other hand pitiful hotel, dilapidated, state of dirty rooms on the 3rd floor, unkind maid and cleaning quickly done badly. Glass bay that does not close completely, leaking bathtub shower and hot water pressure egg Archaic air conditioning a kind of air blower that makes an incredible and inefficient noise  No Wifi in the rooms in 2024 c is incomprehensible, no French channels on TV!!!!  In terms of catering no fake sugar saccharin for people who have to monitor sugar it is a problem nor any substitute for cow's milk, no vegetal milk! No jarred yogurt in the morning or fresh fruit in the morning and rarely at meal!!! Microwave its broken turntable does not work and new tea machine that offered succulent broken tea after 2 days!!!  Animation non-existent except the morning muscle building gym very birn and very professional but terrible aquagym with unbearable techno music  And the whole day of mystical techno or arabic has bottomed sui fzit lal at the head of everyone but to the unlikely taste of the young ka sono who does not care royally about the opinions and requests of customers   And finally clientele mostly pru educated, not polite, who insults the staff, respects nothing and bathes in burkini despite the ban   Brief hotel very mediocre, poorly soundproofed, very noisy, no wifi or French channels  A LOT OF THINGS TO IMPROVE IF THEY WANT NOT TO CLOSE

Lame hotel the 4 stars are gone apart from the friendly staff the rest zero the buffet lame old room the customers no respect to fight for a plate to avoid if you want to go to Hammamet spend your way take another hotel

name: HÃ´tel Royal Azur Thalassa
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_text: This hotel is just ok. We paid around £1000 for flights and hotel (all inclusive). Bottom line - very underwhelming compared to my previous experiences at similar price points (albeit the comparison is to mexico and turkey)  Things I liked:  Inexpensive overall Nice staff  Enjoyed the food  Lovely beach  Nice pools  Clean   Things I didn't like:  We arrived at night after the restaurant had closed. They gave us a plate of cold food (salad, cured meats, a boiled egg). Underwhelming and not what we are used to at other all inclusives.  No entertainment  Lack of atmosphere at the hotel  Lights would be switched off at around 11pm despite people being sat in the lobby.  Running out of drinks  Not having beach towels (even early in the day e.g. midday)  Menus / brochures only being in French  AC not being on half the year regardless of temperature  Being charged extra for the gym (seriously?? I've never seen this before at a 5* all inclusive)

We arrive around 10pm, very friendly guy on reception checked us in and lead us to the restaurant, that was closed. We were provided with a plate of food and drinks. Nice touch. Porter took our cases to our room. We had booked a beach bungalow. It’s basically a lovely room, with a terrace and direct access onto the beach. Away from the main part of the hotel. So tranquil, beautiful views of the sea. Robes and slippers provided, tea and coffee facilities, small fridge with fresh water everyday. The beach is beautiful, great bar, look out for Kareem the bar man. So lovely and helpful. The beach is so relaxing. The restaurant is amazing, something for everyone! Oysters! Wow. Our waiter, Lefty, looked after us like Kings and Queens.  I only have 1 fault with the place, no Prosecco! What’s that about lol. Pushed me out of my comfort zone, gin and mojitos are my new faves😍 Tunisia is a beautiful country with beautiful people.  This hotel is amazing and we will be sad to leave ❤️   of the hotel. Huge, comfy bed and bath!

reviews.review_title: A First Class, 5-Star Experience for our Wedding Anniversary
reviews.review_text: This is one of the best hotels we have stayed at. After an almost 4 hour flight delay, we arrived to be greeted by the hotel staff and quickly escorted to the lunch area, which closed in 30 minutes of our arrival - very thoughtful as  they anticipated our fatigue and hunger after an almost 11 hour travel time from home to the hotel. The food throughout our stay was '5-star': sushi, oysters, vegetarians, meat-eaters or fish-lovers - all our catered for, as was our sweet-tooth - their desserts and patisserie area could respectfully rival any in France. Equally, the A La Carte Italian seafood restaurant experience was one of the many food highlights of our trip. Our room was spacious and peaceful, with air-con and a lovely balcony with an ocean view, that also overlooked the 3- pools, including an infinity pool. Our room was cleaned daily and the hotel was spotless and had a lovely, relaxing atmosphere. The restaurant staff were also kind and thoughtful. The indoor pool and Thalassa was used by us. The entertainment was low-key and 'chilled' (singers, musicians and dancers); however, the bonus of having access to the sister hotel, next door, meant that we could see 'shows' and access a disco and a range of day entertainment for adults and children for free. Absolute excellent value for money. Thank you Zainab, Chokra  and the whole team.

I stayed at this hotel on 11/05/2025. The place is beautiful and the welcome very warm. I am fully satisfied with this hotel, which is clean and conveniently located. We opted for a standard room, which was spacious, well maintained, with a king size bed and partial sea views, but one small note: the air conditioning was not turned on, although it was a little hot (26-28°C) for a month of May. The staff is extremely welcoming and helpful, especially the chefs, who are very responsive. The buffet offers a nice variety, although the pastry section could be improved. The pools are superb, as are the sea views, and the burkini is allowed for veiled women, which is a plus. I recommend this hotel without any hesitation. I share with you some pictures

What a great experience we had at the Royal Azur Thalassa hotel! You cannot fault it - 5 stars are well earned. The interior design, paintings and furnishings are top quality. They also have Azur gallery with spectacular pieces of art.   Reception staff and guest relationship manager are very professional, knowledgeable and helpful. They are always there to help.  Waiters are doing exceptionally good job in all 3 restaurants on site. Variety of food in the main restaurant is simply amazing - there was something to suit all tastes, no matter where in the world you came from - pizza, pasta, grilled fish, beef goulash, salad, etc and lots of fresh bakery, also plenty of fruit and desserts.   There are also several pools, spa center, indoors and outdoors chill lounges. Very conveniently in the hotel area (10 metres away from hotel entrance) there is Le Grandes Bazaar - local shop where you can buy souvenirs, clothing, carpets, cosmetic and other stuff surprisingly at a very decent price.   Simply the best hotel in Hammamet.   Thank you!

We are disappointed with the overall amenities of the hotel.  The food is bland, little varied. The waiters at the table are adorable. We quickly became ill and yet we avoided ice cubes. Leave with smecta and probiotics.  The pool staff, whether lifeguards or bartenders, do not necessarily bother to greet us and are unpleasant.  The staff at the front desk is very kind as well as the maids.  We are satisfied with our room except the soundproofing, we heard the noises from outside and the lobby until 1:30 in the morning this night.  We had sent an email to find out if there was a gym, a positive response from the hotel but on site we were surprised to discover that you had to pay 50dinars a day to access it.  The pictures of the hot tub attractive on the ad but it is only accessible by taking an additional option that is not indicated on the site.

reviews.review_title: Great location, hotel lacks personality outside
reviews.review_text: Excellent food and service in the dinning room, our room was immaculate but had only a small wardrobe and no drawer space .. The pool areas were Scruffy,sunbeds and tables dirty and wet, the pool bar staff were rude and lazy, it took 40 minutes and still no drink arrived, sadly this is because of the tipping culture they expect.. the life guards were hard to find and towels were kept in the hedge!  The beach bar and staff was friendly and clean.. such a shame, a refurbished hotel that had everything you would expect from an all inclusive hotel inside but outside was a disappointment where no management checked up on the staff or came to speak to the customers...

We had a lovely sister’s holiday at Royal Azur. Loved every second of it! All hotel staff were very hospitable and welcoming. Bedrooms are spacious and spotless with cleaners coming in daily to refresh beds and clean bathroom.  Buffet food was good. A wide variety to choose from, even if you’re a picky eater, there is definitely something you will find. Lovely outdoor pools which are well maintained and clean. The entire outdoor area is beautiful and relaxing. Beach is just a little walk down or you can use the lift. Light entertainment during the nights, nothing too much. If you want to book excursions, you can book through the main office. Big thank you to ZAINAB and HANA at the reception. They were so lovely all throughout our stay. Always checking in on us and making sure we have a good time. Definitely recommend this hotel, will be back soon!

Stunning Hotel! Had such a nice time Hotel staff were lovely, especially Zaynab and Hana. They made us feel very welcomed and helped us throughout our time here. Would definitely recommend to anyone thinking of booking. Rooms were very clean and spacious.

I had a very pleasant stay, the buffet is excellent (tasteful, not too much salt, not too much sugar) with lots of choices. Chefs and those who program the menus do absolutely everything to please us with the buffet.  The hotel is very clean. Special mention to Anissa who was my maid who did a superb job every day. This woman is fantastic, very warm, adorable. She's really a beautiful person. Thank you Anissa!  I would also like to thank Aykel at the Hotel Reception for his professionalism and great sympathy throughout my stay.

Plus points ….great hotel, spotless, pleasant attentive staff .Rooms cleaned to perfection. Plenty of sunbeds available at all times of day in the spacious grounds Main restaurant food is  varied, delicious and plentiful. Hayla on the waiting staff deserves a special thank you for her attentiveness and alertness when things need doing. Lovely pool areas. No animation team or music so very peaceful. Relaxing entertainment at night -saxophonist was great. Downside … too much use of plastic bottles and straws. Can the straws be replaced with card ones? Can plastic  bottles of water in the rooms be replaced with refillable glass ones? Can the shampoo, shower gel plastic bottles be replaced with all in one solid bars?. The only snacks available outside of mealtimes were small wrapped sandwiches from an outside bar. This is ok for me but at other “all inclusive resorts” snack options have been more widely available

We have just returned from this absolute gem of a hotel, on arrival we were met by their porter who took our cases away and waited for us to check in, check in was very smooth and quick and we were escorted to our room, the room - superior room with sea view, faultless (apart from be warned, no air can until June 1st) the view was impeccable, very comfortable extra large bed, lovely bathroom and seperate toilet and very clean and tidy. What seperates this hotel to others is the view, the best in Hammamet I was informed by our waiter around the pool Skander. what a lovely young man, nothing was any trouble and he was insulted if I went to the bar as he wanted to serve us poolside. The drinks are all served in glasses which is a nice touch, rather than plastic cups which other all inclusive hotels have normally presented us with. The pool area - impeccable, so well designed, you do not feel on top of anyone and lots of shaded areas if required. Lots of beds, very comfortable beds but in the morning these can be very wet as they are hosed down every morning, these do dry out quite quick though. Now the food - fantastic buffet restaurant with lots of choice, all fresh and something for everyone, we always straight to the grill section with fresh fish, meat etc. The pizzas were also very good. All in all amazing people, lovely hotel and an amazing holiday,  Thank you to all the staff at Royal Azur!!

An excellent surprise because we had read several very negative reviews. A beautiful and spacious room with a very nice sea and pool view. A warm welcome throughout the hotel and a quality and varied restaurant. A special mention for the Dia server who took care of us with competence and kindness. Many thanks to all the staff. The spa is also beautiful

Lovely hotel. We were upgraded to a suite which was really nice and spacious.  Poolarea very nice. No problem getting a sunbed. The pool bar was very hit and miss. Some of the staff obviously had their favourites. We weren't asked if we wanted a drink once. Had to go to the bar each time. Staff in the buffet restaurant were very helpful and polite, unfortunately the food was very average and not very warm . Definitely a disappointment. Luckily it didn't spoil our holiday. We got a good deal through Tui so we were happy overall.

reviews.review_title: Would be more of a 4 star!
reviews.review_text: The lobby is impressive! Our room (a premium sea view) is great and the views of the pools and the sea is beautiful! The dressing room, with the bench, is interesting. The spacious bathroom. It is however poorly arranged, the towel hooks of the sinks force to skin the back of the hands!  The 2 TVs work simultaneously... The terrace in front of the rooms sends back the heat and the air conditioning is not functional until May! An oven! The restaurant is nothing exceptional except the morning Tunisian honey cakes: excellent! As for the waiters, both restaurants and bars, it would be nice to reform them to the reception of all customers. The beach is nice and the sea a translucent blue-green. For me, a 5-star rating, even by local standards, should anticipate the needs of customers.

name: Sousse Palace Hotel & Spa
description: Sousse Palace Hôtel & Spa is a luxury 5*hotel located in the heart of the old town of Sousse, the “Pearl of the Sahel”, one of Tunisia’s most vibrant towns. Founded in 1966 & fully renovated in 2016, Sousse Palace has direct access to the beach and offers a total of 250 exquisitely decorated rooms which combine design & comfort, the ideal setting for a luxurious stay for tourists and business travelers alike. Our hotel has 3 à la carte restaurants with lovely panoramic views over the city & the Mediterranean on the 3rd, 4th &12th floors, a buffet restaurant, a lobby bar, a café maure, a salon de thé, a beach snack bar & 2 outdoors swimming pools. Our wellness corner features a hammam, a sauna, an indoor swimming pool with integrated jets, counter current and jacuzzi, a gym & a charming spa. Sousse Palace also provides 15 meeting rooms & an elegant ballroom equipped with state of the art technologies & high-speed Wi-Fi to accommodate an extensive range of business and social events.Read more

reviews.review_text: Unforgettable memories.  Classy hotel.  Warm welcome, varied animations.  Various meals of all nationalities.  Unlimited buffet.  Cleanliness impeccable. Hostesses, waiter and animators very smiling 😃.  Outdoor and indoor swimming pool with jaccuzi at your disposal.

The room was fully equped a cosy. Restaurant was great and a food was amazing. The pool is nice also the indoor one. The spa was amazing. Beach bar and the beach too. Animation was great with Magi and all of the staff are very friendly. I am very pleased with evrithing

Location of the hotel is great, near the center and all of the shops. Hotel is beautiful, food is amazing. Rooms are big and clean, and the service is so kind and nice. Beach is beautiful. There is a lot to see and experience. I am very pleased and I had great time.

reviews.review_title: Great experience at the Sousse palace

Animation at the top thank you Magui. Very nice catering service the servers are very professional.  Thank you again very much for Fedi. A big thank you to customer relations manager Alia

Quiet and relaxing hotel near the medina and the very nice personal town center and if you lack anything the lady public relationship and there to help we had a very nice stay. Beautiful walk along the beach to advise

The stay was superb. The rooms were tidy and cleaned every day. The staff was very polite and friendly, there was a relaxed atmosphere. The animation team did their best and made it fun every day. The food was delicious and varied every day. During dinner you noticed that the waiters tried very hard to make you as comfortable as possible. The location is also great, you get off the hotel and are on the beach. Overall, a great holiday!

reviews.review_title: Come and you won't be disappointed!
reviews.review_text: I have visited Tunisia seven times and I have the Sousse Palace the best hotel - by far. From the excellent variety of food, the private beach just footsteps away, the different types of massage (fabulous) the exceptional staff who go over and above their role (especially Alea and Maya) from the top managers to the gardeners - I cannot praise the Sousse Palace enough. Come and you won't be disappointed.

reviews.review_title: Training well spent at souse palace
reviews.review_text: Warm welcome thank you to all the training team really well equipped and well organized room with break coffe vary.  Ideal location classic and very chic modern hotel decoration with top lighting. Catering service with exceptional quality waiter to the top delicious food.  Room well cleaned.  Thanks to all the team Sousse Palace

Top experience with great animation.  Staff really high quality helpful listening.  Various food especially Tunisian 🎂🍰🎂🧁🥧🍪🍩🍨 Service deserves 5* luxury from the spa restaurant room.  Hotel to recommend 🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰
