Animations at the top, especially the animators entertain us throughout the day and in the evening. Always taking care of the guests. Various music, very good dj. An unforgettable vacation, we will come back.

Very good hotel, very clean and entertainment was fabulous, shout out to hanin she made the hotel extra special thank you verymuch, I'll be back in September but this time with my family! Thanks skanes serail 🇹🇳😍🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰

Very good stay at Skanes Serail where I came to spend a week of vacation.  The hotel’s biggest plus is its staff (animation, reception, shop...).  I was able to attend several evenings and activities (mini disco, gymnastic activity). All are super friendly and welcoming. The mini club leader is close to the children and loves working with them and it shows. The kids are thrilled to go and are happy to be together and it’s great to see, especially for a former Mini Club manager like me. I congratulate all the teams who make this stay unforgettable in every way.  Personally, I was able to spend a week of vacation in a beautiful hotel with friendly teams for children and adults alike.  I see pull my hat and I'll see you soon with my little brother who will be delighted to make friends at the mini club.

reviews.review_title: Very nice hotel but null services
reviews.review_text: Pros: The hotel is beautiful, the outdoor pools are fresh but amazing, fortunately there was the heated pool (stay April/May). Very clean hotel. The buffet is very good but almost every day the same dishes. Kids slides are great!  Cons: I confirm the nuisance of the club until 4am. Animations are missing, darts and pétanque only. The facilitator of the children's club does not take care of the children, she remains frozen on her phone and does not watch! (child found by the pool alone). You don't let kids in swimsuits into the hotel, but women who are, that's okay. You must regularly tip if you want to have cutlery quickly at the table, otherwise it takes time! The garden view is actually a view of a vacant lot where they do work from 6am to put sand back on the beach. Don't think you're going home rested!  Evening themes are not respected, it is day to day because sometimes the room is reserved for occasions (wedding, birthday). Remember to take a book or card game because in case of rain no animation is offered. Really bad because the setting is really beautiful!

name: Hannibal Palace
description: Looking for a place to stay in Port El Kantaoui? Then look no further than El Hana Hannibal Palace Hotel, a family-friendly hotel that brings the best of Port El Kantaoui to your doorstep.Guest rooms offer air conditioning and a minibar, and El Hana Hannibal Palace Hotel makes getting online easy as free internet access is available.You can also take advantage of some of the amenities offered by the hotel, including a concierge. In addition, guests can enjoy a pool and an on-site restaurant during their visit. As an added convenience, there is free parking available to guests.While staying in Port El Kantaoui, you can check out a popular cafe like High Square, which is serving up some great dishes.We’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay at El Hana Hannibal Palace Hotel as you experience everything Port El Kantaoui has to offer.Read more
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_title: Regular arrivals of tourists by bus
reviews.review_text: Very clean, breakfast excellent. Access to the swimming pool is not convenient by the ladders, risk of slipping as access is by a step.  No wifi in the rooms, mattresses for deck chairs for a fee. the big problem is the mass access by regular buses of Algerian tourists, mainly men who throw themselves on the buffet in the evening, leave more than half on their tables and stick badly. I'm not going back to this hotel.

Nice hotel good breakfast correct for the rate and well placed nice staff just breakfast an unpleasant waiter I did not mind to report the manager did his job badly spoken to customers but apart from this disrespectful hotel very nice

I came in early September, I give the full Rating. Value for Award very respected. Breakfast varied. Very spacious room, magnificent view, on the Kantawa port and Hannibal park, close to all amenities. Welcoming and very polite staff, adding very attentive. I loved my experience at this Pension. I strongly recommend it for a very limited budget.

Had a lovely 2 week stay here.   Rooms were clean, spacious and modern.  Grounds were well kept and very scenic. Plenty of space in the hotel to sit and chill out on the wifi.   Pool area was clean and plenty of brollys and sun loungers.   Bar staff were exceptional, they made amazing cocktails, service was speedy and personalised and they were always smiling.  Reception were helpful and friendly.   Food was yummy. Served hot and always replenished when things were getting low.  Maids were happy to clean and replenish the room with fresh white towels daily.  I will 100% be returning to this hotel.  Thank you.   Tips: *fly spray *tipping staff goes a long way

I am from Wales but spend most of my life in Tunisia I liked this hotel very much clean food great but I will advise holiday makers this is not like all hotels mostly other cultures not Tunisian. And  you would feel singled out in the restaurant. But I am a person who mingles and I found most people lovely but overall hotel clean beautiful. Rooms cleaned every day. TV and fridge in all rooms without charge which was great all channels I enjoyed my stay I took videos pics.

reviews.review_title: Hotel does not have the value of 4 stars
reviews.review_text: Loud noise until late at night due to the musical parties organized each night followed by noise and noise at night in the corridors at the end of each evening, at around 3:00 a.m. power cut in the rooms until to 7:00 a.m. to save energy. You have to offer a few dinars to the agent so that he authorizes access to the swimming pool with jacuzzi. The rapas have no taste of rotten fruit, especially the cheese, it looks like soap. The rooms are not cleaned every day and a towel is taken away from you so that you end the stay with just one towel.

We (my wife, son and I) booked 2 rooms. The rooms stank extremely badly, the carpets were just black with dirt. The rooms were really always dirty. The disgusting smell starts in the hallway where the room is located. I reported this problem to the staff twice. The first time it was simply ignored, the second time they said they would take care of it but nothing happened. The bed linen is not changed. So really catastrophic. I have already been to many 4 star hotels in Tunisia but I have never had anything like this. Also in the restaurant: many local people come in groups (on excursions from other Tunisian cities) and empty the buffet in 5 minutes! It takes a long time for the buffet to be refilled... In the room (again): the minibar is always warm. The cooling doesn't work.  All in all I would avoid this hotel! It was our last time here in the hotel.

The security guards are an absolute disaster at this hotel. They are rude, they speak badly to you. I was really disappointed on every level. To avoid. The entertainment isn't the best, but they do their best. Average food

reviews.review_title: Price is high and service is average
reviews.review_text: Lighting is poor and rooms have dated decor  The pool has so much chlorine it hurts my eyes.  TV channels are unclear and the number of channels is very limited    All rooms opening onto the kitchen suffer from very significant noise due to the boiler  Weak air conditioning  The bedding lacks comfort

reviews.review_title: This hotel is a disaster! horrible ! Run away!
reviews.review_text: the worst hotel I have visited, this hotel is unheard of on all levels, starting with its stars: it is a hotel saying 4 stars is not even worth one star, very old we would say an inn Staff and waiters of the restaurant incompetent rude and thugs they charged me for the fish without my request and aggressive who fight with residents and tourists to send them away and prevent them from returning to the restaurant; I'll explain to you: there is the server of the space and the lower block, a thug who makes a fuss with the clients to reject them and send them back to the upper space and reduce the workload after even the bald server to adopt the same strategy of fighting and insulting residents to prevent them from coming back for their dinner They behave towards customers as if they are bothering them At the pool level, half of the chairs and deckchairs are private and reserved for outsiders. Half of the beach has become private and paid television does not work. No wifi in the rooms  The food is not enough for everyone and a tail of tongue during dinner For lunch there is one and only fast football outside in front of the hotel and as a result you have to queue for 2 hours to buy a sandwich (the queue in the hotel and outside Also ) Salafists, veiled people, people of all kinds reside in this hotel  lots of fights, noise and problems at night in front of the hotel and the disco. It is better to close this hotel, it gives a very bad image to hotels in Tunisia; NEVER AGAIN will I come back to THIS HOTEL or to Sousse

Love this hotel and location is perfect travelled with friend .. very few English which never really bothered me lot of Algerian young boys .. never bothered me also... very friendly .. rooms cleaned everyday and fresh towels food repetitive but always something to eat .. do have problem with buying water with meal which is not good can't even take own (water) in restaurant .. no night time entertainment again don't bother me ..staff and security have been friendly and helpful when needed .. can't wait to go back 😊

Not great. No English people in the hotel, full of rude Algerians.  Not very clean.  Staff don't speak much english. Internet only works in reception and is not very strong, doesn't always work. The pool and the beach well mainted.Have got pictures but can't upload them.

The worst hotel I have ever stayed in in tunisia night club by reception on until 4am every night lots of tunisian men in hotel and lots of prostitutes in hotel coming in taxis ,and going in bar in hotel,we went ti reception at 2am to use WiFi and the staff trying to get us to go inside hotel didn't want us to see what was going on,got charged for a mat for sun bed had no rest at all to much noise at night,towels dirty marks all over them,carpets dirty,room smelt,corridors dark never again dont take familys there its like a singles hotel

Unacceptable hotel. The rooms are very dirty. It's not even worth staying. They even charged for pillows and towels in the pool and then they want to call it a 4-star hotel. The only thing worth it was its location. Otherwise, unacceptable hotel. We stayed from 23 to 31 July 2022 and changed rooms 3 times because the rooms were very dirty.

This hotel is located in a great position for Kantaoui  marina. That’s the plus point. Bad points…arrived around 9.30pm and shown to our room. Three light bulbs missing, it was so dark it was like Hannibal Lectors cell. Reported to reception and maintenance man came up straight away. Looked at missing bulbs and came back within 10 minutes to replace them all. This hotel is so dark and dreary I honestly thought it was named after Hannibal Lector (it might be, I’m still unsure). Everywhere you go it’s dark. We never ate here at all and ate out everyday. On our short visit it was rammed with lusty Algerian single men which, for two women is intimidating. My daughter sought help from the pool attendant, he looked after her and kept her safe from all those said lusty men. He was brilliant, can’t fault him. Friendly, protective and he respected women. On the day before we left, two different reception staff said our transfer coach to Enfidah was 9am. Arrived at reception in good time and no coach. Further investigation at reception revealed the two reception staff didn’t have a clue and the coach arrived at 8am so we missed it. A fantastic reception member managed to call us a taxi and we made our flight home in time. We will never go back here. Absolutely awful stay. It was an urgent late booking and we took what we could get. I was not impressed at all. Nice room and bathroom. Can’t say much else in good terms about this place. Definitely not great for lone female travellers.

reviews.review_title: Good Location; Slow Wifi; Not for Families
reviews.review_text: I Stayed in this Hotel for 06 days During the period of July -August. First what to expect : - 3 Pools : One for Adults + One for kids + A covered one (not free) - Private beach; Gym; Free Parking; Wifi; Bar & Lounge; Night Club (free entree) - SPA (Sauna, Jacuzzi, Massage, Face treatment)(not free)  - The Rooms: Small TV, Balcony; Free toiletries, Air Conditoning, the floor is covered with Carpet The Good: - The best thing about this hotel is its location, it's really close to manny beaches, to Hannibal attraction park, Aqua Palace (Aquatic games); Port El Kantaoui and other attractions. - The food is good, its an open buffet. - The Pools are great, Large and there is one for kids. - The Rooms are clean and with good views; The Shower is Big with a Bath.  - Free entree to the Nightclub except for the weekends  The Bad: - The Wifi is really Slow, You have no Connection in the rooms. - The Rooms are a bit Small and Old, The TV is Small with 4 or 5 Channels. - The Beach is small and full of algae. - The Staff is not that great, some of them are really rude. - The Nightclub is verry loud so expect it to be noisy really late at night. - The Food is good but the restaurant is really crowded; somtimes you have to wait up to 30minutes to get a plate. - Most of the residents of the Hotel are Young Algerians/tunisians, so i don't recommend it to families, especially at night the Club attract a lot of people.

name: Tui Blue Palm Beach Hammamet
description: The TUI BLUE Palm Beach Hammamet is the new jewel of TUI BLUE. Relax on a sun lounger by the hotel's fine sandy beach and sip a drink or take a refreshing dip in the pool. In the evening, you can head to the main restaurant or dine in the à la carte restaurant.Read more
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_title: Bob and Denise will be back.
reviews.review_text: Start with a negative, only booked one week instead of two, animation team made a good holiday great. Big thank you to Sam,and his boys and girls, to many names to mention, so I'll say ALL, it's quicker. Room, food, service, entertainment, all staff, in a word excellent. If your considering this hotel, go ahead and BOOK IT. I know we will be returning.

Just returned after an amazing week at this outstanding hotel. All staff are excellent cant do enough for you,food is beautiful.Big thankyou to Mondher and Mohammad in the coffee bar,Nino and Gophy from entertainment team, Maha experience manager and Samir housekeeper.We will be back many times . Thankyou all for a amazing holiday.

Just got back after a week at this hotel, from the moment we walked in we were greeted by the friendly reception staff, even the manageress gave us a lovely welcome, and it smelt absolutely gorgeous.  The rooms were lovely and clean that was down to the lovely  Sondes  nothing was to much trouble for her. The beach and pool area were clean and tidy lots of sunbeds and the guy in the beach bar was amazing and so were the life guards. The food was out of this world there was something there for everyone  the waiters were lovely  especially  Saida he couldn't do enough for you and always had a smile, and Ahmed always made sure we had a table. We had a lovely time and would definitely recommend this hotel

An exceptional stay  Thank you to all the staff and especially to Salma, our maid. I recommend without hesitation this club  Great location also with access to the beach. The buffet of the exceptional restaurant, a very large choice of dishes, varied food every day. The waiters and all the hotel staff are lovely

reviews.review_title: Had a great time in the hotel
reviews.review_text: Nice hotel with really friendly staff. The entertainment team are really friendly and get everyone involved in the activities. There's something for everyone to get involved with from hard fitness classes to french bowls, darts, archery, bean bag tossing.. its all good fun. The entertainment team are brilliant and keep everything fun. The waiters are really attentive too.. both in the restaurants and by the pool. Couldn't fault them.

best hotel ever staff especially entertainment team  absolutely amazing very clean hotel fantastic tunisian people and extremely very friendly 5 starts food overall holiday 6 starts full recommend excellent activities beautiful and clean rooms with amazing staff <3

So I am sitting on my balcony after a bit of changeable weather day. As my trip draws to an end I wanted to review this beautiful hotel. The building itself is lovely to look at and the reception area is clean and impressive.   The staff are all so friendly and genuinely look pleased to see you. They are attentive yet professional at all times. This would include front of house staff to cleaners and gardeners.  Cleanliness - the hotel is spotless you will see staff cleaning constantly the hotel smells amazing because of it. Our room kept pristine by Sonde our cleaner.  Pool area is large with one unheated pool and a smaller children's pool. The temperature is more than bearable with lots of people using it including myself. The infinity pool looks like there is improvement work being done so can't comment on use.  Food and drinks - I have been to many all inclusive hotels but I have to say this hotel offers choices many don't.  Fresh juice in the morning NOT from a carton also smoothie of the day. Again freshly made and included. The salads are amazing and to be offered steak and langoustines as part of buffet !!  A l a carte culinarium - one free meal within a week stay. Easy to book with Tui app.  4 course meal with lots of choice.   Spa - what can I say the highlight of my trip some of the best treatments I've had. Trust me I've had a lot. Hands down beats and cruise ship Spa and for a fraction of the price. Excellent packages offered you'd be mad not to take advantage of this.  All in all feel like I've had a wellness break and will definitely be back.  Well done TUI blue palm beach.!!

The entertainment team have looked after us very well. They want to get all guests involved in the activities but they are not pushy. The bar staff make sure the drinks are flowing at all times and there is plenty choice of food. The beach is lovely and the staff are excellent.

We visited last year and had a great time, the staff are all very friendly, attentive and have time to make you feel welcome. The hotel has made improvements since last year, including a lift from reception to the restaurant level, I think the management genuinely listen to their guests and want to improve their experience. The food is varied and is great, sunbeds are plentiful with towels provided and cushions of needed. Entertainment is provided throughout the day and evening. We will return again!! Thanks to all the team.

This is a very nice hotel with a gym, indoor pool, outdoor pool and an infinity pool. The entire staff are great and can't do enough for you and there's entertainment on the night with some fun activities in the day. The buffet restaurant always had a good selection of food on the go, they had mundane stuff like chips but also had local dishes with peppers, chillies, cuscus, rice and curries etc, they also did themed meals like Mexican where they made fresh tacos among other things and also had a great selection of puddings. So the bad points, which aren't so bad, the rooms were a little tired in places like the shower was a bit wobbly, just little bits and bobs really, our room had 2 single beds rather than a double, but this is nothing that would put me off or detract from the holiday experience.

This is a lovely hotel and the accommodation, the staff and the amenities are very good. It’s ideal for a holiday where you just want to stay in the resort and relax.  Food in buffet and in a la carts restaurant was excellent and diverse (unless you’re vegan as the choices there are very limited). Thankfully I’m not vegan so had a lot of lovely meals there. Waiting staff were very attentive and I’d like to mention one of the waiters (Faycel) who made amazing efforts to look after everyone in his area of the restaurant and made people feel special when dining. Only negative for me was that there’s not much to see near the hotel so a taxi (or a walk) to Hammamet Old Médina was a must. The new Médina at Yasmin was not so good. We took the offer of a Sahara excursion and that was definitely worthwhile

Have just returned from a week at this fabulous hotel. From the warm welcome on the first day to the last early morning breakfast on the last, this hotel does it all with style and a smile. Room-very modern design and perfect, spotlessly clean, Food- What can I say, there is something for everyone and plenty of it. The whole F&B team were just excellent. Big shout out to Ahmed who was there with a smile and a bottle of Rose or a beer at every glance. Animation team-excellent, really worked hard to involve everyone and all I'm going to say is "silent disco". If you know you know! Pool deck and beach were fabulous, but please provide sunbed mattresses for pool beds, beach and garden beds have them and my old creaking back would have sure benefited from one. The views from the lobby to the sea really does give you that wow sensation. This is one very good hotel with excellent staff!  Of course there can be some small improvements (hooks in the bathroom to hang towels please) and the aforementioned mattresses' for pool sunbeds, but these really are minor.

My husband and I, daughter and 5year old grandson stayed 2nd May 25 for a week and we instantly regretted not booking for longer. We had two garden rooms which were lovely and cleaned daily. We were a little disappointed that the mini bar wasn’t replenished or even had soft drinks upon arrival and only water provided.  However, everything else made up for that.  Upon arrival Mayha escorted us to the restaurant to have lunch and showed us around, until our rooms were ready. Straight away we could tell the people made this hotel. Our grandson has severe coeliac disease (not able to eat gluten).  GF bread, pasta etc is extremely expensive in Tunisia. However they tried their very best to accommodate and we always found something for him to eat. We did take our own  GF bread & cereal  & snacks with us etc.   But there was a lot of choice for him. The chefs were amazing and so was our lunch and evening waiter, forgive the spelling but our waiter  Chadll and Karim were outstanding from that first lunch visit they memorised our drinks which were waiting for us at meal times.  Our breakfast waiter Ahmed (I think his name was the exact same) he also assisted us and opened up for breakfast early the morning of our pick up to the airport, so we could eat something. This was very kind and helpful. Thank you.  From life guards, security, cleaners, waiters, management and animation team all so  hard working staff, again unable to name you all, I can only remember Nino & Gorfy and the lovely lunatic who does the aqua HIIT and gym, simply amazing - thank you.   We did enjoy  a catamaran trip which was bought through the hotel for  £37 each ( no charge for 5 yr old) for half a day was lovely and it was safe.  We’ve already booked for next May but for 11 nights this time  and not 7, but we’ve opted for 2 sea view rooms next time as this has the sun on the balcony in the mornings which we liked.   The sea views do overlook the entertainment at night so if you go to bed early I’d pick a garden view.  See you soon and take care x

I will come back to it without problem.the staff with little care all day.very friendly we feel to be part of the family so helpful.especially the waiter Mohamed who does not exist to inform me of places to visit.bravo to the housekeeper who was decorated free note room just out of kindness and free.the food is very varied and delicious.go without problem.the bartenders make you cocktails hell.they deserve its 4 stars.

Pleasant stay in this very clean hotel where the staff is really friendly smiling who is in the little care of the maid from the catering and reception.Nice spacious and clean room the little more the toilets are separated. We are delighted in all respects Nothing wrong

name: Zodiac Hotel
description: See why so many travelers make Zodiac their hotel of choice when visiting Hammamet. Providing an ideal mix of value, comfort and convenience, it offers a family-friendly setting with an array of amenities designed for travelers like you.The hotel offers a concierge, to make your visit even more pleasant. The property also features a pool and free breakfast. Guests arriving by vehicle have access to free parking.If you are looking for some good spots to eat nearby, you may want to check out Restaurant Sheherazade (0.3 mi), La Bouillabaisse (0.9 mi), or Golden Fish (0.5 mi), all of which are within walking distance of Zodiac Hotel.Best of all, Zodiac Hotel makes it easy to experience some great Hammamet attractions like Kasbah of Hammamet, which is a popular historic site.At Zodiac, your comfort and satisfaction come first, and they look forward to welcoming you to Hammamet.Read more

reviews.review_text: Perfect stay to rest by the pool with young and old  Various and correct catering. Perhaps ice creams are missing especially for the snack and yogurts for the little ones. Cleaning remains to be reviewed as well as cleaning of towels. A special mention for Dido being part of the animation team that embellished us our week!!!!!

Great atmosphere and the team very invested in activities and encourages you!  Activities are diverse. In general the rooms are nice as well as the architecture.  The staff at the top.  I recommend it if you want to spend the best holiday in Hammamet!

Second time at the zodiac and always very pleasant stay. Various buffet, smiling team and available!  Special mention for the animation team really great, bella susie ach malek and the others without forgetting medhi! I recommend.  See you soon!

reviews.review_title: Very good experience at the zodiak family club in Bouficha
reviews.review_text: So from the arrival I was greeted as it should be, cocktail arrival, personal care. The hosts are super nice, very nice. Special mention for Malek, Bella and Suzi who welcomed me super well and made me feel like home. Lots of activities throughout the day. Very good restaurant and tasty cocktail.

I had a great stay at this hotel, the staff is very kind , the restaurant is good. The staff is very helpful on arrival they take the suitcases so you don't have to carry them. They are all very polite and I have a preference for three hotel animators who are Malek, Belle and Souzi and all the team. They are adorable I recommend them as soon as you arrive.

Highlights of the hotel l entertainment team at the top!!!!! meals are good, our room tjr very clean every day, just lack of towels with a little more thicknesses!! French speaking hotel that allowed us to get to know each other a lot c was very nice (if qq recognizes me c is pat 2 of the pétanque) Point weak no direct access to the beach it belongs more to the city and not at all maintained!! You also have to go far to say to do qq chose!! if you have the opportunity make the catamaran proposed by Mohamed who proposes the pirate ship to the hotel Staff and servers also very nice

I had a great stay at this hotel, the staff is welcoming and the food is good and the animators are too kind, dynamic and smiling  The room is beautiful  Quality services price and top!  I recommend this hotel

reviews.review_title: Super holiday with great entertainment team
reviews.review_text: Great hotel, we had a great stay, very welcoming. The hosts and staff are super friendly and friendly. The pools and slides are great. The rooms are spacious and clean.  Great hotel! I recommend you 👍🏾

We had a great time, the animators were super top! My girlfriends and I were delighted we were treated like princesses again thank you to the whole team we will come back with pleasure!  (I highly recommend you do the quad it was a great experience)
Great stay as last year animation the restaurant the spa the quad parachute.  Great mohamed team at the restaurant 🥰 thanks to the animators zuzi and dido 🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍

Welcoming hotel with good family space , the animation is on TOP thank you to Dido, the buffet and good quality, pleasant stay with the medina and coffee safsaf at the top for a good evening chicha , we will return next year to relax and enjoy Tunisian life in the back season (25-30 degrees)

A week of pure madness with friends in this hotel, and frankly... it was the fire! 🔥 We had fun from morning to night, and even beyond (thanks the evenings!).  The animation team? Good-humored machines! Always there to make us move, laugh, dance... Impossible to be bored, they assured serious 💯  Food level, nothing wrong: we ate well, it was varied and super good. And to recover after all that, the rooms were top: quiet, clean, and perfect for a good night's sleep (or a well deserved nap 😴).  And so... THE ZANZIBAR 😍! A crazy atmosphere, cocktails banging, good music, crazy laughs galore... we would have stayed there all night (actually, we did 😅).  In short, a week that we are not about to forget. We will definitely be back. And you, come as you are, but come quickly!

We just spent an unforgettable week at the hotel with friends, and everything was just perfect! The atmosphere was top from start to finish. Special mention to the animation team: amazing, funny, always full of energy and with little care so that everyone has a good time. Congratulations to them, you set fire 🔥!  As for catering, we feasted every day. Various meals, tasty, and for all tastes. Jean Zibar? An experience in itself! Awesome atmosphere, delicious cocktails, and evenings that we are not about to forget.  The rooms were comfortable, quiet, and we slept really well after busy days.  In short, a perfect week with friends, to do again without hesitation. Come as you are, you will leave with memories full of your head!

A great stay in a very good hotel with great service and a great entertainment team! Dido at the mini club is great ❤️ The restaurant is very good, we eat very well and the waiters and cooks are all great. The service in the rooms is very good and the pools are great!

We went to this hotel from 10 to 17 May 2025 , very good wide choice service, very good meal and diversified simple and effective. Perfect welcome on all the staff, little crush on our maid room 211 ✨️ and a big thank you to Hamza at the bar super service, simply little catch on the noise in the rooms in the morning from 07:00 we all hear absolutely all... pity if not great hotel.

name: Thalassa Mahdia
description: If you’re looking for a resort in Mahdia, look no further than Thalassa Mahdia.Given the close proximity of popular landmarks, such as Mahdia's Old Town (2.6 mi) and Fort Ottoman Borj El Kebir (2.8 mi), guests of Thalassa Mahdia can easily experience some of Mahdia's most well known attractions.Rooms at Thalassa Mahdia offer air conditioning providing exceptional comfort and convenience, and guests can go online with internet access.A 24 hour front desk, a concierge, and baggage storage are some of the conveniences offered at this resort. A pool and a poolside bar will also help to make your stay even more special. If you are driving to Framissima Thalassa Mahdia Hotel, parking is available.While staying at Thalassa Mahdia, you may want to check out Chicko's (0.6 mi) which is a short walk away.Plus, during your trip, don't forget to check out a history museum, such as Mahdia Museum.The staff at Thalassa Mahdia looks forward to serving you during your upcoming visit.Read more

reviews.review_text: The hotel is amazing we was Here family we Will come back Here again the animation team is great always smiling activities the staf is Nice the pool is big the food is very delicious the sea is Amazyng the service are very friendly the bar man top is very Nice

Hotel and friendly 8/10 The animations and therefore the animators are friendly and very nice 9/10. The pool is large and enough deckchairs for everyone 9/10. Level catering we eat rather well 8/10. So I recommend this hotel  Total: 8/10

Good value for money. Great entertainment team. Complete buffet and healthy food. Beach easy access.serviceable. Interesting thalassotherapy treatment. Various activities.lots of dance. Several nationalities and good understanding. To do

We had amazing holiday it was great me and my mom the animation is very friendly the is staf is good the service are very nice the food is very delicious the pool is very big and clean we will come back here again it was very beautiful experiance !!!!

reviews.review_title: A hotel or gatekeeper makes the law ⚖️!!!
reviews.review_text: The guard of the entrance to the car park of the Itropika Tabarka hotel on 17/04/2025 at around 10:00 pm, we were two people came to visit the pretty city of tabarka as a tourist me of Algerian nationality and my friend of Russian nationality, we were advised the hotel of itropika to get drinks and possibly eat, but we were surprised by the guard at the entrance of the car park who refused us access because the hotel is full and the access to the restaurant bar is strictly reserved for tenants, we tried several times to let us access at least the reception to talk about it but his refusal was categorical and we came back empty-handed The next day On 18/04/2025 we try a second attempt, this time we show up at 6pm to see if there was a possibility to reserve a place at the restaurant for the evening, we were greeted by the receptionist who directs us to the caretaker (same from the evening before) to give him our names!!! Now I wonder how a guard at the entrance of the hotel has more prerogatives and decision-making power than the receptionist or the people of the hotel administration, I will leave you to answer me  For my part I do not hide my disappointment and frustration about this incident especially in the company of a foreign person of Russian nationality... reviews.review_title: fun in the sun in north africa
reviews.review_text: SCOTT E  I presume you were talking about the group of 6 - 8 adults who after riding the inflatables on the beach returned to the pool after 5pm once the pool bar had closed and most guests had returned to there rooms to prepare for there evening meal etc,  That the said group of adults decided to have some fun in an otherwise deserted area.  In case you had forgotten how to do so it is called having fun on your holiday - i would suggest you try it sometime - you never know you might just like it !!!!  NOW ON TO AN ACTUAL REVIEW OF THE HOTEL ITSELF   The staff are all amazing and nothing is to much hassle for them to ensure you are having a great holiday.  Rooms are a little dated as is some of the exterior but you need to remember you are in north Africa and money is not as free flowing as we have it back home.  Maintenance work was ongoing to the hotel as i witnessed first hand 2 employees scrapping and repainting the rear of the building to make it look welcoming to all future guests.  The food is also lovely with an A la carte restaurant  with different themed dishes served.  we will return to the hotel that is for sure as we enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend to anybody.

The hotel and facilities are lovely overall. As others have said, it needs a bit of tlc but that all comes at a cost inevitably passed on to the guest. It's not luxury but neither is the price. The food was all excellent. No pork products are served.   The highlight is the pool area. It's lovely and peaceful which the majority embrace. Sadly, one squad of overfed, sunburnt and drunk British goons decided to ruin everyone's peace and quiet by screaming and bombing the pool for an entire afternoon.  The hotel is adults only, but some children never grow up.   Nobody from the hotel stepped in, which would have been nice.   This was certainly the exception though and the majority of the time it was lovely and calm. Jamil and Daniel from the Animation team were very pleasant. Encouraging but not pushy and two really interesting guys, full of local tips.   The beach area immediately adjacent to the hotel is kept really pristine. Sadly though, anywhere on the beach not outside a hotel is filthy with rubbish, bottles, half rotten cans etc. It's really yucky and it would be nice if the hotels clubbed together to have it cleaned up.   Nabuel is worth a taxi ride (£5 e/w) is you like the full Tunisian Medina souke experience. It's wild with hassle and haggling. You need to have your wits about you, but it's a lot of fun. If you prefer your shopping a little more serene, there's a great shop outside right of the main gates, just past Marco Polo. The owner is a gem, and all the prices are fixed and great value. They sell everything you find at the market and more.   If you go left outside and walk around 30 minutes following the coast and cemetary, you'll find an old fort and Medina surrounded by o a lovely harbour and restaurant area.

This is a lovely hotel with incredible staff. Rooms are spacious and always kept clean. The pool is beautiful. The food is incredible. We loved the beach as it’s quiet with a breeze. Only a few respectful beach sellers.  I can’t rate the staff highly enough! Special mention to Ameur and Ossama in the restaurant, and James (007 1/2) and Ben at the BBQ. Would love to come back!

Stayed for 7 days in May with my partner. Hotel is ideal for an all inclusive relaxing poolside holiday in the sun. Whilst the facilities and the rooms at the hotel are somewhat dated and due a modern update/refurbishment (air conditioning in the room works but is mediocre at best), the staff were amazing and went above and beyond to ensure all guests were happy.   The pool is lovely and very well maintained - with a pool bar that serves beer, wine, cocktails and soft drinks.    The hotel is right on the edge of the sea, which is ideal if guests feel they need a change of scenery from the pool.   The food was really good and exceeded expectations. All diets are catered for. Me and my partner never left breakfast, lunch or dinner feeling hungry.   All guests were civilised and polite to staff.   FYI: Tipping is a BIG aspect of the culture in Tunisia due to low wages. Be prepared to bring cash to exchange to Tunisian Dinar on arrival (Dinar is a closed currency and cannot be purchased outside of Tunisia)   A brilliant stay. Would recommend.

Great hotel for getting away,  zoning out and relaxing. Friendly, quiet and very clean. Pool area was relaxing and very well presented. All the staff are polite and helpful. The best bit: I would recommend the young lady, Manam,  for a full body, deep tissue massage,  with reflexology.  One of the best! I also had a facial with Houda, very relaxing.  Worst bit: The area. Dirty, unkept and too many locals wanting something.   Come here to relax and watch the world go by..... bring plenty of books too!

All the staff caring for the guests from the gardener to the director all are kind without being burdensome.The thalasso and its staff as charming as professional helped to make our stay just perfect.Finally we will not forget the quality of the dishes and the offer offered at each meal. We'll be back...

reviews.review_title: Wonderful hamam and massage - not to be missed!!
reviews.review_text: First the hamam (spa)  Really excellent - we had 30 mins in thalasso pool/jacuzzi/water jets to ourselves which was great. Then on to (hot 🥵!) hamam where the lovely Houda did the honours, guiding us around, and scrubbing us down. Smiley, friendly, lovely lady. Then 10 mins and tea to cool off a bit, then on to WONDERFUL 50 mins massage, courtesy of the very talented Maram and Naziha. Both were truly excellent and provided exactly what we wanted, pressure wise etc. I have an injury to my arm, and Maram handled it beautifully- massaged, but carefully and thoroughly. The supporting team, Fatem and Awatef (spelling - not sure, sorry!) were helpful and friendly and the whole experience was marvellous thanks to their expertise. HIGHLY recommended. 🙏🙏. Than you all, ladies 💕🥰

We are currently staying at Aziza for 10 nights. This is our 2nd visit here. The first was back in Oct 2013. We were made to feel welcome from the moment we arrived. The food is very good and plentiful with a good selection and waiting staff are very friendly and just want you to enjoy your holiday. Although the building itself looks a bit tired now from last time, the room is clean, spacious, and comfortable. The hotel is a little out the way for some attractions but step out, and a taxi is always easily accessible. We just wanted a holiday to recharge our batteries with good food and pleasant staff, so we're happy. Evening entertainment is not to our taste in reception but there is a pub downstairs to use instead. Thank you to everyone here, including the pool staff, for our ongoing comfort and well-being needs being taken care of  for the rest of our stay.

A real gem! Came for 5 nights with my dad, and was very impressed by the lovely hotel and pool area, great food and lovely staff. Great to have access to beach as well. Everyone we met was lovely (staff and hotel guests) and we enjoyed the chilled out atmosphere. The al a carte was great, and the pub was good fun with a great quiz and showing the football. Please disregard the negative reviews, you would have to be very fussy not to enjoy it here! I cant wait to return. Thanks to all of the staff for a great holiday.

name: El Mouradi Djerba Menzel
description: Finding an ideal family-friendly hotel in Midoun does not have to be difficult. Welcome to El Mouradi Djerba Menzel, a nice option for travelers like you.Phare de Taguermess (Lighthouse) (3.1 mi), located nearby, makes El Mouradi Djerba Menzel a great place to stay for those interested in visiting this popular Midoun landmark.The rooms offer air conditioning, and getting online is possible, as free internet access is available, allowing you to rest and refresh with ease.El Mouradi Djerba Menzel features a concierge. In addition, as a valued El Mouradi Djerba Menzel guest, you can enjoy a pool and free breakfast that are available on-site. Guests arriving by vehicle have access to free parking.While visiting Midoun, you may want to try some shrimp at one of the nearby restaurants, such as Djerba-Sidi Ali Restaurant.Midoun is also home to Krokodilfarm Animalia, a popular park that is not too far from El Mouradi Djerba Menzel.El Mouradi Djerba Menzel looks forward to welcoming you on your visit to Midoun.Read more
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_text: We had a good stay at el mouradi djerba menzel c a great experience especially with the team of animation with good moods with multiple activities even in the evening with impeccable evening without forgetting the delicious food , service clean rooms and all. Thank you all staff

We had a great time. The animation team was at the top and the activities were all funnier and more original than the last. The rooms are clean and the restaurant service was efficient. Thank you to all the staff! I recommend:)

Very good hotel, there is everything you need, nice outdoor pools and an interior, the food is very good, the hotel is clean. The staff is friendly. We had the right to a restaurant to choose: Tunisian, fish or Italian, we had chosen Tunisian and it was perfect. We had a very good week.

Hello, I don't understand how anyone could give this hotel 100%. I no longer recommend it to my enemies... We were there 1 year ago and it was a disaster !!  I haven't had anything worse in 5 stars yet. After about 35 x Turkey and 25 x Egypts I can certainly make a judgement. Despite about 100 USD Bakshish a week, we were treated as unwanted persons.  The occupancy was about 90% local guests , who fought at the buffet like it was the last meal and then the 50% just left at the table.. There was only 1 pool where our women could swim in bikinis, otherwise everywhere screaming cheeky kids playing a football in the reception without anyone having any regard for the other guests..    I could write for a long time, but there's no point.  The locals are there in your country and should do what they want - they are there at home .  But please do NOT recommend this hotel with top marks to people from D, A, CH, PL, CZ, SK who are not used to this.

In to spend a week here in el mouradi djerba menzel the hotel and very clean we love it bcp and especially the animation team are very welcoming smiling we like it the steps courses and zumba with the animation team that we put our stay mieu. Not to mention the delicious food and the own rooms.

My stay will be pleasant, unforgettable and Special mention for the team of animation of your Good mood and your welcome without forgetting our Friends Abdel who put our stay mieu. All the staff will be nice. Everything is good food, service, rooms..  Felt like a family here at El mouradi djerba Menzel. I recommend for all to spend a Magnificent stay.

Comfortable and pleasant rooms We regularly visit this hotel. The spa is fantastic we come out relaxed and the staff is really listening  Very attractive price , massages we love.  You should follow the advice ‘d Alex always good advice and good mood.  Our drop-off point for assured relaxation.

We were very well received on arrival at the hotel despite the late hour, helpful and kind personal, the very active entertainment team offers several activities and various evenings, comfortable room there is everything you need and the housekeeping does everyday the very nice personal cleaning, very good restaurants various varieties of dishes and sometimes Tunisian themed you will miss nothing in the morning as well as noon and evening. As for the activities you take in the hotel (spa quad ballad carriage etc...) they are beautiful and relaxing. Finally to tell you that we had a great holiday in the hotel.

Decent room restaurant good reception friendly animation team super friendly hotel I recommend access to the sea is accessible superb beach room cleaned every day staff at the top the exteriors are well maintained🌹😚🥳🎉👌❤️

very nice hotel, nice infrastructure but would need some small renovation work since it is a 50 year old hotel... All the staff is very kind, helpful ...from the front desk staff to the housekeepers and cleaners...all very polite...except the manager who does not say hello to anyone, yet it should be the first to greet the customers thanks to whom he has a job...maybe he is at the end of his career and no longer interested in his work...a good manager is nevertheless indispensable to stimulate troops and customers...

Nice and well located hotel with direct access to the beach. Very enthusiastic and dynamic animation team, especially Salim aka Momo, Abdel and Bashir. Meals could have more diversity but let’s say it’s not peak season yet probably. I will return with great pleasure

Very nice hotel, super friendly animator and great atmosphere very well received from the reception, correct food perfect room clean, very nice outside, Bar what you need  Very nice beach, maintenance service quickly available

We are two adults and a child, and our holiday was enjoyable and relaxing in every way. Reception: Very friendly, the staff welcomes you with a smile from the first moment. Room: Wonderful and clean, comfortable, and had everything we needed as a family.  animation Varied and professional, the teams put in a lot of effort to entertain both adults and children. Restaurant: More than excellent! The food was very, very diverse, and the flavors were amazing — something for every taste. The place: It has the authentic spirit of Djerba; you feel like you’re living in the heart of local culture and tradition. Bar: Good in terms of quality, but unfortunately, the staff were not friendly …  this was the only disappointing part.

The animators they are top, nothing to say always smiling and listening to the holidaymakers, the rooms are very clean. All the hotel employees always smiling. They are listening to our expectations, the animations All suits us very nice context pool

The new facilitators are young, but they're great. They do their best to make the stay as pleasant as possible. Many nationalities are represented here. The rooms are very clean Every night there is a different event.

reviews.review_title: Great hotel. The stay went very well.
reviews.review_text: I want to recommend the hotel, great atmosphere super holiday animator that I recommend . the rooms are very comfortable. Lots of animation everyone is listening I will come back very soon. I recommend it.😍

name: Hotel Royal Jinene & Jinene
description: Hotel Jinene Beach located between Sousse city and Port El kantaoui Rooms with air conditioning..Bathroom..Telephone..TV..Balcony..Sea view or garden view..Restaurant..Bars..Pizzeria..Moorish cafe..Beach bar.. Open-air swimming pool..Indoor heated pool..Mini club..Playground area for children..Tennis court..Mini golf..Spa center.Entertainment team..Read more
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_text: Absolutely loved this place best part was meeting mino. He made the holiday perfect for us even dressed up as Spider-Man for my sons 18th birthday he was so much fun always had an activity for us to do day and night we luv Mino can wait to see him again. Rooms were very clean maid service everyday and she was lovely too. Only thing I would change is a different selection of food it just was the same all the time. Was very tasty. Highly recommend this hotlel

staff is so friendly. Children’s entertainment staff are the best Kouda  Syylou  panda sabwuy so good with keeping the kiddy’s entertained. I will definitely return the hotel staff is so friendly place is so clean food is excellent love it xx

The best part about our holiday has to be the entertainment staff - all of them was absolutely amazing they made it the best holiday we could ever wish for they made it fun and exciting and taught us so many games and dances…   Islem - is so sweet and kind and enthusiastic  Akauda - is funny and kind and always happy to be involved  Subway - always up for fun and is apparently brilliant at basketball seems he beat me in a game ;)  Aladdin always brought The music and the vibes and was so sweet to take us out into the town and kept us safe  Chef was amazing and sweet and always made time for us and made sure we were happy!!   Out of the whole holiday these are the staff members who made our holiday great!! So happy to have met them! Thank you to all of you for making it the best experience 🤍

I had a great stay at this great location. Great welcome! The animation team is on top, the PANDA animation manager is great! The whole team is smiling and available to make you have a good stay. The hotel is clean and well maintained, the buffet complete and tasty. The hotel offers direct access to the beach and a small paillote for a cocktail with sea views. I highly recommend!

I spent 7 wonderful days at the Royal Jinene Hotel. The food was really excellent and the room and pool clean. the animation was very great and entertaining.....a big thank you to all the animation team and a special thank you to kouda

reviews.review_title: Good resort staffed by lovely people.
reviews.review_text: My partner and I spent a week at the Royal Jinene Hotel in Late April/Early May 2025. Sousse is a fascinating town, the archaeological museum is not to be missed and the fort (Ribat) is also worth seeing. In the wider area, El Jem is also very much worth seeing. The hotel is fairly clean and there is a pretty broad range of food on offer. Beef is regularly served but (unsurprisingly) never pork. Egg is very widely used (even in pizzas). The beach is sandy and the hotel has both indoor and outdoor pools. The outdoor pool even has waterslides. The best aspect of the hotel is its staff who are friendly, helpful and kind. Some entertainments were provided at 21:00 in the evening. There was a quiz, karaoke, dancing etc.

reviews.review_title: Nice quiet hotel pleasant staff always helpful
reviews.review_text: Nice hotel we went in jan so not in season but staff are very helpful and hotel is clean, staff made my daughters birthday amazing big celebration we were very happy the manager helped with a cake for her and went out of there way to arrange it with me

Difficulty getting a double bed, reception to improve, the Hotel is mostly occupied by groups of gentlemen, smell of infective cleaning product, good location, 50 m from the beach, outdated decors, insufficient elevators we spend our time waiting for breakfast suitable for 2 nights after we are saturated,. Staff speak little French

I’m afraid this holiday was a disaster. The staff were lovely and very helpful but the hotel is very run down. Couldn’t sit in the bar area due to cigarette smoke so had to sit in the foyer. We were there for 7nights and 5 of those  ended in fights even to the extent that as new people arrived a fight broke out and they refused to stay at this hotel. Food was uninviting so although all inclusive we had to eat out every evening. Pool area never cleaned so sat on sun beds surrounded by fag butts and dirty tables. Don’t even get me started on the so called beauty & Spa. This was a joke. Will definitely go back to Tunisia as the people were lovely but I would recommend giving this hotel a wide birth until they sort the whole place out.

reviews.review_title: Cleanliness  and food were the downsides of this hotel
reviews.review_text: Cleanliness is not in the Tunisian vocabulary.. room ok at the beginning until we found last occupants clothes in wardrobe,what looked like bodily fluids of some description in the toilet walls and overall room clean was poor..The amount of staff wandering around you would think let's wash down sun loungers clean the pool area..nope.. food I understand will not be to everyone standard but again British tourists think a full English should be supplied at breakfast and burgers nuggets and chips for lunch and dinner..I found the food fine bar the fact it was all cold..even a pizza just out of the oven or whatever..all had to be nuked in microwave to gain some heat..staff are lovely and at night a good atmosphere although if you are out and about expect to be hounded with begging and on one occasion as I did not cough up I had stones lobbed at me from a distance of coursebut not what the Tunisian govt would want if they expect tourists but to be fair I wouldn't not stay here again it's just at least I'd know to bring my own bleach,hoover and cloths

reviews.review_title: I am not coming to this hotel again
reviews.review_text: The staff are friendly and that is the only thing  good about this hotel. I have never been to a hotel that the whole reception smells of cigarette smoke. My wife suffers from atsma and we could not enjoy an evening chill downstairs in the lounge. The food was cold and one day the rice tasted like left over from the day before. The sheets on the table were hardly changed and looking dirty. The bathroom shower cloth was full of mould and the AC was not working. The curtains in the room needs washing as we daw blood stain and the chairs and tables in the balcony needs cleaning in fact we had to request a room change and lost our sea view room which we paid for. The dining area needs an overhaul.  But as I said the staff are very friendly.

Staff were amazing. Very helpful,  friendly and informative.  Nino, chief animation (entertainment) was great. Reception staff very helpful. Food was lovely.  Would definitely go again. Great value for money. Tunisian vodka is a must 😉🍸🍹

All round good for the money.  Friendly and welcoming staff.  Rooms are good. Beds are comfortable.  Food is okay and fresh.  Facilities are good. Especially the bar.  Team leader of animation (Nino) is an excellent host. Great events such as Karaoke, live music and created an entertaining atmosphere throughout our stay.

reviews.review_title: Wasn’t terrible, actually had a great time. Clean, friendly staff and okay food. Good for the price
reviews.review_text: When I first booked and then I read the reviewed I dreaded this holiday I won’t lie. Me and my partner arrived and were pleasantly surprised. For what we paid we actually thought it was okay. Rooms were always clean and tidy, food was okay with some choice, breakfast we didn’t bother and a few had said it wasn’t great but I can’t comment. Staff couldn’t do enough for you, the evening entertainment was always a laugh. I have to say, there was never a dull day, it was a bit like an episode of eastenders with some of the guests, but everyone chats to everyone and it’s generally a friendly atmosphere. Don’t get me wrong, it’s not like the 4 and 5 stars were used too. But we would pay around £1200 each for that. We paid just under £400 total for 2 people and added on a case. I have to say for what we paid I really can’t complain.

Very good experience,amazing friendly staff in all sections, reception, restaurant, swimming pool bar, good food, lovely spa massage with reasonable price,cosy swimming pool and is by an amazing beach! Certainly a go back! Highly recommend!

name: Hotel Residence Mahmoud
description: Hotel Residence Mahmoud is an excellent choice for travelers visiting Hammamet, offering a family-friendly environment alongside many helpful amenities designed to enhance your stay. Rooms at Hotel Residence Mahmoud provide air conditioning, and guests can stay connected with free internet access. You can also enjoy an on-site restaurant while staying at Hotel Residence Mahmoud. Plus, during your trip, don't forget to check out an architectural building, such as George Sebastian Villa. Enjoy your stay in Hammamet!Read more

reviews.review_text: Extremely limited in food choice  Found chicken raw in the centre on first and only night we had dinner in the hotel Breakfast very limited and poor - hard bread , hard cheese every morning Rooms average and dated Fridge Broken in our Room Television had poor reception No WiFi in the Room , fault with Access Point,  No Pool as advertised  On-The Plus Side;   The Staff were very friendly and helpful given the circumstances This could be a lovely hotel if some thought and proper management was put into its running

Solo travelers honestly don’t… I travel quite a bit and was excited as a female I stuck out like a sore thumb understandably due to the culture etc.  The restaurant and bar are limited, no cocktails, relaxing beside the pool or beach.  The advertisement photo is deceiving as it’s really the most beautiful wall to look at in comparison to the rest of the hotel.  Restaurant and bar area is like an old man’s club dim, fill of smoke and smelly. The room was standard, clean sheets, vanity table and a wardrobe but outdated. The hotel needs a face lift. Also, it doesn’t not a beach as stated except an extremely busy road so be careful! If you intend in booking keep in mind this is no a family friendly hotel it’s anything but.  Finishing on a good point is the location it’s between Yasmin and Hammamet but you’ll need a taxi.

I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I stayed there for one night only during a fast passage. Considering the attractive price, I find the property good value for money. The room was clean, with simple but sufficient comfort for a short time. Too bad there is no wifi, but it remains acceptable. The breakfast, although not varied, is quite correct and satisfying. The staff is very welcoming and friendly. It is an ideal choice for a stopover or a short stay. Thank you.

Small Inn very nice and very nice..clean and green..typical Tunisian decoration..Heavy Breakfast and Very Affordable Awards..great restaurant..very well located near the sea and the city center..perfect for evenings or a weekend

reviews.review_title: Nice hotel, despite some areas for improvement
reviews.review_text: Nice and clean hotel, typical oriental decorations, spacious rooms, nice pool  Cons: far from the center, breakfast leaves much to be desired, no shower gel in the bathrooms, and inexpensive but low quality restaurant with very long service

Just come back from Residence Mahmoud Hammamet. Please don't book. This is not a good hotel. It is open to the public and the bar is open till early hours of the morning. Very noisy. We changed room 4 times for different reasons. My watch was taken on the 2nd day from our room. Some rooms do not have a safe and it was not explained that the safe is at reception. Food was awful we booked half board. We had to pay for water with our meals. Every evening you had an option of 3 choices and the same dessert every night water melon or honey melon. It says at the front of the hotel that there is security there isn't  wifi is difficult to get in most rooms. No entertainment as it states on the holiday advert. It also says there is a spa there is not. The pool was not very clean so keep your head above water. We all had stomach problems and had to buy medication. Please just book somewhere else.

A little gem. Cheap but surprisingly good value. A  quaint traditional feel in a good location. If you're looking for a great deal well this hotel offers just that. Breakfast was included although nothing special it was fine. Reception were friendly and although I had to change my room this was no problem. The manager was very helpful in changing my room. The food is reasonably priced and u can get service to the poolside which was great too. There's a friendly lifeguard and helpful restaurant staff there. The rooms are adequate some perhaps bigger and quieter than others so ask for a quiet room as some rooms overlook the restaurant/bar courtyard below which comes alive with young Tunisias at night. All in all a very good attractive hotel with an excellent price and great pool. 👍

reviews.review_title: Located in the tourist area with access to all services and close to shopping centers and supermarkets, etc.
reviews.review_text: The place is very nice and clean and close to all the destinations, the employees have excellent service, especially one who speaks Spanish, his name is Ahmed, the receptionist is very attentive and responsible in his advice, the food is very good, we will return, thank you 100/, recommended

Stay 10 days May 2024 Positive: you have everything nearby, store, cafe, restaurant, no need for transport, the residence is very clean, the mop is mopped 10 times a day, the staff is cordial, most of them helpful Except some who think they are I don't know who but...  Negative Limited breakfast no pastries just bread, tomatoes, cheese, jam, coffee luckily you have bakery and cafe next door... Far from the beach c the expedition to get there cross a road full of cars difficult to cross then take stairs then recross a road no pedestrian in short 10 minutes to get there c the weak point if you like the beach don't come here though if you like to party and drink this is the perfect place Bar for beer fans, lots of men, I don't recommend it for single women Or for 1 night or 2

The hotel is a 3-star hotel and the technical condition is satisfactory. However, they try very hard and it is very clean. On the plus side, despite arriving early, we got a room around 10 without having to wait for the day to start. There is an exchange office on site, you can exchange dollars, euros and also pounds, yen or francs and Danish crowns. They have their own piece of beach and 6-7 positions with sun loungers. There is a small swimming pool. There is a restaurant on the patio, good prices, pleasant and very large portions. Breakfast I read a lot of opinions that it was a roll with jam. Today, however, there was cold meat, eggs, white ricotta cheese. , jam, yogurts, baguette, cucumbers, tomatoes, plain and chocolate croissants, and sand cake. Coffee, tea, orange and peach juice, very nice service. The downside is that we have a room above the patio and it is very noisy at night until 2:00, there is music, voices, it is a lively restaurant. Considering the price - a very good choice

I been coming to Tunisia for 40 years and chanced on this hotel following a friends stay .The hotel is lovely rooms spotless food plenty and gorgeous . Can’t fault it good location very nice staff friendly welcoming don’t want to leave ...

We felt like at home. It's nice city Hotel with  great  hospitality. Stuff is really very friendly and helpful. We had nice room on the 3d floor with view on the green restaurant area, flags and sea. Food for dinner was delicious, breakfast food was boring. Rooms were cleaned every day, bed was decorated very nice way, but it was some dust on the furniture, there are put soap for us on the 4th day.  Hotel has excellent local, because it's on the main road and there is bus stop - buses to Tunisia, Yasmin Hammamet, Nubel and Medina are available. 2 roads needs to be crossed to go to the beach, it has sunbeds and sun umbrellas. Wather is  amazing  beautiful. I  recommend this hotel and definitely if I have a chance will visit again.

We've been to this hotel 15 days in September 2016. Im not first time in residence, and this is the place which I want to visit again and again! I'm staying there last two years, and I appreciate so much the development of the hotel. Many things are not changing and this is the positive side, many things changed in a good way and there is no negative side at all. For the people who just thinking to visit this hotel I wanna suggest you residence. The hotel is sittuated in a very good part of Hammamet, between the old center and not so far from Yasmine Hammamet. To get to the beach takes about 5 min by walk. Inside the hotel there is a small garden, pool and bar. Prices in the hotel not so big, I would notice that some things costs less then in other places. The food is really good, and tasty. The staff of the hotel is the best staff in the world! They are so kind, they can help you 24\7 and they made my stay really great!  Thanks to all the people who work in residence! We love you so much and hope to see you soon!

We are third time in this hotel, and each holiday here is amazing! Thanks to everyone who works here, who made our stay so great!  A few words about hotel this year. They made wi-fi in each room, reception bar and garden outside, the bar outside has place in the garden but now there is a new roof which can be open or closed (depends on weather). It made our stay more comfortbale, especially in the evening.  The food is as usual great, the rooms are very clean, outside is very clean. Everyone is so friendly and helped us everytime when we were need it.  Thank you so so so so so much! See you very soon! With love  Your Anna, Lisa and Alisa

We visited this Hotel ( My father and I ) a while ago , we made a reservation and agreed on the price .From the moment I walked in , the receptionist started picking fights with us for no reason , and we were on a 9 hours trip , I tried to explain to him the situation , that I am tired  and can I have my room please , he answered back by saying by saying that there's not any room and that I am being bossy , I explained to him  I am that  I am just tired , he then gave us a room that smells like garbage and was so dirty but we could not find any other place available so we stayed . Then he called us , screamed at us for forgetting to close the doors of our car ( my father is old and sometimes he forgets ) so I went down stairs and we argued about the whole situation . Thank God we were staying there for just one day . And by the way , they don't have enough food in the morning for everyone so must hurry or  you will end up with some bread from two nights before and expired butter .

reviews.review_title: One more amazing holiday in Hammamet
reviews.review_text: We were in Hammamet 2 weeks in August and just back. We are 2nd time in Residence Mahmoud and 17th times in Tunisia. I would like to say a big THANKS to the all staff and the owner of the hotel. Since 1st time there , we are like at home in residence. All stuff there work many years, so they make the atmosphere there.  In brief about residence: The hotel isn't new, but the owner repaired rooms, reception and bar inside the hotel, so the hotel looks very light, style and very clean. You can walk without shoes everywhere. The rooms aren't big but very comfortable, clean and light and there are no same rooms in the whole hotel.  About food: Food is great. they make food very tasty, and sometimes one portion is enough for 2 persons. You can have a lunch as in the hotel (the price is absolutely acceptable) as outside in the cafes. There are many cafes next to the hotel, so there is no problem to eat smth.  As I wrote before, the staff of the hotel is amazing, I love each of them, they were taking care about us and all guests, they are friendly and very cute. They made everything, that I wish going there back asap.  The beach is near the hotel, about 5-7 minutes by walk, there u can find chairs, plank beds or pillows as u like. By the way in the hotel there is a small pool, where u can also stay to have a sunbath if u are lazy to go to the sea.  In the end I would like to say thanks to Mahmoud and the all staff of the residence that they made our staying so great and see u soon, I hope.  Your faithfully Anna S.

name: Royal Thalassa Monastir
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_text: We arrived to a very windy and wet Monastir,however, the sun came out on the day on  Sunday .we found the staff extremely attentive ,The animation team, especially Tony ,Amin, and Momo , worked very hard  at keeping all of us moving. The food has got better as the big boss has been in to upgrade the standards and the ambience. It has definitely worked. Our main waiter, Mongi, was simply amazing, and so were the rest of the team, to be honest. The bar staff were very friendly.  The only downside is the accommodation is very tired, sorry. But this is the only criticism. However, they are clean and tidy.   Thanks for a great break, Royal Thalassa

very nice stuff , lovely food and delicious, loved the vibes , but weird thing when we arrived to the hotel an animation guy called toni or roni something like that told us to not talk a lot to the bartenders and the workers in general . i was shocked why all of that hate . they work in the same place just why , i discovered that the bartenders are good ones . anyway our room is always clean also the service is good .we enjoyed

The drinks and service are amazing and especially the staff! There is a very nice animation team member named tony! He hosts things at 9pm in the conference every night and they are all fun. Ranging from dancers to quizes!!! The rooms are perfect aswell and clean. Overall a perfect hotel

reviews.review_title: Great place if you want to stay

If you tell them no they accept it and move on , special mention to Tony what a man he is , also anime and mono are great :) doussa on guest relations is great fun and always stopped for a chat AYE  and yuseff in main buffet area was a fantastic waiter always had my table ready , anwar in the bar and the young boy on the beach bar where also great at topping up drinks. My only negative is I had to take my paperwork to the gym daily which was an absolute hassle . This should be free . I have stayed here twice now and with your staff being so good I would come back again . A little tip goes a long way in this hotel , anyone reading reviews it’s not five star you are absolutely correct but you don’t pay five star prices either .! reviews.review_title: Beautiful hotel that I highly recommend
reviews.review_text: First of all being a small group tour operator myself and having worked with many operators and travel agencies for 8 years; I was very surprised by the negative reviews that do not correspond in any way to the reality of the hotel. The criticisms are unfounded. I am currently with my partner at the Royal Thalasso Monastir Hotel. The hotel is beautiful with a beautiful modern decoration and very nice.all the staff is kind and attentive. The service is impeccable on all levels. The rooms are comfortable and the cleaning is well done every day (with a small tip. , , you have all the attention). The setting is very nice and the outdoor pool is great, plus an indoor heated pool. The food is varied and delicious. There's really a choice. Fresh and pressed orange juice is offered. In other hotels, it is paid. The hotel offers a very peaceful setting for a relaxing holiday. It deserves these 5 stars by Tunisian standard. Special thanks to Mr chokri Atiri for his very warm welcome and for room 518 . Thank you very much. I highly recommend the Royal Thalasso Monastir. Make your own experience and beware of negative or misleading reviews. Mme Camaret Camille

reviews.review_title: Happy for the price we paid, expect 3 star and you’ll be fine!
reviews.review_text: Hotel room was large and clean- bathroom a little dated. 2x 1.5L water bottles replenished daily in the room. Walls are very thin and often woken by neighbors. Location- nothing near by, some water sports on the beach and a hotel further down with a shop inside. Take cash to change for dinar- won’t do this with card.  Pool area was nice, pool kept clean. Always enough sunbed both at the pool and the beach.  Animation team are lovely, always trying to get you involved however if you’re not interested do soon get the picture and leave you alone. Pool/beach bars didn’t have the largest selection of alcohol but we don’t drink much so wasn’t an issue for us. Soft drinks were branded, latte was nice.  Food was repetitive like most all inclusive however we always found something to eat and didn’t go hungry. Drinks were waiter service at lunch and dinner, again staff really helpful and always keeping drinks topped up. Staff were all very attentive, polite and always happy to help. We visited the spa for access only which was relaxing which cost about £25 for two people.  We went as a couple and wasn’t much entertainment for kids however this may be different in the school holidays. Some reviews are very negative on here but for the price we paid we did not expect the 5 star luxury we’ve had before where we have paid a 5 star price. If you remember that you won’t go far wrong, we had hot sunny weather, relaxed by a pool and didn’t have to cook and clean for a week for a very low price! So I can’t complain! We would return for a cheap week in the sun!

Poor.
