reviews.review_text: Great hotel, met some great people but food and drink are very inadequate most of the food was inedible to our party it was either cold, full of bones or just plain disgusting apart from the cakes they were fantastic and choice was terrible and brits aren't catered for as for outside Beirut is prettier than mahdia as soon as I stepped out of a taxi near the medina I was accosted by yet another scamming beg thinking I was his meal ticket then what we were told was a lovely walk up around the cemetery and fort was a disgrace flea ridden cats everywhere accompanied by rubbish dumped everywhere and to to our disgust I thought Muslims respected they're dead only to discover the cemetery was the local fly tipping site never ever again

Terrible hotel I would say 2stars, food cold , plane, no taste. Drinks serving in plastic cups disgusting have a coffee or tea in paper cup. Everything is old has horrible smell in room and towels yellow , was white long time ago. Very poor hotel. Be avoid!!!

I arrive on December 20, good welcome , spacious room, attentive staff , varied meals , very nice decoration throughout the hotel , for Christmas very good meal friendly atmosphere , very nice show of the animation team .I look forward to New Year's Eve

reviews.review_title: Where not to stay in Tunisia
reviews.review_text: Avoid, avoid, avoid at all costs. This hotel is advertised as a 5 star, I would give 2 stars if it is lucky! Also stated it is 30 minutes from the airport, well it is at least 4 hours. Have stayed around the world in several 4/5 star all inclusive hotels and some are not so good as others, accepted. But this place… We are on holidays, we work hard all the year round and enjoy good wine and food. Drinks are served in plastic glasses, they are warm and not nice. So if you get the last glass of wine in the bottle around 22:00, they say “it’s gone “ and won’t open any more!! We did pay for all inclusive, but it is just not delivered. In the bathroom, there are holders for toothbrush cups etc, but no cups!! Food is average, well below average. The a la carte restaurant (there is only one, but advertised at three) is open three nights a week and the lovely restaurant manager Mr Mourani or something made sure we were booked in every time. Also this hotel is advertised as “ in the heart of the new tourist area”. Well, outside and for the walkable distance, is just wasteland and roaming dogs and a few restaurants. Please note, if you like to walk and stop at a bar for a beer, they do not serve any alcohol whatsoever outside the hotel. Our air conditioning stopped working first day and we reported it at reception and he told us “all stops in October “. Blatant lie as our room cleaner fixed it. Also it was remarked by a group of young Tunisian men in one of the cafes, that I was not wearing a hijab.  Top tip, bribe the bar staff, give them £10 at the start of your holiday and you will get real glasses and slightly better drinks.  Even better tip, DONT GO!!!

This Hotel is at best a 3 star. Run down rooms , damp beds fit for the dump, old broken furniture and peeling damp paint. Corridors with leaking roofs and mats to soak up wet. Wild dogs on the beach and staff that are not interested as season winds down. All inclusive do not bother as the Hotel will not provide it Evan though you pay for it. The hygiene of this Hotel is poor with guests getting sick, food standards and selection was the worst we have ever experienced in all our travels uneditable possibly the only all inclusive we have lost weight. The sunbed mattress were sticky and done the dinner mats in the restaurant unclean and The Entertainment more enthusiasm in a primary school play. The Hotel is 1hour and 40 minutes from airport in a bus that nearly cost us our lives with a dangerous driver on his phone all the time. I can not stress enough do not use this Hotel and believe me this is brief total waste of money.😡

reviews.review_title: Downgraded and senior management not receptive to guest improvement suggestions
reviews.review_text: In other hotels just don't swerve into this one! The reception on arrival totally overwhelmed, not even a page helps you bring the suitcases to the room. In the main restaurant there is no eye-catching, totally chaotic the table clearing/uncovering, food was not written to - ALLERGERS have the total look. The manager does not take care of the hotel areas at all, neither does they control them. After contact, the guest gets the impression that the guest is annoying!  The manager is also not receptive to small suggestions for improvement. Wi-Fi only in lobby area. The dishes are broken off - you can get injured here- is nevertheless offered to the guest every day again.  Even with a hotel that has become old, you can maintain the standard with daily checks, which has not been the case here for years.  It was only during an announced visit from the management level that the guests were able to experience the hustle and bustle of the day before. Since everything was then acutely cleaned on high polish, trimmed, swept, cleaned, covered, fixed - I would suggest to the hotel management times incognito check in there 2 days, then you can see it directly that the pretended quality is just sham! My rating: Don't go to this hotel, because you can spend your saved holiday money better elsewhere where quality is right!

We stayed here for 10 nights October 2024, the hotel is absolutely beautiful! Rooms are big with loads of storage and a beautiful balcony view!! The hotel has 2 pools & a kids pool, a spa, 2 bars and loads of activities included with the all inclusive. Such as football, volleyball, beach volleyball, darts, ping pong, pool, archery. People work on the beach directly outside for jet skis, boat trips and the hotel can organise excursions, we did quad biking and camel riding. The hotel is about 15 minute drive from Madhia city which is an absolutely gorgeous place. We also ate out 3/4 times and all nearby restaurants are amazing. The food in and out of the hotel was all beautiful, there’s loads of option and is served beautifully. The drinks menu in the hotel is slightly limited however they have most alcoholic drinks/ soft drinks. I definitely recommend asking the hotels photographer (they have 2) to take pictures and print them, we did and ours are beautiful. There isn’t an ATM at the hotel but one about 15 mins walk, however you can change currency in the hotel. There’s also 2 shops which have literally everything you could need on holiday! We had a shuttle transfer and it took about 31/2 hours so I do recommend getting a private transfer to save time. Other than the long transfer i cant say anything bad about this hotel, it’s absolutely beautiful with lovely people, good food and in a good location in Madhia. Will definitely be back next year!!

Firstly let me say the transfer was at least 4 hours from the airport that we flew into. Arrived at 5am in the morning after a quick check in we were taken to our room. When we got to the room we were pleasantly surprised we had a suite which was unexpected but a nice surprise. Room was lovely sea view couldn't have asked for more. The hotel was spotless the staff were friendly and helpful. The food well as a fussy eater myself I still managed to eat something everytime .The waiters were great cleaned tables very quickly fresh water on table at every meal. Would I go again yes but fly into a closer airport.

Really comfy beds, great staff, clean rooms and lovely pool.  Food is ok could do with more selection for English- beach is stunning and definitely worth getting up for the sunrise as its stunning! Would happily stay again - staff and locals are lovely

All staff from SPA were very friendly and kept hight standard of customer service. A dealer lady (Sameh) did a fantastic job by recomending which massage will suit to my preferences.  Personally I highly recommend a Jalila for massage. She is top one.

reviews.review_title: Great bust, not even worth 2 stars
reviews.review_text: The room was old, spoiled, with stained carpeting where you were afraid to walk barefoot on it (foot fungus). AC condensation dripped on carpet. There was initially no safe, which was then brought in afterwards and simply placed on the shelf of the wardrobe, brief briefing, that was it.  The food for breakfast & dinner was below average. Unlovingly presented and manufactured. Scoop dishes such as ragouts or goulash with bones on the meat, food, vegetables and side dishes were pushed cold from the kitchen (not hygienic with HACCP, food must be heated to at least 65°C, also in Tunisia) and only warmed in the edition !!!!. Every morning we had the same white bread, we had different in Tunisia. There wasn't even toast. For an omelette you had to wait in line for 20 minutes. The worst part was the placemats, disgusting. Absolutely unhygienic, dirty, because in the plastic net still the remains of the predecessor. From Friday to Sunday, the hotel was packed with locals, where we don't mind in principle, but the eating habits just made us shake our heads and feel uncomfortable. The food selection and preparation was also underground on those days. Hotel has a top location, beach, loungers and umbrella good. Pool is in need of renovation. Annimation not with passion. All in all a total bust, except top location and beach

We are here now and having the best time. For any doubters, forget the negative reviews, we absolutely love it. Rooms are adequate, food is good as are the drinks. Entertainment is fantastic and everyone of more than friendly. Still 7 days left and loving every minute. Well recommended.

2/3 things very good: the beach and pool as well as the entertainment team. Unlimited water bottles during the day  The rest very average, to put it simply: Dismal welcome on arrival at night (not even a glass of water for welcome after 2 hours bus) Very old bathroom Pool/beach bar staff and unpleasant deckchair (tipping only counts) Sunbeds booked very early in the morning (not allowed) Hall decoration and interior rather rustic / outdated) Internet very difficult to access (only from the lobby, in good weather) and impossible from the rooms Meals/buffet correct but cooks waiters not pleasant

5 Star Pension Very Big Scam  Pension to escape, where to start, restaurant ..... No choice (chicken, veal, beef) well spiced  Meal that is cold or very little warm No water and sometimes no glass, when we sometimes ask for water we do not have a very dry meal. Tables that are not cleared and sometimes eaten with the cart of dirty dishes. Belly ball when meal time arrives.  Rooms ..... Bed made as they can  1 shower towel for 2 (large lack of staff, respect for poor ladies) Beach Bar...... Non-existent and the waiter so friendly that we ended up not going there  The staff.... Lovely as a prison door but still some exceptions The only positive the bar inside, friendly, smiling And the Mr of security at the beach, exceptional because he is so kind, very kind.

name: Hotel Royal Tulip Korbous Bay Thalasso & Springs

reviews.review_title: We are very dissatisfied with our stay, far from the standards expected for a 5 star hotel.
reviews.review_text: We are very dissatisfied with our stay, far from the standards expected for a 5 star hotel.  No kettle or tap in the room. When we called the front desk, they checked twice looking in the room, instead of just apologizing. Not at all professional.  Few choices for dinner and breakfast. The spa pool was not clean. As for the view, it was very disappointing because of the outdoor pool, completely empty, when the weather was nice and we could have enjoyed it.  How can a 5-star hotel accommodate its guests with an empty pool, especially when it’s supposed to be the highlight of the property? The whole experiment was ruined.  Frankly, either you are a real 5-star hotel and you rise to the occasion, or you assume a 4- or 3-star rating. I don’t know who awards the stars in Tunisia, but clearly it’s not justified here.  We left very disappointed. One thing is certain: we will not come back.

An exceptional hotel! Fantastic facilities, great food and super friendly staff! The rooms are spacious and perfectly furnished and the food especially at the “Espardon” remarkably good! No wishes remain unfulfilled.

Sublime place by its landscape. But also by its incredible meals and services. Worthy of a 5 star. Successful welcome. Perfect room and bedding. Cleanliness impeccable. Sublime spa and treatment too. Very cute Moorish coffee. Only small downside despite our interest in the indoor pool we were mistakenly told that it was only possible from the spa and paid. So we didn't take advantage of it. What a shame!!

Various buffet, very good quality food, pleasant setting, calm, relaxation.  Staff with little care.  Stunning view. Exceptional location.  Suitable for childless couples and corporate groups. Experience Beautiful.

reviews.review_title: Ideal place to rest, recharge, and eat well
reviews.review_text: We are staying for the 3rd time in this hotel and I reconfirm that it is the perfect place to rest, recharge, and eat well (everything is too good). We would like to highlight the experience at the top at the Spa. I don't know where to start: Mrs. Mbarka with her warm welcome and very clear explanations, always listening with a smile; Ali at the reception who was very kind and kind; at the Hammam, Raja who is exceptional and who invests in her services without exhaustion. I also recommend its very soft and relaxing scrubs (A Must!). We also thank Hiba, Thouraya and Intidhar for the massages and very pro facials. Dr Haddad who was always available and very responsive. In general, all the staff of the hotel are very competent, not forgetting Mr Mohamed the head of the reception who was always listening to us by providing satisfactory answers to our needs. See you later!

Excellent hotel with an original location between the forest and the beach of Kourbous. A staff with little care as soon as we arrived at the hotel. The atmosphere is friendly and pleasant, and the restaurant offers a varied choice to satisfy all tastes.

A warm welcome from the whole team and exceptional quality services! We spent a weekend as a couple more than pleasant, and we expect to return very soon. Among the best hotels I have visited in Tunisia, if not the best.

This hotel is beautiful, surrounded by mountains on one side, the sea on the other, it is so nice and soothing,   The architecture of the hotel is beautiful,  The rooms are very nice, The staff is very welcoming, pleasant, attentive, always a little attention to please.  The buffet is very varied and very good.   The spa is a marvel, really very harmonious staff listening, and very professional always smiling , an unforgettable experience  This is my 2nd Experience and certainly not the Last Special thanks to Mr. Safouene for his professionalism.

Very nice hotel, in the over-the-top kind, on the hillside with great views. The staff is friendly and attentive. A special word for Chief Concierge, Mr. Hatem, precise and efficient. But there's one but: we don't sleep well. The mattress is incredibly hard, which is very surprising in a five-star hotel. In the early morning, we're ground and broken.  Another point: in the thermal pool, there is no ramp to descend into the basin. Since the water is cloudy because of mineral salts, we descend to the judge on rather slippery steps, which is not at all ideal. In the end, despite the beauty of the site and the kindness of the staff, a second stay is not at all certain.

reviews.review_title: Disappointing for a 5 star rating in this beautiful location!
reviews.review_text: Beautiful architecture, fairytale location between sea and mountain and seemingly quality thalasso center. Unfortunately the rest is deplorable for a 5 star! Very average rooms from the point of view of the quality of furnishings and facilities, service very far from that of a 5 star. Some anecdotes summarizing our stay: -Although the occupancy of the hotel is at its lowest and we are almost alone (less than a dozen rooms), we left the room at 9am and came back at 1:40pm: room not yet made. When we arrive no bottle of water in the room. At the restaurant for dinner, no olive oil and a rude waiter shouting in front of everyone: "I ALREADY TOLD HIM THERE WAS NO OLIVE OIL!" (the butler did what was necessary, sent him away and finally brought olive oil... In short, the hotel's amenities are not worth the room price at all, especially in this low season, when there are outlets that are closed, reduced staff but not at all well managed....

reviews.review_title: Stunning hotel for a romantic weekend
reviews.review_text: It's an amazing hotel. Very responsive staff, good service, spacious rooms. Choice of breakfast food for all tastes. Several a la carte restaurants in the hotel, with a wide selection of menus. Sensitive staff who are ready to fulfill your requests instantly. The spa center is 4 floors, with complexes at will, as well as a pool with water coming directly from the thermal spring.

This hotel is a great place. Between mountains and sea, the view is exceptional. A balance of good taste and creativity. A must for those who appreciate nature. Breakfast is of exceptional quality and variety of products.

We stayed at this hotel for a week and it was wonderful. The hotel is beautifully decorated and this from the front, located in a very quiet location with stunning views of the ocean.  The common areas and rooms are very clean, the staff is extremely kind, always a little attention to brighten up your day, everyone was really caring. The food is very good and the buffets are varied. The facilities are superb: swimming pools, spa, tennis...  We loved the quiet of this hotel but also the possibility to visit the cities of Tunis, Carthage, Sidi Boussaïd... located about 1 hour by car, to see!  The hotel also offers a 2h boat tour to get to the hot springs which we loved, the scenery is really beautiful and the sailors very friendly! I highly recommend this hotel for a perfect stay in Tunisia! Absolutely nothing wrong, everything was there and our expectations were more than met! Many thanks to all the staff and especially Hatem for his extreme kindness and availability! We hope to return very soon!

I am currently there l hotel is very quiet perfect for a perfect relaxation stay also room, staff, location, cleanliness.... the only downside the buffet total disappointment franchememt is not worthy of a luxury hotel to improve imperatively.

name: Vincci Dar Midoun
description: Finding an ideal family-friendly resort in Midoun does not have to be difficult. Welcome to Club Marmara Djerba Mare, a nice option for travelers like you.Nearby landmarks such as Jama Fadloud (Mosque) (2.6 mi) and Phare de Taguermess (Lighthouse) (3.0 mi) make Club Marmara Djerba Mare a great place to stay when visiting Midoun.Rooms at Club Marmara Djerba Mare provide air conditioning, a desk, and a seating area, and guests can stay connected with free wifi.You can also enjoy a pool and free breakfast while staying at Club Marmara Djerba Mare.Travelers looking for a place to eat close to Club Marmara Djerba Mare can head to Rachid et Sophie (0.6 mi), Les Palmiers Chez Neji et Catherine (0.7 mi), or Chez Chouchou (0.5 mi), all of which are within walking distance.During your visit, be sure to check out a popular park like Krokodilfarm Animalia, which is a short distance from the resort.Club Marmara Djerba Mare looks forward to welcoming you on your visit to Midoun.Read more
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_text: Perfect!!!! It's all there.  The hotel staff is exceptionally kind, kind and helpful. An animation team of extreme kindness, they offer us full of activities to entertain us and put us at ease. Special mention for my Chacha. Thank you all for your kindness. Soraya

disrespectful people in the hotel who move the towels if you dare to leave for 10 minutes, no good food at all (even when booking the restaurant), burnt food, not fresh... no kettle in the room, no coffee, nothing at all. Unpleasant staff with insistent animators or even harassers, disastrous stereotypical activities. Pros: spacious room, sufficiently maintained hotel

Hi is just want thanks the group entertainment the been absolutely amazing and well organised easy going they do plenty activity gym to dancing games etc  I want thanks one off them Mario been really good and friendly keep going and hope will see u again  Good service too

Enjoying  Reception top vincci servis was so good , animators is was very talkative and friendly i must come back to the hotel , food for everything it was , i was at the show with animators And i danced with them so it was amazing and good experience

reviews.review_title: It looks nice on the surface
reviews.review_text: The hotel's biggest asset is the beach. It's clean, beautiful, and close by. The rest leaves a lot to be desired... However, your position at the hotel depends on how often you visit and how much you tip. The animators like to use women for their own benefit. There's a lot of hypocrisy behind their charming smiles.

1st trip Djerba and probably the last.An island infested with plastic waste of all kinds.Regarding the hotel reception hall top we think that the rest will be the same and there total disappointment as soon as access to our room long corridors with windows, doors that date from another time and I do not even talk to you about filthy and stained carpets. We had 1 room garden view finally if we can say a vacant lot with excavator and piles of rubble.The restaurant at breakfast if you like stale bread, at lunch and dinner dishes that look like nothing without tastes and repetitive no worries and yet we are not difficult. The beach: not enough deckchairs and dirty. Swimming pool: logically no deckchair reservation but in the morning towels already installed so after 3 days without place you do the same thing. Bar: terrace too small for the number of people in the hotel. Hyper-sweet, untasteful, infectious cocktails. We didn't understand everything about this hotel, why a brand new padel court that must cost a small fortune that will serve very little instead of renovating the interiors and carpets???management is not making the right decisions and risks losing many customers if nothing is done to stay 4*  After all these criticisms, we salute the good humor, smiles and courage of all the staff: employees, cleaning lady, bartender, waiters at the bar and restaurant, receptionists, photographer (Fethi,Houssem,Karim,lorenzo...) Without them we would certainly have changed hotels.  I still have not understood the positive reviews and we are not on our 1st trip.

Perfect location on the seafront, the staff is really top, the buffet of the restaurant is really varied and beautiful very delicious I enjoyed that the buffet different evening at each meal, I chef is a genius! Animation team is great no difference for customers

Great for rest and good animation sympathy and good hospitality  Good to come back Good for family Good beach....good food  Animation 7 days a week helps to get to know a little gerba! 😆😆 Who likes has camels by the beach to take walks Beach 30 meters from the hotel 😆

I arrived at hotel 8.45pm and was greeted by a lovely man at reception called Havib. Was told that I could go straight to the restaurant to eat.  At the restaurant there was about 20 empty tables, the others were being used. One waiter seen me trying to find a table to use. I asked if I could use a table that wasn’t set up and he said ok. After collecting my food I came back to the same table was still not ready. So I sat and waited, and waited and ended up using my hands to eat! Waiter finally came over with cutlery. I was asked if I wanted a drink and I asked for cola zero..was abruptly told to go to the machine and get it…went to the drinks dispenser and there was no cola zero on tap.  I stayed in room 1439, room was dated, curtains were hanging down as part was detached from the rail. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. Food in the hotel was good, I particularly liked the Tunisian food.  As a regular visitor to Tunisia and as an ex holiday rep working and living in Tunisia for 3 years I was surprised that the animation team never even bothered to say a simple “hi” to me in the week that I was there. Maybe if I was a single woman then I might have been worthy of some acknowledgment. Having said that, the animation team seemed to work hard  Restaurant staff weren’t particularly friendly towards me but one Maitre d’ was kind an acknowledged my birthday and even came to find me when I left. They had a cake for me which I thought was very kind.  Reception totally ignored me once when I went to enquire about a transfer. Went back later and Habib sorted it. Habib was friendly and professional. If I had a business I’d employ him.  Pool area was lovely and so was the beach.  It was my first time in Djerba. Personally, I prefer Sousse and Port El Kantaoui

We had a great stay, the buffet was top lots of choices and very good. The staff is very attentive, excursions and leisure are also available. We were advised and guided throughout the stay by Fehti who was adorable. Makrem's bar was always smiling and pro. Only small downside of our stay, the bedding a little hard.

Very friendly welcome with attentive and available staff. Special mention to Fethi for his good advice and kindness. Very well located sea nearby and very nice exterior. Very pleasant stay. Various and quality meals.

After a stay of 8 days have left with many memories food very very well and diversified  Bartenders, waiters, housekeepers, managers and although people with smiles listening frankly super nice Not to mention our top photographers  Pass the views of very nice photos or Iris at top prices

Let's start with the positive: The animation team was very friendly and the setting is great.  Small souvenir shop near the hotel with very attractive prices! As for the negative:  It was not until a seminary arrived that we had a buffet worthy of the name. No choice at the all-you-can-eat buffet, no indication of the products offered, no fish, no local pastries, 2 local dishes that fight in a duel. No information on arrival regarding access to infrastructure (all inclusive/half board/free activities or not). We learned from being turned away at an activity/evening that it was only for members of the “Coralia Club” (we still don’t know what it is). Difference in treatment between all inclusive and half boarders and members of the Coralia Club. Restaurant and bar staff not at all pleasant (especially superiors). Difficult management of meals when there are people, tense flow at the level of dishes and service in the room (no glass, no water...).  The music is too loud by the pool and let’s not talk about the evening, we hear it in the rooms as if we were at the party.  Concerning the bedding much too hard (mattress / pillow). The broken shower curtain bar, it holds thanks to the sdb mirror. No air conditioning in the room just ventilation... No poolside bar or even a snack if a small dip is made in the afternoon (winter period apparently).  Regarding their wellness area, for the installation of polish, it is done as follows: we paint the nail as well as the entire finger then remove the surplus with a piece of wood. As for the massage, it was just a layer of oil that I was brushed with for 1 hour.  Anyway, once not twice.

The holiday on the island of Djerba was very nice the place fully met our expectations. Room very large and clean.The food at the hotel was varied and always fresh. The animation was always trying to entertain the guests.An animator Jasin even spoke German and tried to support the German guests. a great holiday unfortunately came to an end far too quickly.

Very good hotel with great animation, the rooms are clean and the staff is very welcoming as well as the animators who are adorable and do everything to make no one bored. The beach is beautiful and the pool too. We had a great week and will be back.

Honestly one of the best experiences... What a wonderful place to visit with family  The view was amazing The staff were super friendly and helpful  The food was delicious and the service was great  Thank you very much for everything we really had one of the best holidays and a special thanks to Mahmoud  for his recommendation and all the management...we surely will be back

Beautiful hotel, the staff and all the animators are at the little care with us, the food is at the top, the shows and entertainment are perfect for both children and adults I really recommend this hotel.

the team at the top...we had a great stay!!!!the superb beach!!!the welcome to the little care!!!!and the entertainment at the rendezvous!!!on it lend gladly because nina and the troupe are wonderful!!!!!the country is very welcoming!!!and cocktails nothing to say 💖💖💖💖💖💖

name: TMK Marine Beach By Turismark
description: TMK Marine Beach by Turismark is a haven of luxury on the idyllic island of Djerba, also known as the "African Caribbean". In a privileged seafront location, enjoy our private beach and exclusive sunbed and parasol service. There is a large sunbathing area with an outdoor adult pool, a children's pool and a relaxing heated indoor pool. Shops, pharmacy and bars are just 400 metres away. Discover the fantastic beaches of crystal clear water and golden sand on this beautiful island, while enjoying the comfort and charm of our hotel.Read more

reviews.review_title: I dont recommend coming in here its an expensive trap
reviews.review_text: No air conditioning, one bottle of water per day and you take it only 21:30, Bad internet connection, no parking spot for residents.  They always runoff wine its almost no all inclusif…………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………..

Returning to the TMK Marine Beach another time and the evolution is constantly an exceptional reception with Chef Ilyes and the whole team day and night who always find an answer to the requests addressed, a beautiful room seen on the sea, impeccable cleanliness every day the housekeepers pass and the governess watches over everything. The pools always clean with almost present lifeguards.A very active entertainment team with Tito, Momo mido and the versatile dj and a diverse program every day. a diverse cuisine with Tunisian and European specialties to choose from and waiters always present Saied and Hassine (except one in unsympathetic white shirt). Impeccable management and better every year. Thank you all and see you soon

We stayed in this establishment for a week, after the 3rd day we had to change rooms because too much problem in the 1st (778). The rooms are very poorly insulated, you can hear all the noises of the rooms next door especially the resonance of the hallway and the doors slammed. The infrastructure is old and poorly maintained. Unheated swimming pool, broken deckchairs, rusty table outside. Then for the unlimited buffet it's always the same, after a while it's tiring so at our own expense we left the establishment to eat in the restaurants that are next door (Gaia and the restaurant at the port of aghir). For the activities offered by the people of the central corridor it is a little expensive for what it is but the accompaniments are adorable. If you want to change your currency at the hotel, they only take cash and not with the CB. We had to find a vending machine because they told us to do it at the airport when we arrived but we arrived at 21:30, so everything was closed. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. The spa is suitable but poorly maintained. In fact the hotel is not a 4* but rather a 2* with sea views. Do not rely on photos especially the rooms because you will not have all the services indicated on the photos. This hotel has a big potential but really misused. We will not return to this property. Valentine and jessica

Very good value for money! The food is very good. The animation team is very friendly. The people at the front desk are friendly and helpful. The pool and the beach are close! Clean and spacious rooms. Everything is there for a good stay

We went with my friend to this beautiful hotel I recommend 1000%. The team welcomed us whether it was the cleaning, reception or catering staff. The breakfast and dinner buffet was very complete with a wide possibility of choice.  The room was very clean and the hotel is by the sea. I also wanted to thank our hotel tour guide: Ali baba. He showed professionalism from beginning to end and accompanied us throughout the stay. All the excursions were done with him and everything went very well. Thanks to him we had very nice taxis and who knew the history of the island well. I wanted to thank him for his kindness since even when we had problems (with our rental car) he was there to help us and follow us he was really our protector during this trip.  I therefore also recommend this 1000% guide.  Thanks again for everything.  Line and Fatma

reviews.review_title: Not very appealing to all types of people.
reviews.review_text: If you planning to come to relax think again, music on everywhere, people coming up to you asking different things a lot, If you also want to come to get away from some haram as a Muslim myself there is so much haram in this place it is hard to be there. From belly dancing half naked to people openly drinking alcohol it is frankly disgusting,  all is very uncomfortable. The animation people should be showing more Islam than not. The place is sub par and the service is unfaltered. The culture night which is every Thursday, if you are Muslim do NOT go. Haram everywhere.  All in all partially enjoyable as I met some good Algerian Muslim brothers and good people who where staying here.

The hotel is beautiful, with a large roofless space in the heart of the complex, and a long corridor overlooking the sea... The food was delicious, sometimes with homemade Tunisian pastries. A big thank you to our waiter Sayed Aloui who personally took care of us throughout the stay, and satisfied us with all his attention and superb decorations on the table , great mastery of napkin folding!  We will be back with great pleasure.  Delphine, Patrick, Thaïs

Clean and human-sized hotel  The room was clean and spacious with sea views and balcony  Very good food, thank you very much to the cooks and waiters of the restaurant and especially to sayed very nice and helpful and his little decorations on the tables made us very happy to my husband and I thank Nader & Priscilla.

Friendly hotel, comfortable rooms. The animation team is toooop!!!! Especially in Migo the best of the whole team. The food is to be reviewed on the other hand pity!!!! We will return to Djerba but not to this hotel  Stayed from 20 to 26 April 2025

Room very good and comfortable.  Restaurant good but too bad there are no local specialties.  The waiters are very caring, and in particular a big thank you to Sayed Aloui for his little touches.  Young and dynamic facilitators.

reviews.review_title: A good experience for a family stay.
reviews.review_text: We had a great stay at this hotel.  The rooms are spacious and the bedding is good quality.  The staff responsible for cleaning the rooms and common areas are smiling. The very dynamic and friendly animation team knows how to create a good atmosphere without excess and offer 2 animations per day. The cuisine is good and varied, young and old have found something to feast on.  A special mention for the table service staff, attentive and available mainly for our usual Sayed server which was attentive and very professional.

Hotel suitable for the price .food nothing to say not necessarily very varied but very good .big respect to the animation team always smiling and filled with energy available to guests small young or old frankly guaranteed atmosphere.the housekeepers amazing how nice and efficient they are I go out in the morning to buy me a pack of cigarettes I come back my room is made .the waiters a little slow but it goes .otherwise clean pool just a pip umbrellas without canvas so being big I hit myself so many times that I have traces of it so work to do urgently more lacks than canvases so incredible that it is not already settled .

Very good personal welcome super friendly and the animator are exceptional activities every day. As soon as a small problem arises it will be settled in the minute always smiling. The buffet is varied and of good quality.

reviews.review_title: Very satisfied festive and family atmosphere full of activities offered by Alibaba very friendly and smiling
reviews.review_text: Very friendly hotel nice cleanliness nothing to say staff very attentive professional animation team at the top very good dynamic and warm atmosphere  Very pleasant setting very good family and festive atmosphere  Very well connected near the center of djerba

Clean and quiet hotel, attentive staff, welcoming and adorable, entertainment team that always set the mood, plenty of activities to do outside and inside the hotel , several nice and beautiful places to visit, thanks to the whole hotel team

A great place!!! A director very supportive of his customers. Staff always welcoming and available..an animation team at the top! In permanent exchange with the customers... decent room , good meals .. in short, a great stay that I recommend to all tourists ... Philippe D

name: Hotel Dar El Bhar
description: If you’re looking for a romantic hotel in Playa Sidi Mehrez, look no further than Hotel Dar El Bhar.Guest rooms offer a minibar and air conditioning, and Hotel Dar El Bhar makes getting online easy as free wifi is available.You can also take advantage of some of the amenities offered by the hotel, including a 24 hour front desk, room service, and a concierge. In addition, guests can enjoy a pool and breakfast during their visit. As an added convenience, there is free parking available to guests.While you’re here, be sure to check out Sunset Beach Bar Djerba, one of the barbeque restaurants that can be found in Playa Sidi Mehrez, which is a short distance from Hotel Dar El Bhar.The staff at Hotel Dar El Bhar looks forward to serving you during your upcoming visit.Read more

reviews.review_text: This place was perfect, not a modern hotel, but very cozy and had everything for an enjoyable stay. The rooms are well maintained (and I could notice improvement being done) The best beach access (a highlight) and beautiful gardens with lots of birds. The service from all the staff was outstanding, specially from the fabulous manager (Nouel), she was awesome and always there to help and making sure all guests were having the best time… she knows how customer service works. kudos for her!   Love the ambience and breakfast was also enjoyable… the bread they make right in front of you was a highlight and delicious!   The pool area was tranquil and beautiful too (see video attached). I highly recommend this hotel for families, couples, friends or solo travelers, no regrets!!!

Very friendly and clean hotel. Nice vintage style. Great international breakfast and restaurant with quality food and very affordable menu. Highly recommended!  Staff very kind and helpful to the different needs of the guest.

The staff are so welcoming and ensured we had a lovely time. It felt like being in a family. The room was always cleaned and with nice touches. The beach is beautiful and just a few metres away. Delicious breakfast and optional disco in the bar each night. Also possible to eat more quietly in the restaurant. Easy to get a taxi to the local towns. Can’t recommend enough!

Everything was perfect, the hotel was quiet, clean, well located, the beach is nice.  The city center of Houmt Souk is not far, 10 dinars by taxi.   Possibility to do beautiful walks, I recommend this hotel as well as the island of Djerba.

Very nice Charming Pension , its location by the sea is exceptional, very well maintained. The staff is very pleasant and the manager is very attentive and very involved. I will soon return inchallah..  …………………………………..

Very good stay in this charming Pension, very welcoming staff, and kind, Naouel the director always kind and very attentive, I recommend this beautiful Pension. They just marked us Tunisian specialties in half board at night. Thank you.

We have been coming to this little Pension every summer for 13 years! With family and friends, we spend a relaxing holiday. The staff is very attentive! The view from the suites is amazing, the beach is beautiful, the sea is warm, the cuisine is good and generous! Special mention for Hassen, Rachid, Faiza... and members of the front desk and management. See you next year!  Ingrid, Manu and Victoria

I liked the architecture welcomes it from the staff too bad I had to leave. The hostess was just amazing 🤩. You can eat with your eyes closed the restaurant is qualitative and the place is safe. Too bad in the evening too much noise in the pool area.

reviews.review_title: Great experience at Dar El Bhar restaurant
reviews.review_text: The beach restaurant of the Dar El Bhar Inn is currently one of the best restaurants on the island of Djerba. Quality, Award, welcome and warm atmosphere, a terrace practically feet in the water. At the entrance, we offer different fish on a bed of ice, a very nice menu, I advise you to try the wolf fillet stuffed with salmon, exceptional... a killing!! Congratulations to the whole team, we must continue in this way!

Great reasonably sized hotel, close to the casino. Very welcome from all the staff, including the director, who advised us on visits to the island. Thanks also to the very friendly Hafedh who gave us good advice for the rest of our trip. Friendly bar with dj or live music depending on the evenings. Breakfast varied. Small negative: the spa, certainly cheap, but not at the level of other hotel services.

A great stay. A place where you feel good. Tranquility and comfort are very appreciated.  A warm staff, an accessible manager who always has a nice little words, attention to customers.  I highly recommend!

Stay at the top. I enjoyed the charm and quiet of the hotel. The food is excellent.The rooms are beautiful , well decorated The pool is nice and access to the beach and a big plus!  The staff is very dedicated , kind like their Director Naouel , who moved heaven and earth for a great stay. The Hassen server 🫶🏿

A very pleasant stay  Hotel up to all the comments we could read before booking our stay at any level (cleanliness, kindness, comfort, food, location feet in the sand!)  We have booked 2 standard double rooms for us and our children(teen) and the 2 rooms are spacious with comfortable bedding. There is swimming pool, restaurant, spa, and private beach with sunbed. Beach towel provided with deposit. The wifi connection is present everywhere up to the deckchairs on the beach!!!  It is a man-sized hotel where ALL the staff and manager have a kind word or attention to the guest. We feel that everything is put in place to satisfy the holidaymakers.    If you want to make visits, just ask at the reception and we call you a taxi!  If you want a holiday away from major hotel chains and find authenticity you are in the right place.

Pension clean warm, very nice and welcoming staff. Naouel the director very present, smiling helpful and listening to customers. Hassen waiter excellent, patient and smiling towards guests at the restaurant at lunch. Ali at night for half board at the top. Pool garden spacious and clean room and delicious meals to choose from. La thalasso very well and it is not cheap at all: do not hesitate to ask MOMO for your reservation and see the Awards with it. There are cute cats at the hotel that are vaccinated and very clean and also very cuddly. Jack Rachid is very helpful and available. The lifeguard Jasser is top and safety to the max in this charming hotel: hakim and Adam top and feel really safe in this hotel.

reviews.review_title: Find Djerba the sweet within this typical Pension
reviews.review_text: This Inn is charming and typical, far from the great impersonal complexes!  We are there feet in the water, turquoise and deliciously hot water.  The rooms all have a name, Borj Kastille was mine, and every day they are perfectly cleaned.  Two restaurants, one in the Pension and one on the beachfront terrace. Spicy dishes, delicious fish! I had a wonderful stay that makes me want to come back.  Thank you to the staff for her kindness and the manager for her always smiling welcome!

reviews.review_title: Five stars but watch out for your booking!
reviews.review_text: The hotel is highly recommended for its facilities, spectacular breakfast and beautiful beach which is practically in the garden. What you have to make sure if you book x mail is that when they answer that your reservation is confirmed, that the signatory puts their name and charge in the hotel. It happened that we arrived and our reservation had never been entered. I had all the emails I sent and they replied confirming my reservation but did not take them into account. Finally after a very bad time and several comings and goings with Fatma (manager who arrived later) sent our friendly couple to another hotel (which was higher category and whose difference they wanted to charge!) and we were able to stay there in the only room left available.  I have to admit that the manager who was that night and another gentleman whose names I don’t remember were extremely kind to us but I can’t say the same about Fatma, who can be very good at running a hotel but not for public relations with guests (her manners and shouts leave quite a lot to be desired). A little anecdote: as a gentleman for the bad time we were given dinner that night. They give us the menus and suddenly we see coming almost running to Fatma who looks at the maitre as an indication and he practically rips the cards from our hands, to give us another very poor one that had only a menu option. We feel totally untreated and humiliated!! If this unfortunate fact had not happened I could say that the hotel deserves five stars and obviously we will return!!!

Small hotel, far from the complexes, extremely well located (you come down from your room, and you are on the beach - you have to cross the sea). The staff takes great care of us.  An excellent memory, and A Marvelous Encounter.  This year, there has been real progress (especially in the kitchen).   A small hotel that shines.  Yvan

name: Dar Ya
description: Looking for a place to stay in Tunis? Then look no further than Dar Ya, a charming lodge that brings the best of Tunis to your doorstep.Dar Ya features a 24 hour front desk, a concierge, and baggage storage.Given the close proximity to Zitouna Mosque (3.0 mi), guests of Dar Ya can easily experience one of Tunis' most popular landmarks.During your visit, be sure to check out a popular Tunis shrimp restaurant such as Chez Slah, which is a short distance from Dar Ya.There is no shortage of things to do in the area, and there are several great attractions that are within walking distance of Dar Ya, including Medina of Tunis (0.3 mi), Bab El Bhar (0.5 mi), and Cathedral of St. Vincent de Paul (0.7 mi).We’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay at Dar Ya as you experience everything Tunis has to offer.Read more

reviews.review_text: Logistically perfect, at the entrance of the Medina from which you can move comfortably on foot to the main attractions of the center. Friendly and welcoming staff. Clean and comfortable rooms. Shared bathrooms quite clean. Hearty breakfast. Recommended

I spent three nights in this Hostel in the heart of Tunis Medina and I am extremely satisfied, I think I could not have asked for better! First of all the courtesy and extreme kindness of the staff, all the collaborators were really lovely with me, both giving me tips on how to move and local advice. Turning to the environment, it is very suggestive: it is a typical Tunisian house with decorated tiles and traditional furnishings. Very welcome also the breakfast, varied and plentiful, which allowed me to taste the typical Tunisian desserts! A place I would definitely recommend for a stay in Tunis.

A very cool accommodation, it is well located, even in the medina. Everything super clean. We stayed in a room with two beds and it was very spacious Good breakfast, with some typical things, but also the usual (bread, croissants, yogurt, milk, coffee). Staff friendly and helpful. Just lack air conditioning, it was too hot in the room.

reviews.review_title: Atmospheric accommodation in the Medina of Tunis
reviews.review_text: Dar Ya is a very nice, simple accommodation in the Medina. It is only a short distance from the souks and the large mosque. The accommodation has simple but nicely furnished rooms. Breakfast is served in the courtyard. Price and performance are in line with expectations. The staff are very friendly.

We had a wonderful stay in this guest house! (3 nights for us) A stunning space with an ideal location in the medina, with an accessible roof terrace that allows for beautiful views of the city. Excellent welcome with great kindness, always providing very good advice, whether for visiting the region or eating out. Breakfast with everything you need. The room we had was spacious and comfortable, no complaints about cleanliness, the same goes for the shared showers. We recommend this place to sleep without hesitation ;)

Super friendly helpful staff. Our room was large and spacious, opening out onto courtyard (bit noisy if you wanted to sleep in). Beautiful quirky traditional decor, great roof top views. Simple but generous buffet breakfast included. Bit hard to find but you get the hang of it. Recommend for people up for adventure and genuinely interested in Tunisia.

Fantastic Hostel Pension within the Medina of Tunis. Thank you so much Yousef & the team for all your assistance & going far beyond what is expected when travelling Solo. Early morning Airport transfer very much appreciated.

A traditional guest house inside the medina with a roof with views.   There's a central two tier courtyard with rooms around the outside and also a room on the roof.  Very friendly and highly recommended. I will be back.

reviews.review_title: Well located once you find it
reviews.review_text: This hostel offers a clean friendly safe place to stay within the Medina. Common areas are pleasant with local charm & old pictures of Tunis. Receptions staff is willing to assist with planning, & information. Breakfast buffet is not large but offers a variety. They also offer a 3 day/ 2 night trip to the South that is well priced and paced. I booked upon arrival (not sure in season if this would work) and left 2 days later. Enjoy!

Day Ya has a fantastic location which felt reasonably safe (important in the Medina) though women might be wary of walking around along at night- though this applies all over Tunis really.   Lovely tiles and courtyard- look at the pictures, exellent staff who speak good English and are very helpful and genuinely nice. There is a great rooftop and a guest kitchen which is helpful to have (though not well equipped or used.   It is a hostel though, so its basic. The rooms are around a coatyard so it can get noisy- my friend had a crying baby in room next door which made it hard to sleep.  Internet is patchy. And weirdly in such a coffee drinking country the breakfast (otherwise good) had instant coffee which is frustrating....I hate instant coffee!  But the real deal is that it is the only cheap hotel in the Medina, the local area is friendly and untouristy, and if you stay there you are immersed in real old Tunis which is worth a lot in my book.

we stayed at dar ya for 3 nights and it was really good. the room was clean and comfortable. there was a kitchen for cooking if anybody want. hot shower and clean toilets. and they were really really kind.

It’s in a beautiful building with nice open spaces and roof top, good size rooms, very clean ,helpful & friendly staff, and a super breakfast. The location is also good within the Medina ...easy to shop, roam, and return

Amazing experiance, Staff were helpful and even organised trip to Sahara. You can ask one of the guys at reception he can help. They can also direct you with local transport, which is a must try. Everything is nearby the souls and medina. Rooms have air con on top floor with wifi. Felt like home

I stayed here four nights and could not have been happier. Staying in the medina is terrific, both for sightseeing during the day and also for going for pleasant walks and cheap bites to eat at night). It is well inside the medina but located in a place that makes it easy to find. The staff are super nice and helpful and accommodating. My room was comfortable, the (shared) bathrooms are clean, there is hot water, and breakfast is big and good. I would definitely recommend it. Great value.

reviews.review_title: Just what you are hoping for
reviews.review_text: This is everything that my last Medina Dar was not.  If you are looking for somewhere traditional, pretty and of-it’s-place, then stay here. If you are in need of a Corby Trouser Press then go and stay in the French bit... and doesn’t expect it to be up to your standards.  This is a two star place but the best among all. You’ll share your shower but with few others. The place is clean, and interesting but most of all the people are friendly.  However.  Are sure you know why you are coming to Tunis. It isn’t tourist-orientated yet. I saw few other foreigners.

Our group was comprised of four mature women who were there to teach at an English camp for a week. We were there in early July and the heat was what one might expect in Tunisia at that time of year: HOT!  Dar Ya was a really great experience.   Our room was on the first floor, and there was no AC. This traditional style Tunisian home had no windows to the outside so we relied heavily on the fan in our room. I had also brought a small personal fan which I'd recommend. There was another group of 10 teenagers and leaders staying there at the same time, and they had 2 rooms upstairs, one with an AC unit.   There were two showers, two sinks, and about 5 toilets which were shared with the other first floor guests.  They were cleaned each morning and everything was well-maintained.   The morning breakfast was really great and offered hard boiled eggs, sliced tomatoes and cucumbers, pastries, yogurt, coffee and tea served on beautiful Tunisian pottery. The staff are so accommodating and when the gentleman who set up the daily breakfast realized we had an early flight, he made sure we had coffee and pastries.   As someone else stated, the lighting in our room was rather dim, but we made it work. Also, WiFi was available for free, but rather weak. I'd definitely stay there again. It was a great location and felt very safe.

reviews.review_title: A traditional house in a great location
reviews.review_text: The hostel itself is a beautiful house with ceramics on the inside and a traditional courtyard. It is less than 5 minutes away from the center of the Médina. The room was cosy and a locked closet was available. The breakfast was really good and offered a variety of options both foreign and Tunisian. The internet was slow but still functional. The staff was extremely helpful, they picked me up from the taxi since it is quite hard for cars to access and dropped me off to the closest place where I could find a taxi after I checked out. They give me a lot of advice on what is around.  Safe and nice for girls traveling alone (my case). It was also really nice to get the chance to talk to the staff about life in Tunisia especially with Hamza, thank you for everything :)

It was a lovely place, located inside the old City, traditional Tunisian house, nice stuff. I recommend it if you're backbag traveler, the shower was good hot water, the breakfast was nice, the people here so nice. And I'm looking forward to visit this place again.

When I arrived the front desk man (Bashear) walked out to greet me at my taxi. (Your taxi can't drive to the front door, street is too narrow). As I checked in he got me a map of the medina and marked out good places to eat and how to get around. The owner (I think) doesn't speak English and my grade 8 French is weak to say the least, was so nice as well. When I was checking out he grabbed my big backpack and carried it 2or 3 blocks to get me a cab to the train station. The room was clean and the breakfast was amazing, I recommend getting up early at least one day to enjoy the fresh pastries while they are warm.

reviews.review_text: What I found best in Djerba was the sea, the meals and the service. Apart from that, it was a disappointment. The Abreu Agency did not tell me that the journey from the airport/hotel took 1 hour, with 7 stops in different hotels. A 2:30h trip leaving Lisbon took one night, including check-in and return will be the same. The Palm Azur Hotel is not recommended for children. The air conditioning only works from June. Another failure of the Abreu Agency because temperatures of 37 degrees were recorded.

To celebrate 2 birthdays, we went to Djerba, in a group of friends.  What a great welcome and an unforgettable stay. Everything was perfect, from services to entertainment.  The animators are hyper dynamic and always try to please us.  Regarding the restaurant part it was perfect. Very varied and very good food. Not necessarily just Tunisian dishes.  A huge thank you to Farid who allowed us to spend an exceptional anniversary evening that we will not soon forget. A man of great heart and care.  There will still be 2 small downsides: evening entertainment stopped way too early, probably because we were not in high season, and then the Quad exit proposed to the hotel which will have been disappointing because we will have only made road and an unnecessary stop of 15 min for je ne sais quoi. It would have been better to warn us that it was mostly a walk which would have been less frustrating for some of us who wanted a little sensations on beautiful tracks.  Mahmoud listened to us and made us beautiful proposals for our stay to be most pleasant. Thanks also to Faten who advised us well for the visits. reviews.review_title: This place is created by people with passion
reviews.review_text: Hotel Palm Azur is the perfect place for complete relaxation, both for the lazy one, lying on a lounger by the pool or on a beautiful beach sipping delicious drinks, and for the active one, thanks to the best team of Animators. It is thanks to the Animators that you can't get bored there! Games, fun, competitions, sports. Special thanks to Jimmy! He is a walking volcano of energy, he is everywhere, always smiling and very helpful. He will calm you down during morning yoga and stretching sessions or while playing mini golf and will give you a good workout during a game of beach volleyball or aqua fitness. What the whole team of Animators does in the evening is a real bomb! They can liven up and get literally everyone dancing! Great dancers, energetic, full of passion, spontaneous. It is wonderful to watch them. Energy, energy and more energy! The food is delicious, varied and the restaurant staff is very nice and smiling. The rooms are clean, spacious and atmospheric. The area is quiet. But it is thanks to the Animators Jimmy, Maja, Zizu, Mimo, Alex, Kaito and Mimi that I will definitely come back there! They are the main ones who create this place!

I recommend the hotel, delicious food, wonderful pool. Wonderful people who work there, special thanks to Jimmy and his team for making our time there pleasant. Very positive people. Quiet area near the hotel. Rooms very clean, hotel well-kept. I will definitely go back there

reviews.review_title: I like this hotel and I will come again!
reviews.review_text: Great hotel for families, daily animations, very nice atmosphere. This is my first time on Djerba and I like it very much. People here are great and always smiling. The best animators Zizo, ,mimo, kayta, jimmy, smayli and the boss dido 😍🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰

reviews.review_title: Week at Djerba in Club Palm Azur
reviews.review_text: I'm on djerba for the second time, at the hotel also for the second time and it didn't disappoint me in every respect, smiley is always smiling, he invites you to help, and entertains. Mimiu is a great animator and they squeal great music. I can say the same about Keita, Jimmy, Zuzi, Maya and the main animator Dudu are great at what they do. I heartfeltly recommend.

reviews.review_title: Our beautiful week at the Club Palm Azur
reviews.review_text: We have just returned from a week in the sun at the Palm Azur, and our stay was stunning!   The hotel was clean and tidy, the food was plentiful with a good choice on most days, and the beach was just at the foot of the hotel.  A special watch out for the spa, we experienced massages by a lady who was clearly not trained, and therefore had bruises for the next two days - this is a bit we would miss out when we visit again.  The room was cleaned everyday without fail, and the service is impeccable.  The reason why we have given it 4 out of five stars is just the few things that were lacking - no chips in sight all week (which is survival food for an all inclusive), the a la carte restaurant didn’t have a menu, or take any dietary requirements into consideration or offer alternatives, a huge deposit needed for an iron, a kettle in the room but no tea making facilities, and all-inclusive hotel, but no drinks in the fridge, these small things would have made our trip exceptional.  Our highlight was absolutely the entertainment team who were excellent, every day there was heaps of activities around the pool and the evening entertainment kept us busy!   A special shout out to Zizu, Mimo and Jamie who added that extra touch of ‘special’ and kept the smiles coming all day - thank you all, you topped our holiday and we can’t wait to re-visit - mainly because of you!

reviews.review_title: My best second time on Djerba
reviews.review_text: Guys from animation they are the best staff in my life  They doing maximum for your fun and for spending time good. We have the best shows and activities during the vacations  Thanks to Maya, Mimo, Jimmy, Mimi, Kaita, Smiley and Zizo❤️ And to Big Boss Dido🤝

reviews.review_text: The animation team are tres Bien!! They are all so friendly n bring cheer to the hotel n pool even on windy days!  The team really do entertain everyone individually!!!aqua gym gymnastyq volley ball petanque everything is good rio Nutella abdell shipo momo

Just about to leave from a week at Sidi Mansour. We got a very cheap deal so our expectations were not too high but have to say, was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is a little tired and the rooms are very basic (no kettle!!) but everything was very clean. The pool area is fabulous and quite picturesque and seeing as most days were spent around the pool for us, this was a big plus.  The food isn’t amazing but we did manage to eat at every meal with no major issues. The salads are amazing! The waiters and bar staff  are all very pleasant and eager to fill up your wine glasses at every opportunity 😂 Now onto the entertainment team. Our holiday would simply not have been the same if it hadn’t been for the efforts from this amazing young team. They work tirelessly from morning until early hours and always have a smile on their faces. They obviously are asking people to get involved in their activities but I would never have said that they ‘pestered’. I generally didn’t join in with a lot of the activities but would get asked and as soon as I said no, they left me alone. I really can’t stress how much they made our holiday. All of the team were amazing but a special mention for Tweety, Inzo and Chris ( not their real names) 😂 who really went above and beyond to bring enjoyment to our days!  All in all, a fabulous mixture of relaxed and activity filled holiday, met some great people and would definitely return for the cost!

The hotel itself is a little tired, in need of refurbishment. The rooms are basic and somewhat dated but clean and comfortable. We had paid for a garden view room but the manager upgraded us to a pool/sea view room on the day we arrived which was great until we realised we were above the bar so it was quite noisy at night - and first thing in the morning when the cleaners started work!  Food in the restaurant is ok - not the best for my British taste (no cereal at breakfast for example) but it’s varied so there was always something I could find to enjoy.   All the staff are friendly and welcoming, from the bar staff, waiters,  reception and  cleaners.   This holiday was nowhere near perfect but, for the price we paid, was really good value for money. There’s not a lot to do outside of the hotel but we’d only come for a week in the sun and the weather was perfect for sunbathing round the pool - which is immaculately clean and a lovely space to relax in. The music can be quite loud, except between 12 and 3, but we enjoyed it although others didn’t.   What made this holiday great for us was the animation team - they work really hard to include as many guests as possible in the games from first thing in the morning until last thing at night. They are all characters and are friendly to everyone. A special mention has to go to Criss, Inzo, Abdul, Mario, Nutella and Steve - what a team!  We had particular fun with the newest members of the team, Tweety, who wore some outrageous fancy dress costumes every day and made us laugh with his antics. His name should be Cheeky because he’s certainly that!  The hotel would not be the same without this team of young people working hard to make the guests time enjoyable. Thank you guys.   All in all, we had a lovely holiday. You know the saying ‘you get what you pay for’ and we didn’t have high expectations for what the holiday cost - but our expectations were exceeded, by the friendliness of everyone at the hotel and, despite its shortcomings, I would recommend this as a destination.

Clean hotel with a great view from our balcony food hasn’t been the best for us the animations team go above and beyond I really enjoyed water polo with one of the animators mr tweeti is by far the best on that team he would be the reason for my return  The weather was beautiful reaching 36 degrees and the staff were pleasant and polite we believe that the animation team make the hotel what it is thank you for a nice stay

Animation team they are good and every night they do animation and party it's a very nice hotel and i will come back in the future thanks to the reception and animation (criss and twiwti) thanks a lot really The bar is very nice and the reception is good. On Fridays they have a unique Tunisian evening. The decor is special.

I had a great time at the Hotel Sidi Mansour. The animation team was on top from start to finish: dynamic, smiling and always to entertain us. Thank you for the atmosphere and the good memories! I highly recommend it. 10/10

reviews.review_title: It's just great happiness to be here
reviews.review_text: Superb atmosphere with the animators at the top the petsonnel super nice with us listening to the care to us to start again very well meals very good very diverse clean in addition very beautiful picine and garden really beautiful setting I would come back

The animation team very well Nice show in the evening Except the room no air conditioning The window door very difficult to open Very nice staff Good and varied restaurant  Pleasant stay  Good photographers  The staff is at your disposal Game of pétanque gymn

L, animation team at the top of the sun in hearts than happiness a little problem arriving in our room a short circuit more electricity l,home super cleaning ok only one inconvenience to get in the bathtub you have to have big legs hihi apart from that everything is fine

The hotel is in need of some refurbishment but the rooms were clean and serviceable. On the whole the food was acceptable but not very varied however there was always something acceptable to eat. On the subject of the animation team !................ loud, intrusive and seemingly unable to take no for an answer, repetitive loud music around the pool area, constant harassment to join in the "fun", impossible to enjoy a quiet drink in the bar at night. On the subject of the beach - it is reached by walking down a road alongside a wall topped with broken glass, little strewn with thousands of empty plastic bottle scattered around along with other indescribable bags of stinking rubbish! Not forgetting the homeless encampments along the way. The area around the beach can only be described as a "bombsite" devoid of vegetation and appeared to have been used as a dumping ground for unwanted rubbish. On my visit I encountered a discarded settee, two microwaves and various items of broken furniture, The bar at the Beach is NOT all inclusive and only soft drinks are provided - alcohol is payable. Overall I understand you get what you pay for but the surrounds of the hotel do not inspire. Very few British people in the hotel and all feeling somewhat disillusioned. On a more positive note the bartenders in the Hotel provided excellent customer service and could not be faulted. If you want a holiday where you remain within the hotel around the pool and like to participate in repetative activities and the same in the bar in the evenings then this is the hotel for you if on a budget - otherwise STAY WELL CLEAR.

My mum and I stayed at this hotel for a week in May and, despite being a bit rough around the edges, we had a great time and would definitely return.  Depending on when you go, there are not many English people in the hotel. This wasn't an issue for us at all and was something we were aware of because we had researched the hotel before booking. Every guest we met was lovely and we had no problems. If you want a hotel that is full of English people then this probably isn't the one for you.   We originally booked this hotel based on the reviews of the animation team, and they didn't disappoint. The whole team work incredibly hard both day and night to make sure everyone has fun, I didn't find them to be too pushy. They are an absolute credit to the hotel and were the highlight of our holiday.  The food was great while we were there. Although there is a small selection at each meal and sometimes it can feel repetitive, the actual quality of the food that was there was great and I never had a single meal that I didn't enjoy. There was always some form of rice and potato on offer so I think even fussy eaters would be fine. The drinks are ok, although there is limited choice in the main restaurant which is a shame.  There were a few small things that weren't perfect, we experienced water outages twice in the week we there, we had a tile fall off of our bath and often our 'clean' bath towels were stained and discoloured. You also have to pay a deposit to get towels for the pool and for a safe in the room, but this is not a massive issue. The beach wasn't the best, but we spent most of our time around the pool anyway. We weren't given any information when we checked in which is an area I think needs to be improved.   Overall, for the price paid, it was more than worth it. Good rooms, good service, great entertainment.

Not the best to be honest,  cheap and not particularly cheerful,  not recommend for people from the UK, The entertainment  was  not good ,the music was so loud when people just want to relax , I saw a couple of the animation teams shows which consisted of dancing!!! Nothing to do in the area very quite.

reviews.review_text: Stayed at this property with Gate 1/Discovery Tours.  Each room is a free standing villa.  Room 1 is the closest one to the main building. Bathroom has a free standing tub.  Mini bar with soft drinks included. Bed was very comfortable, pillows were not.  Lots of outlets and ubs ports.    Budget dinner was ok;  hot & cold salads with a lot of tuna.  Breakfast buffet had good choices and an egg station.  Staff very good.

LA VILLA BLEUE opens its doors to a unique world where every detail tells a storyRead more

reviews.review_text: This hotel lacks a lot, the infrastructure in the area is horrible with old cobblestones making it extremely dangerous in the dark, the hotel doesn't have a luggage service, buses can't get there, you have to walk and they don't have any porters, many stairs making it very hard for people with reduced mobility or the elderly ones, breakfast is very basic and you have to pay extra for an omelette and you can't order food after 9pm.

A very pleasant welcome, a splendid villa, a beautiful tasteful decoration, furniture, objects, works hanging on the walls, bouquets of flowers , you feel very good in this house. Superb views. The icing on the cake, the room la Tourelle with its view and terrace at 180 * .

First the view is really great and also the staff very nice. However, the ladies and the elderly gentleman at the reception very unfriendly. The hotel is said to have 5 stars, which we find absolutely exaggerated. You had to balance your bags yourself from the car to the hotel and from the room up the stairs back to the reception. Sorry, but you can't do that. Breakfast is a joke for a 5 star hotel. A cappuccino or a few scrambled eggs, omelette or similar costs everything extra here. We didn't try the dinner. Hence no statement on that. The rooms are nice in themselves but so noisy that you could hear doors slamming especially in the morning as people ran up and down the stairs or the staff swept the pool area in the morning. Unfortunately, it has come of age. After one of the rooms was converted into a construction site one afternoon, my collar burst. But so be it! Conclusion a hotel that really and honestly did not deserve the 5 stars at all. Great location doesn't give me 5 stars yet, there is more to it. There are 4 star hotels in Sidi that are better and I mean no harm. Ah so the reception manager was super nice and extremely helpful, but even he can't change anything if the owners let it slide like that. What a shame!

We did not stay there, but had some drinks at their terrace which had a great view of the sea. It was the best service we had in Tunis. Fast, friendly and efficient. Excellent variety of drinks, both alcoholic and  non alcoholic. Serenity with a view.

reviews.review_title: AVOID!! Not real 5 star. AC broken, electric problems, not hot water
reviews.review_text: I’m not usually one to leave reviews but do yourself a favor and book any other hotel nearby. This hotel came recommended from a local friend for the location. We stayed 4 nights - excited for the location and upgraded to their top suite. Unfortunately, we ran into problems almost every day. 2 of the 4 nights our AC did not blow cold air - in 40C weather. Woke up completely drenched in the middle of the night. They kept sending someone to “fix” it but nothing changed. Several arguments, 5 calls to the front desk, and 3 days later, they finally believed us and sent a real HVAC tech to fix the problem. The last day/night an electric problem caused all of our outlets to stop working in the room. The towel warmer shocked us. On top of it all, the hot water stopped working. We’re usually easy travelers and aren’t phased by minor discomforts. But for the amount of money paid ($400USD/night) and this being a 5 star hotel - it was totally unacceptable. The hotel manager spoke to us at check-out and proceeded to give us a lecture on how the AC works (even though there was clearly an issue and they sent an HVAC tech from the nearby town to fix it and admitted there was an issue). She grudgingly ended up giving us 10% off our bill and promised us a discount at our next stay. Sorry, this will be the first and LAST time we stay here!

We dined at Villa Bleu in Sidi Bou Said on Thursday, August 29, 2024 and were delighted by our experience. The setting is exceptional, with breathtaking views. The service was neat and attentive, and the food was just superb. We highly recommend this place for a memorable evening.

Poor customer service. I wouldn’t recommend them when there are many other hotels with better service in the area. Poor customer service. I wouldn’t recommend them when there are many other hotels with better service in the area. Have stayed in a few places in Sidi Bou Said with a more pleasant experience.

We booked the family suite at La Villa Bleue, but our experience fell far short of the expectations of a Five Star Pension.   Cleanliness and condition of the room: When we arrived, the sheets and towels were dirty. We asked that they be changed, but those provided to us were also stained. The bathroom was dilapidated and a strong smell of pipework persisted. The shower and sink were clogged, and the water stagnated at the ankles when we showered. Despite our complaints, the maintenance failed to resolve the problem, informing us that it would not be repaired until after our Check-out. No other rooms have been offered   Service: The behaviour of the female manager was unacceptable. When I wanted to borrow a book from the living room library to read in the bedroom, she ripped it out of my daughter’s hands saying that books should only be consulted in the living room. I have never seen this in my life after years of traveling. A vulgar and haughty behavior, this person has nothing to do in the hotel industry and has no sense of customer service. I remain shocked by this lack of professionalism and respect. reviews.review_title: Typical Tunisian Architectural Charm Facing The Mediterranean
reviews.review_text: Location: almost at the edge of Sufi Bou Saeed’s cliff, right by a viewpoint with stunning views. You cannot beat the views on their terraces (the breakfast area and the pool area)..  The breakfast area terrace has an unobstructed view of the Mediterranean.   Access to cars: Even if it’s in the pedestrian area, cars have access to pick you up or drop you off at the hotel entrance. However, expect to pay a higher fare, given that you’d have to ask the hotel to call a taxi for you, or, that most Bolt, InDrive transfer app drivers try to avoid driving through the pedestrian area. You can walk through the pedestrian area yourself (a 10min stroll), but not with suitcases (streets in the pedestrian zone are cobbled and can be slippery).   Rooms: There are a few rundown rooms and a few that are not sea view. My advice is to aim for a sea view room that’s been renovated/well-maintained (if you’re staying there, might as well pay extra and enjoy the sea view off your windows, balcony or terrace). Do not count on getting good Wi-Fi inside some of the rooms (depending on the location of your room). But the rooms have safes, are spacious and are clean.   Staff: Wonderful staff! They carry a positive attitude and are more than ready to help with any question or request you have.   Lubna and Reem (at the reception) excel at providing the best service possible. Kareema and Hamza (breakfast area) carry a cheerful attitude while providing a great service at breakfast. Mariam and Afaf (house-keeping) work nonstop at making sure everything is spick-and-span. The whole crew take their work seriously and always carry a smile on their faces and a can-do attitude.
