It is a family hotel, there is in front of a huge pool with slides and the sea next door!!! Activities are offered, the hotel is well placed. We had a great holiday. Thank you!!! Very good value for money!!!

Hotel very clean and staff super friendly the biggest let down were the bathrooms which desperately need a revamp.  Food very monotonous but good quality.  Best thing was a guy called Adel in the gift shop who took us on a trip to Sousse but we met up every day to chat and ask advice on many subjects. Very helpful and lovely man, shop was very well stocked and if he didn't have it he would get it for you next day.

I had a great stay at this hotel. The setting is beautiful and the atmosphere very pleasant. The activities offered are varied and accessible to everyone: horseback riding, quad biking, jet skiing... there is something for everyone! The meals are fresh, hearty and diverse, a real treat every day. The staff is friendly, available and always smiling. I highly recommend this property for a successful holiday

Again, we had a wonderful stay. Everyone was of a rare kindness, patience and always attentive. Whether it was the management team Jalil, Nour, the chef de salle Faouzi, the waitresses, the chef de cuisine, in fact everyone without exception was adorable, always bending over backwards to make us feel good. The hotel is very beautiful on a human scale, a beautiful pool and a beautiful beach. This time only the bold ones bathed, the water was 21°. Everything was perfect, and especially the chef's kitchen, a real treat. Thank you, little nod to Skander😉.

The hotel is well maintained and clean. Director very friendly, kind especially to Italians. Waiters very helpful and always smiling. Loved it as there is both the pool with slides and the sea directly from the property. Many activities from morning to night, both inside and on the beach. Highly recommended for both couples and families.

reviews.review_title: Good 3* hotel right on the beach
reviews.review_text: We stayed in September/October for 3 weeks at Neptunia. For a 3* hotel it is amazingly good. The room partly already renovated and always clean. The staff is very friendly, many speak German as well. The manager was present all day and always asked if everything was okay. And, as good food as there we didn't even have in 4* hotels ! The beach is just a dream and is cleaned several times daily. Although we never fly to a hotel more than once we have already booked for 2025. We can only recommend it. In addition, it is now to be renovated further over the winter.

reviews.review_title: A wonderful place for a family vacation
reviews.review_text: Were at this hotel in September 2023, were not very happy with the hotel meals, BUT the incredible attitude of ALL the staff captured our hearts and, after visiting in May 2024 the 5* hotel in Turkey unanimously decided that they missed Neptune very much and returned here in September 2024 again  What I want to say, first of all, the manager of the Hotel Zhalel is just a terrific person who knows ALL his guests to their faces, every morning, every day and every evening wonders how the holiday is going, it is very valuable, everything under his control practically 24/7! After a year became insanely delicious food, the choice is small, but there were always fresh delicious fruits, very delicious sweets, fish, meat, mussels (in the hotel 3*:)) , side dishes, tortillas, we ate to the ground (bringing sausage😅 but it didn't come in handy😅)  Whiskey was taken, beer was drunk at the hotel, quite 👌🏻  The room stock is being renovated, the rooms are being renovated, yes, it's not a super suite, but everything is very, very clean and neat 🤷🏼‍’”️ The most luxurious sea view of the rooms  The beach this year was cleaned twice EVERY day, sifted through the sand early in the morning and afternoon, the seaweed was cleaned immediately   We're not quite lucky with the weather, but this item has nothing to do with the hotel😅  Met a lot of guests who were last year (what people are coming back says a lot, I believe)   If there are flights from Moscow, in September 2025😂 we will come again to our soulful nearest dacha😅

reviews.review_title: Good times/Bad times- read full review
reviews.review_text: This was the 15th time I have been to Tunisia. This was my first time at this hotel.  Hotel is spotlessly clean. Maids cleaning from sun up to sun down. They should be paid more! The best advice I can give, tip well. You’ll be treated well.  Mr Jalel (manager) couldn’t do enough for us. I have walking problems and COPD. We had to move rooms a couple of times because I needed air con. Air con wasn’t working in either room. Mr Jalel ended up getting me a floor standing fan to help with the heat.  We were on the 2nd floor facing the sea. The breeze was needed.  Reception staff, especially Abdallah, were extremely helpful. Abdallah can speak good English and was very helpful when we needed a translator. I even ordered a birthday cake for my partner with the help from Abdallah.  Dining room and kitchen staff were also very nice and helped whenever I needed help.  We celebrated a birthday while at the hotel and they pulled out all the stops to make a cake and decorate the table with fresh flowers. All the staff even sang happy birthday. They were amazing!  There is only one downside to this hotel and it was an employee called Adel who took you on excursions in the hotels name to wherever you wanted to go.  We thought he was very friendly. He sold jewellery at the side of the shop and also worked in the shop with the shopkeeper at times. He even took us to atm when we needed to change money. He took us to the medina in Sousse and showed us around. He took us to a rug making shop. We enjoyed the banter from the staff at the shop and Adel. We bought 2 rugs! We brought one rug home with us and paid for the other to be shipped to Scotland. This rug was more expensive as it was a gift for mother in law, who is 85. We wanted a family tree with the names of the family in Arabic.  We have asked Adel 4 times since our return to Scotland regarding when we would receive the rug. We were told to start with that we would get it. Now we don’t even get a reply about the rug.

Nice Pension by the sea in Monastir. Fine sandy beach, Things to do and entertainment (quad bike, parasailing, outboard, towed buoy, massages, etc...). All-you-can-eat and varied buffets are fresh. Traditional and classic dishes (pizza, pasta in sauce, etc.). Delicious desserts, unlimited local drinks, pancakes to taste, hearty breakfast with giant Tunisian donuts (ftairs or banbalouni). I highly recommend, if you wish to book, call the Pension directly, you will benefit from preferential rates in all inclusive. It is a family Inn, on a human scale with an exceptionally kind welcome. The friendly staff will go out of their way to ensure you have a great stay. Possibility to call you taxis to visit the surrounding cities (Monastir city, sousse...) A real moment of pleasure 🤩

Superb Beachfront Inn in Monastir. Fine sandy beach, Multiple Things to do (quad biking, parasailing, outboard, towed buoy, massages, etc...). Various buffets based on fresh produce with local and classic dishes (pizza, etc.). Delicious desserts, unlimited local drinks, pancakes to taste, hearty breakfast with the emblematic Tunisian donuts (ftairs or banbalouni). I highly recommend, if you wish to book, call the Pension directly, you will benefit from preferential rates in all inclusive. It is a Family Pension, on a human scale with an exceptionally kind welcome. The staff will do their utmost to ensure you have a great stay. Small dedication to Nour le Directeur and Faouzi le Maître d' Pension who have been of unlimited kindness.

Small charming clean and quiet Inn, front line.  Friendliness and dedication of all staff without exception [his account...] friendly.  Very correct and varied meals.  Nickel beach with activities. Director attentive to the well-being of customers... very appreciative. Perfect swimming pool and water slides.In short positive for this stay. I highly recommend and will return very soon with great pleasure. Nice place to discover.

reviews.review_title: Great stay thanks to Danny and Gougou
reviews.review_text: Great holiday made great by the animation Danny and Gougou. Food not so great, same every day.  Great location cashpoint only a short walk up the road and supermarket 10 minute walk  and half the price of the hotel shop. Don't believe what you hear it is safe to go out by your self I went out several times for coffee, cashpoint and supermarket on my own and with another female. Explore outside of the hotel, great nightclub and shopping in monastir, shopping, clubbing and Arabian night in sousse where great. Late night beach parties were also great. Made some lovely new friends and special people. Xx

name: El Mouradi Gammarth
description: El Mouradi Gammarth is situated alongside a beautiful beach of golden sand facing the forest of Gammarth and close to the town of La Marsa, once a summer resort for the beys (rulers) of Tunisia. It is near to the ruins of Carthage and the village of Sidi Bou Said and is 10 kilometres from Tunis-Carthage international airport and 15 kilometres from the capital Tunis. This new hotel is ideal both for holidays for pleasure and for business trips.Read more
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_text: Thank you for the wonderful time at Hotel Mouradi. The reception, the bar, the restaurant and the delicious food, the security I like very much. The two ladies, Ahlem Zhir ind Radhia Toumi, in the morning shift until 15 h are very professional and very friendly. I'll be back. Thanks to all of you at the hotel. Eure Dagmar

This hotel is optimised for mass tourism and provides a pretty sterile experience for any traveller who wants to get some experience and a feel for local communities. It is a “resort”, quite isolated about 10 km from Tunis  and surrounded by other, mostly now abandoned, tourist venues of similar stripe. The nearest store is a 25 minute walk away.  Although the staff were very pleasant people, I don’t think the hotel deserves a 5 star label as it displays little by way of hospitality beyond a bed - not even a bottle of water in the room. The buffet is large but ordinary, and it’s wise not to wait too long after start time. I didn’t get to try the sparsely patronised a la carte presto, but the bar was quite good, though understaffed.  I stayed here due to it being part of a package tour, but I would not choose the place if organising my own travel arrangements.

reviews.review_title: A hotel that could be nice
reviews.review_text: The hotel is very large, well equipped (indoor, outdoor, lounge, large hall, hammam, sauna, massage...) and, half board, the buffet is quite correct. The staff is helpful and pleasant, you wouldn't say warm but... not far away sometimes. MAIS: - no tourist information available at the reception  - Rooms at the end of their life: holes in the carpet, phone and hair dryer that do not work, fairly dubious cleanliness, worn paint, window that can be opened but not closed...) - if you want to have breakfast near the dining room window, you can be turned away because the tables are large and there are only 2, 3 or 4. - seminar in the lobby and on the pool for 2 days: lots of noise  And the icing on the cake: - a swimming team that trains in the outdoor pool all day: howling, trumpets... and makes noise in the corridors at night.  In short, it is a good place, well placed (away from Tunis but close to other places to visit) but do not seek luxury and calm.

reviews.review_title: “A Nightmare Stay: The Hidden Reality Behind the Facade”
reviews.review_text: A deplorable hotel: the rooms were shockingly filthy, the reception was cold, and no help was offered to change rooms or find a solution. The only response we received was, “We’re sorry, but we have no solution to offer.” An extremely disappointing experience. I’m sharing here the hidden side of this nightmare.

A deplorable hotel: the rooms were revolting dirt, the reception freezing, and no help offered to change rooms or find a solution. The only answer you get is: “We’re sorry, but we don’t have any solutions to offer.” An extremely disappointing experience. I share here the hidden side of this nightmare.

Throughout my convalescent stay I was entitled to several treatments from Mrs. Najla. Who gave me daily lymphatic drainages as well as blow-drying and facial care. She is very delicate and of absolute kindnessd I'll be back.

reviews.review_title: Fun and Relax in low season ☺️
reviews.review_text: We liked the welcome, the smiling people, who make sure to listen to you.   We had a small leakage problem in the SDB in less than 10 minutes it was settled with kindness and discretion. They have installed a WhatsApp system that makes it possible to reach them directly it is incredible and effective. In addition, after each intervention, a small SMS to know if the request was made and always a reminder about their availability.  The hotel is very nice the lobby, the amazing bar with live music, there is really a beautiful work on the aesthetic of bar that reminds me a little of the American jazz club.   The restaurant is a self, it's varied there is everything. But it remains a self, clean, after it often lacks serving cutlery in sauces or other accompaniments. I didn't see if there was an à la carte restaurant, what was already enough for me. And again it was clean. The orange juice in the morning was troooop good!!!   Our twin double room with white decoration, a very spacious balcony and a view of the entire hotel with the sea in the background, so I think we had one of the best locations for visibility.   And to finish the best for last, my little relaxing moment at the beautician, where I was lucky to be in 2 pairs of good hands with Najla and Dhouha who took care of me perfectly, I extremely needed a manicure and a pedicure, which was executed without any worries, with incredible kindness, in addition to the professionalism found in the execution of my treatments... we chatted a little and again it is always nice to have people smiling and who have a sense of welcome.

Gammarth waterfront hotel near Tunis. The structure is very large and impressive but you can see that it is very old and honestly can not be worth the 5 stars they say they have. Long empty corridors recall the famous Overlook Hotel. The room was definitely clean and with a large bed; the bathroom instead had broken tiles and shower and so would be completely redone. The staff is very friendly and the breakfast is quite good although the table service is not exactly impeccable.

I wouldn’t say the hotel is average or very good   The reception is mixed depending on the staff in front of you.   The hotel is well maintained and clean.  The rooms are a little aging but also clean  There is a mini bar in the room extra. every day a room master controls the mini bar. But on the other hand, don’t think to check if the housekeepers hand over water knowing that we are in tt included , clever trick for us to serve the mini bar , medium technique , to go and ask our due to the reception for WATER.   The restaurant has a varied choice at every meal, what’s great is that employees at the end of the shift can serve this which limits waste and at least they work on a full stomach.   Which is to be thrown up. It is to see them serving in the middle of duty in the gastro with their fingers , eating in front of the customer , then serving you with a "pliers" , and all this in the greatest calm the chefs of room say nothing , it is moon , eat ok = this make a plate and go in the kitchen is better.   We went to the massage , lame go your way , relaxing massage = make your toes crack and tickle your feet , make your hair scrape no encompassing or relaxing maneuver 45 min to wait for his pass

5* hotel just magnificent exceptional welcome very attentive and very smiling  The restaurant is really diverse have eaten very well  I will be back with my colleagues and children soon  Have visited sidi bou Said the famous »café delicacies «

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. It is ok, the rooms are spacious and comfortable. The buffet is quite large there is a choice. On the other hand wait 2h for extra pillows after 5 calls at reception I found it completely move!  I want to mention a special note to Najla at the beauty area for her services that made our stay so much more enjoyable 🙏 we tested, hairstyle, radiance facial and beauty feet. She is caring, gentle, attentive! It's no one's love! I recommend 200%!!

reviews.review_title: Highly recommend, amazing hotel in Tunis
reviews.review_text: My favorite hotel in Tunis capital, always choose this hotel for the amazing service, great location, unbelievably nice rooms with views, delicious food with variety, and great professional personal that is always available 24/7 and very helpful. Highly recommend this hotel! :)

Very nice Hotel as a whole, nice staff and big positive regarding the food which is diverse and varied.  Several chefs will prepare different dishes for you, whether for breakfast, lunch or dinner.   The room is a bit old and deserves to be refreshed.  On the other hand it was very clean and quiet (because the balcony overlooked the pool and not the outside).   Little tour to the spa where I could enjoy a facial done by Najla that was really top.   Excellent value for money for this hotel, I recommend.

Really an excellent hotel, in amazing pool tunisi I did a blow dry there really the best dhouha and najla my good to pick thank you very much soon I would return with pleasure I am very satisfied very professional
Perfect blow-drying even with extension where top nejla I recommend it was very good thank you ❤️🙏🏼 ‘ ́ ́ ́ ́ ́

name: Hammamet Beach
property_amenities: Free wifi in the business center

reviews.review_text: Very nice hotel, with quality entertainment and animators always in good mood, available and dynamic. Very welcoming staff although meals are not exceptional. We recommend this hotel with family or friends.

Very good hotel with a beautiful beach. It is very nice. Varied meals. Clean rooms. Each room has air conditioning. Fantastic service. Everyone is very nice and helpful. Animators are wonderful.Lots of attractions for children and adults. You can play football, volleyball, basketball, tennis, boules, golf etc. There is a mini aquapark, several swimming pools, and a daily disco for children and adults.

Reception, staff, catering, location: very satisfactory.... A small flat for the comfort of the room , bedding would be to review .... A very good mention for Myriam at the animation and Firas the sports coach ....both very friendly and pro. Emmanuelle

reviews.review_title: Good hotel but not yet at the level of a 4*
reviews.review_text: We spent a pleasant stay with a good restoration of the animations pleasant a very pleasant staff very friendly, nice well maintained pools small flat the room that for us was old little socket to charge portable devices the absence of fridge, safe and towels paid air conditioning inefficient .can be 4*when it will be renovated completely globally not on our stay

Very satisfied with the hotel,,,,,as well as the animation team where there is a very sporty and very friendly animator it will be done As well as Paolo................................................................................................

The hotel itself is really nice. The food halls  are great, the restaurant staff very friendly and kind. The pools are clean and very well maintained, the renovated rooms are beautiful and modern. The animations are interesting and the animators are super nice. But I couldn't say the same about the front desk. I can't say I was well received. The team is not friendly, some of them are focused on European customers and addresses us as if we were sub-people. I had booked a renovated room with sea views, and on arrival we were given some very old room. If you do not make a claim, you stay in it while you have to pay something else. I am mixed of my holidays at this property.

Perfect location on the beach  The atmosphere is excellent the animators are just adorable and helpful  .................................nnn......................................................... ................(firas""")......

We had a great time a  superb renovated room the staff is always as nice it's been twice we spend our holidays at this hotel and we come back next year to forget the team f animation which was top especially for me mario who is always available and thanks to the staff you are really great does not change anything next year

Hotel on top!  And the restaurant! The staff is very welcoming! The animation team is exceptional with a lot of energy that put the atmosphere in our stay! Little dedication to Blacky and Meriam! Nothing to say!  See you soon!

We loved our stay at the hammamet beach hotel!  Hotel at the top!!!  The rooms are beautiful, the atmosphere is superb with different evenings each night!  The buffets are super good.   Small dedication to Blacky and Meriam who were great 😁

Nice setting, decent room... staff and hosts welcoming...special mention to Maryam and Mario...various buffet, and bartender at the top...thank you all for this beautiful week, even if the weather was not there every day...very nice memories 😘❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

Great trip between family! Nice and varied restaurant  Correct room  Direct access to the beach which is a big plus! Animation team super special mention to Mario and Maryam who are really nice 😘!  Thank you to the whole hotel team, waiters! 🙏🏼

Very good personal hotel listening good cuisine (chef Karim) and very nice waiter (lotfi) 3 beautiful swimming pool plus an interior we have a renovated room facing the sea with new bedding I advise unfortunately for families with baby no fridge in the room where to rent it 10 dinars per day depending on availability 😔 we made the camel with Garcia was quite a shame that we have to cross rubbish stones and demolition site his waste a bit the excursion but it also shows the reality can do the excursion otherwise 210dinars for two adults a child (3 years) for two hours, hotel and very clean and well maintained by all hands we do not see while we are at the pool or other: a little tip to the waiter allowed us to have  always the same table and having our high chair for the little one it was very nice and it a little complement 😉

We had a wonderful stay, beyond our expectations! Everything was there for an unforgettable holiday: the setting, the atmosphere... but above all, an exceptional entertainment team.  A huge thank you to the whole team, who knew how to put joy, energy and an incredible atmosphere every day. A special thank you to Meriem, an amazing woman, full of kindness. 💃🏻❤️!  Best blacky DJ in Tunisia   We will be back with pleasure 😍
We had a pleasant stay 5 days the staff was warm and welcoming. We have a renovated room, really beautiful sea view. Papa Garcia offers good activities. It is great the buffets are very good.

Club kids led by Sabrina at the top the hotel is well located the animators are present except the catering which is not too varied too repetitive I will return with great pleasure for the happiness of my children. Very nice experience good value for money

The rooms are quite obsolete but its pass.  We find the mattress hard but we get used to it by force. The animators are nice but the music at the evenings and too loud and two animators spend their time whistling it's super earsore.  My husband is injured during a slide ride nobody par ali the gentleman who manages the excursions is taking care of us. Forced to go to the private clinic on a Sunday and pay a blind we also had to negotiate the price of 300 euros announced we went to 100 euros to get sewn under the chin. Our belongings also took a bleach for a housekeeper during a pool outing in the indoor pool. The manager offered me and my husband a 30 min massage. That's nice of him. The food is not extraordinary but we always find to please despite the recurrence of dishes. Their donuts and pancakes are excellent.  The hotel is clean and we made quite a few excursion with ali and garcia that really have us more. Despite the waste and stray cats... alive and dead if we ignore all its is a beautiful country that gives the impression of freedom.

We enjoyed the welcome to this hotel by both the staff and the entertainment team.  Thanks to Simba, Blaky, Pablo and Mario for their kindness. Great location, nice hotel beach. A big thank you to the chef and the staff of the self who regaled us and also for their kindness.  Cleaning in the room is very well done with the little that gave them.

Bel hôtel . Well placed. Proper food. The rooms leak. Bed base wood plank . Spring mattress stoned . Unacceptable. Almost 2 hours from the airport to the hotel because the driver makes the tour of the grand dukes. Check-in 14h45 . Not even a sandwich since 6:00 in the morning.  Excursions very expensive. Care also. Very friendly staff. For the price in May suitable except for the horrible sleeping.

Nothing but praises about our stay at Maia Hotel Suites! The entire staff was helpful and kind and the service they provided was simply excellent. Two examples: The desk agent placed a phone order for food for us, and had it delivered by the security agent, from the restaurant downstairs, on our first night, because we were unfamiliar with the neighborhood. On the day we left, at 3:30am because we had an early flight, the desk agent (different from the first one) came downstairs to check on us after he saw on the security cameras that we were waiting for our taxi! And we had barely been waiting 5 minutes! The three security agents at the door were always cheerful. They provided tips and recommendations that made our 3-day visit even more pleasant. The room was spacious and very clean. Shower, sink and toilet were clean and worked well. Wi-Fi was dependable and fast. The breakfast was copious and delicious. We chose this hotel for its central location and weren't disappointed: 10 - 15 minutes from the airport (depending on traffic...) 20 minutes from the Medina and 20 minutes from Sidi Bou Said. We found taxis within less than 10 minutes each time we left the hotel to visit the city We very highly recommend the Maia Hotel Suites hotel for anyone visiting Tunis.  If we ever come back to Tunis, we won't bother looking for a different hotel.

It was an amazing experience and an excellent choice will definitely come back. The staff where very helpful and professional. The have accommodated our request for earlier openings of the restaurant for breakfast be your check out. Laundry service where fast and reliable.

Loved my short stay at the hotel  We were upgraded to suite instead of double room Clean and spacious suite Soft and soothing atmosphere Very welcoming and warm staff  Breakfast varied , delicious and served with a small gift gesture

reviews.review_title: Exceptional service, spotless rooms, great location and amazing breakfast!
reviews.review_text: Excellent service they go above and beyond for the customer! Spotless rooms and areas. Absolutely amazing staff! Friendly and caring! Breakfast was fresh and tasty. The location is perfect, it’s even close to a shopping area! I loved my stay at Maia hotel suites! Definitely will come back again. And I recommend.

reviews.review_title: Nice and clean hotel improveable with little
reviews.review_text: Very nice hotel located a short distance from the airport and close to the lake. Nearby there are a good number of clubs and restaurants, the center of Tunis instead is 20 minutes by taxi. The room I was assigned was tiny, they will have been a 10 sq m plus the bathroom also small. The essential but decent quality furniture. More to review the insufficient lighting especially in the bathroom where perhaps, on the mirror is appreciated a better visibility for example when shaving. Nothing to say about cleaning, done well and thoroughly. There are no room services, for these you have to call Glovo and the like. The common areas are very nice and well maintained. Breakfast is served à la carte in a room also very nice and with a very kind staff. The offer, however, is definitely limited, it revolves around different versions of the same omelet, no desserts, honestly after a while fed up. Ultimately nothing to say about the hotel and staff that I can only speak highly of. There would be little things that if put in place would make this structure really interesting. In the end, however, all in all I was fine.

It was clean , comfortable, well maintained hotel .friendly workers. Location was good , clean and quite neighborhood, a new shopping area is being added to the surrounding streets. free parking  Breakfast was tasty and freshly served. I recommend to everyone

reviews.review_title: Nothing to say alone little flat missing a pool
reviews.review_text: Super clean and quiet staff very professional servers very nice and kind I highly recommend this Pension the staff is worthy of a discreet palace available and very kind thanks to the receptionist for their availability and the ground floor caretaker very friendly

It's a wonderful place. The rooms are so clean and the staff is the best. Their breakfast is so delicious. We broke a plate and they said it's OK and didn't charge us anything!!! Its location is good midway to most places so 10_15 min by taxi. Highly recommend 👍👍

Shockingly wonderful hotel! Beautiful interiors. Well furnished rooms, living room with two couches (one is a sofa bed) and a kitchenette, separate bedroom, dressing area with lots of shelves; a mini apartment!  We were expecting a continental breakfast and were surprised by a menu and waiters!  The evening front desk man who checked us in was amazingly hospitable and helpful. He arranged for someone to buy us a bottle of wine (the person had to take a taxi since there is no alcohol in that area of Tunis), brought us ice, and helped us order dinner to be delivered. The phone in the room didn't ring so he actually made three trips up to our room! Over and above.  Enthusiastically recommend this hotel which is a 10 minute, 10 dinar taxi ride to and from the airport.

reviews.review_title: An enjoyable stay at Maia Hotel Suites
reviews.review_text: Maia Hotel is located in the Berges du Lac district close to Lac Leman and only a 10 minute drive from Tunis Carthage Airport.   There was a good welcome on arrival where there was a security check on the ground floor and then we took the lift to reception on 1st floor. Check-in was smooth and it wasn't long before we were given our key card for the suite that we booked.   The suite was spacious with an open plan kitchen/diner setup, large bedroom and bathroom. There was a lot of storage space. There were a few issues with the TVs and a lack of essential items provided in the kitchenette.   Breakfast was served in the restaurant, the menu was extensive and served to the table. A good range of hot and cold items were available and the coffee was excellent. It was a very good stay at Maia Hotel and ideal for an extended airport stopover.

When I checked in the toilet had not been cleaned. (This was obvious because the seat was closed and it hadn’t been flushed by the previous user.) I killed a couple of the small cockroaches in my room. And there were several mosquitoes in the room as well.  Most of the staff was nice, but sometimes it was hard to find someone at the front desk. Next time I’m here I’ll probably choose a different hotel.

The rooms are of high quality and in mint condition.  The hotel is clean, the staff very friendly.  Breakfast was delicious.  I would definitely recommend the hotel.  The location of the hotel is very convenient, between the city center and La Marsa and only 5 minutes from the airport.

Nice place gor a family but poor breakfast and the hotel contains insects we got few bites and we complained to the front desk and they just advised us to plug on a device that is not work to keep the insects away..  poor for 200$ per night should review their breakfast menu.. otherwise most of the staff are so friendly

Very welcoming hotel in the Berge du Lac area.  Structure: new, with 24-hour security, reception always open.  Rooms: very clean, large bathroom, comfortable bed. In some there is also a kitchen with kettle and stove.  Wi-Fi: fully functional  Breakfast: good. You choose a series of options from a menu (eggs based on the type of cooking, crêpes, yogurt, fruit, juices, etc.)  Staff: very friendly  Location: convenient, a few minutes walk takes you to Lac 1, while a few minutes by taxi takes you to Lac II, the Mall and the center of Tunis.  Good value for money  I advise

Dirty sheets  Yells at customers when you say sheets are dirty  Rude front desk staff  Manager who lies and makes empty promises  I also have front desk yelling on video. Message me if you want to see it

Excellent hotel. Cleanliness. Service. Freshly served a la carte breakfast. Comfortable bedding. Design. The kindness of the staff. Ideal location. I had a wonderful stay with the family, perfect internet connection. And above all calm. I give it 10 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: Very good experience. I highly recommend
reviews.review_text: A really good hotel, very welcoming and generous stuff. They gifted us a suite instead of a simple room as a gift for our special celebration. Very good rooms and services. I highly recommend this hotel. I will surely get there again in the next occasion.

name: Hotel Liberty Resort
description: Everyone needs a place to lay their weary head. For travelers visiting Monastir, Hotel Liberty Resort is an excellent choice for rest and rejuvenation.As your “home away from home,” the resort rooms offer air conditioning and a minibar, and getting online is easy, with internet access available.Guests have access to a 24 hour front desk, a concierge, and beach chairs while staying at Hotel Liberty Resort. In addition, Hotel Liberty Resort offers a pool and free breakfast, which will help make your Monastir trip additionally gratifying. And, as an added convenience, there is free parking available to guests.Travelers looking for Italian restaurants can head to L Horizon Bleu or La Voile.Looking to explore? Then look no further than Bourghiba Mausoleum, which is a popular Monastir historic site – and it is conveniently located a short distance from the resort.Hotel Liberty Resort is sure to make your visit to Monastir one worth remembering.Read more
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_text: We stay in Tunisia lots of time, it’s very nice place,food, beverage, room service very good. animation team very funny.There is inside pool with warm water, massage center very profesional,Evening time, plenty of funny shows. We are for sure come back

Hii i had a great holiday with my family and i wanna speak about all the services and special monument with animation team the do a wanderfull work they word had so much , anyway the food it was tasty clean everything good , our room was clean all day also thank liberty hotel see you soon

Reception. Arrived at the hotel and advised to go straight to restaurant as it was due to close and to book in after meal. Booking in was straightforward and not at all stressful. Shown to room without any delays.  Unfortunately we’re not given any information about hotel meal times or anything else.  Room. Clean and tidy and large enough for our needs. Large balcony. Bathroom had a shower over the bath. If you’re a short person may have trouble getting in and out. Only 2 sockets in room really do need more.  Room cleaned on a daily basis. Satisfied.  Restaurant. Food did vary only one soup available at mealtimes but plenty of salad. Food was more for the Eastern European guests. Brown bread was sometimes available but not always. Fruit and cakes plentiful. Good service and clean.  Bar. Good service and good staff. Drinks were the very cheap variety and sometimes ran out of some drinks. The bar area unfortunately wasn’t kept very clean. Quite often the tables were dirty and sticky. Did mention it to the bar manager but very little improvement.  Tea and snacks. Drink machines with paper/plastic cups. Morning snacks croissants, afternoon snacks cake. Bin for dirty cups was often dirty needed a good clean.  Animation. Very good. Entertainment room for improvement.  Pool area. Plenty of sun beds at all times and area kept clean.  Beach. Nothing to write home about, worst beach we have seen in over 50 holidays in Tunisia.  All in all a pleasant stay but could do better. Definitely not worth the 4 star rating more of a 3 star overall.

Location was good however may need taxis to get to near places such as sousse and monastir  Rooms where amazing lovely and clean and room service was daily done an amazing job  Value for money was mainly worth it however could have used more variety in food but we went out of season.  Services where amazing especially the animation team… they made the holiday amazing they had alot of activities through the day and gave us a good laugh especially Zidane, Jambo and Ali they where amazing!!  The hotel was lovely and clean would recommend to stay there.

My first visit toTunisia, had no complaints at all. The first time I've traveled alone and didnt want to come back home. Food, rooms, staff, pool everything was good. Bus stops directly opposite hotel 25p fare to Monastir 13Km away. I'm hoping to return this August.

Hi everyone really what to say about this hotel apart from that everything was sublime warm welcome as always I am at ma.5 eme time it is a soothing place the animators the cheerful staff funny the rooms always made with care regarding the restoration this appetizing I recommend this hotel frankly sumptuous bravo to all at the next

The staff are all great but the entertainment team are the best especially dj Ali and Jambo 🥰 and go above and beyond to ensure you have the best holiday 😎 would recommend staying here  Beach is a short walk across the road and food has lots of options even for a veggie 🥗

There could be a bigger variety of drinks in the bar but besides this everything awesome. We're satisfied with rooms, food and especially animation at the hotel. We honestly recommend :) 🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺

reviews.review_title: i recommend this hotel by experience
reviews.review_text: The staff is professional always smiling and very polite, they are always very attentive, helping you, advising you. The reception is perfect, nothing to say, there were too many different shows kids dance and live music , excellent animation team  . the rooms are cleaned regularly, the cleaning ladies are very nice. big hand and special thank for the waiters and the bartenders there who offer us a very good service while enjoying the champions league matches , hookah tea drinks was the best .. The hotel is equipped with everything, shop, hairdresser, spa, exchange office. We had a great holiday . we are coming back as soon as possible <3

The hotel is very good clean and nice.All the staff is so apologies and funnily.We spend very happy and nice time.I will recommend to all my friends to come and visit the Liberty resort. Specially tanks to the entertainment young staff.Thank you Tunesia.👍

People are very friendly and helpful. The weather is perfect because sun is always shining here , food was good and delicious it’s better than turkey .. The bar have many varieties and the staff was smiley and kind but the most awesome part were the animation team they are the best spent a lot of time with us to make fun and laugh , nice spirits..  we enjoyed our holiday , thank you liberty hotel  We adore the vacation  Special thank to all the workers there

reviews.review_title: we are coming back , thank you Liberty Hotel
reviews.review_text: we were there for one week filled with passion and love , the first day when we arrived the room was extremely fantastic and tidy , decorated with some red flowers with a nice smell , the bar was varieted rhum whiskey vodka gin with nice beer moreover animation team was so friendly nd lovely they provided anything we needed all our holiday , yoga aquagym chess pingpong nd tennis , big heart for them all , you made our holiday finally the food was delicious and tasty we adore  i give 10/10  keep on the same road , we will back as soon as possible

Nothing to eat on arrival (10 ish) Entertainment is not great to be honest,lights switch off around 10pm NOT GREAT . Food ok but not much variety ,good beer but wine and cocktails not the best. Good swimming pool and beach bar  Beach is not private loads of locals going there but not problems at all .

Welcome, the staff member who initially booked us in was rather unwelcoming, however the dealings that we had during the rest of our were good.  Room, Good size with ample balcony. Clean but rather tired.  Pool, Clean and overseen by lifeguards. No issues whatsoever in respect of securing sunbeds no matter what time of day and service was friendly. Waiters around pool suitably dressed and always available.  Reception Area, comfortable seating and air conditioned.  Food, slightly more variety would have been preferred, waiters in Restaurant extremely helpful.  Shop, the man in shop was extremely helpful and provided excellent guidance in respect of places to visit and transport options.  Location, taxi rank situated directly opposite hotel and available throughout the day.  Beach, a matter of crossing the road and walking down a lane. Sunbeds were available at no extra charge.

Hello, I'm Josef. I would like to say that it was a great holiday and a great hotel for me. This is my first time in Tunisia and I want to thank all the staff in the bar, restaurant, reception. And a big thank you and recognition to the entire animation team. This is a great team and a lot of energy throughout the day, smiling and joking with me and my family all day long. That was beautiful. Thanks, Ali, Lukas, Bangala, Bruno and everyone.

name: Iris Djerba Hotel & Thalasso
description: IRIS Djerba Hotel & Thalasso 4* is situated in the tourist district of Djerba Island, 15 km from the Houmt Souk, within walking distance from numerous restaurants, bars and shopping opportunities. The hotel has 2 swimming pools and a well-maintained thalassotherapy center with affordable prices and rich customer experience. Warmly decorated rooms with a stylish touch with balcony or terrace - garden or pool view. Many unusual architectural solutions and pieces of decor create an incredible atmosphere. For children, there is a lot of space to play, mini - club with playground and a small paddling pool. In addition to the listed facilities, Iris Hotel & Thalasso offers also 1 conference room with a maximum capacity for 750 people.Read more

reviews.review_title: HORRIBLE Experience, Please save your money and go somewhere else!
reviews.review_text: Please don't waste your money by going to this place especially if you are traveling with children!!! This hotel was absolutely horrible. Before you pay for this hotel just know that you will be expected to pay about £50 before you get your keys!   We did not have hot water for 3 days and every time we said something, no-one took notice of what we were saying until we asked the manager to give us the rest of our money for the remaining 4 days so we could book another hotel, we even emailed love holiday who were helpful and refunded us a small portion of the monies we paid, once love holiday reached out to them they moved us to another room. Another problem was that their rooms were cold and the heating did not work properly, they gave us a small heater which helped a little, but this was very stressful especially when you have a 2 year old with you on holiday.  The heated pools were turned off, the spa was not open, the were no activities offered like advertised, we had to book a few excursions while we were there so that we wouldn't be sitting in the hotel room all day.  We found over 30 cigarettes buds on the children's play pit, it was absolutely disgusting because I toddler accidentally stepped on one and wanted to play with it, when I reported this to reception, they did seem to care.  The Hotel was filthy and never vacuumed, they only used broom on some areas.   The food was ok, not the best but okay, not a lot of variety especially for breakfast. They "ran" out of milk for 2 days so we could not have hot drinks or cereal.  The "night entertainment" was an absolute joke, it was just loud noise that they played until midnight, when we asked them to turn it down because we wanted to sleep, they obviously did not listen. Honestly if you advertise yourself as a family friendly hotel then surely you should try to be accommodating to people who will come to your hotel with children.  I loved the island of Djerba as a whole but this horrible hotel really ruined my holiday because it caused more stressed than relaxation.

Omg where to start, we had booked a week at this hotel in March, it took 3 room changes to get a room that was remotely except able, even then a cleaner had to come in and clean it again, we missed lunch with room fiasco so asked where snack bar was and were told there was a cafe 1/2 a mile down road, tried to get a drink no beer no gin the list goes on. Thank god for some other guests who had some duty free and were happy to share. Food one option so no choice at evening meal so dried up chicken or nothing!!! Breakfast stale croissant not over cooked stale and the best bit you could have a cup of tea if you liked it black because no milk!!!! Everything is closed the indoor pool is not heated, you can’t even enjoy sitting on your balcony as furniture is filthy. We couldn’t stand being there anymore so we were checking out, another couple who arrived same day as us had booked flights home that’s how bad it is. Trying to check out was a nightmare they would not return our tourism tax which we had to pay in cash. We kept asking them to call a taxi but wouldn’t after 2 hours a taxi turned up for some other guest and the driver took us first as we were going round the corner. A cheap holiday should not mean that you can’t expect a clean safe environment or that if you are all inclusive you can’t get some edible food and a drink at the only open bar. As much as the few staff there were tried all they could say was sorry until we were checking out and this became quite hostile.  We are a well travelled couple and have had many cheap last minute getaways but never never have we expect anything like this, I don’t usually write reviews unless it’s a nice one, but I just feel I have to let people be informed of how bad somewhere is that you only stay one night a pay to go and stay somewhere else. In the summer maybe more of the hotel is open but unless some work is done it’s nowhere near a 4 star

Avoid at  all cost I'm there now food is terrible there is one mucky smelly restaurant 1 bar lift keeps breaking down bar barely stocked love holidays say not our problem see the hotel and the hotel just ignore and say I'm sorry. No spa looks like not been open for long time

Very welcome and the animation team L. At the top The best favorable point of the hotel L. Just the music that was a little loud.  Too bad for the self much the same and the meals are cold, little choice.  All in all the hotel could use a good new shot

The hotel was good. The rooms need to be improved with cleanliness. The staff are friendly and helpful. The tour man Karime is really good guide person. He took us to the city tour quadra bikes and camel tour which was really worth the money. If you want to book trip I would recommend to talk to Karime he is really friendly and make good deals

This review could have easily been a 1 star. However, on reflection, the price we paid was only £34 a day all inclusive, which included the tax you paid on arrival at check-in.  The room was basic but a good size, which included a bath (need to ask for plug as not in room). On arrival, we were given a room with a toilet that didn't flush and a broken toilet seat, which were both resolved quickly.  It was out of season, and the room was cold, so I asked for a heater, which again was dealt with quickly. The food offer is very limited and is repetitive, with most days the hot counter offering food being luke warm in temperature. The bar on the afternoon of day three ran out of vodka and gin on the afternoon of day four with neither replaced until the evening of day five with only whisky and buka available for all inclusive guests even though they had spirits in another bar but were only available to paying guests. The gym has an additional charge and has very limited equipment in poor condition. Reception was very helpful in assisting any issues.  Most staff are polite enough, and the animation team tries to get to know you. It is located within walking distance of a few cafes / restaurants which we thought were good value for money, which was welcome due to food offer in hotel. The hotel is less than 1/2 a mile from the beach, which is not well maintained, and the two occasions we went were mainly occupied by camel rides. The hotel would appear to have been nice at one time, but it looks like lack of investment over time has taken its toll.

Time of year, reflected in price and I guess what we found. As maintenance work going on in hotel and a lot of local facilities closed.  However, recommend the excursions and Karime the tour guide is excellent, knowledgeable and very helpful 😀

This hotel plays BANGING music all day every day. If you are looking for peace and quiet then this is not the hotel for you. This music is played outside at the pool area and also the lower level of the hotel where the dining room is. There is no one ever at the pool, the animation guy playing it is the only one dancing.... it's pure self gratification. It's really an unbearable noise. If you want peace and quiet you will not get it here, not even by escaping to your room.  Food is mediocre, not at all hot, even when coming off the hot counter.  I'm here with my sister and we have been hassled a lot in the hotel. I expect it off site, but please not on the complex. I've been here two days and have been asked the same questions ten times over ie, what's my name, where am I from, have I been to Tunisia before.... please leave me alone on site. This is no way a four star, probably was once, but it's faded grandeur makes it now a two star at best. I would definitely not recommend, even for a cheapie break away.

We're here for the new year. Arriving at the reception, we are told that we are given the most beautiful room in the hotel just above the reception. Effectively beautiful room clean and beautiful view of the pool. But we were not informed of the noise of the evenings (music in depth until the first night 1:30 and the second the day before December 31 4:30) it is only the animators who dance. We were offered to change rooms, but based on feedback from the local holidaymakers, we preferred to keep ours and buy earplugs. Among other things, this hotel is a commercial hotel that complements with buses from Algeria and Libya that only come to eat and sleep 1 night. We had the worst Christmas Eve of our lives. People threw themselves on the food, there was not even a plate or tray. Our meal was for us a bit fries and with paid drinks. Great for an exclusive all.. While on some tables the food was spoiled (their habits do not justify everything) we went outside to finish our New Year s Eve. The restaurant, we are really tolerant people and not difficult, but there from the 1st day to the last day of our holiday it was always the same, it was good without more, not too many choices and the tablecloths are dirty. Do not hesitate to put a little more expensive and but a tip avoid this hotel..

Cheap hotel with a beautiful pool but is not relaxing because young people put the music very loud all day until 11pm restaurant level really unhygienic they touch everything with their fingers and never wear gloves. It is always the same meals, we took half board but for dinner you still pay for the drink even the water. In the room you are entitled to an old tv in the shower the cabinet is broken for the toilet you have to flush 4.5 times finally you will find better elsewhere.

Is nice hotel good location the value from the price is very good too the restaurant it's okay the entertainment they try they make it like the best the staff there nice smiley the room the nice and clean like traditional I spend good time there

reviews.review_title: Very disappointing and not recommended for a good stay
reviews.review_text: The animation is at the top as well as the staff, friendly, very professional and very welcoming. However, the hotel is more than disappointing. The food is always the same again it is necessary that the dishes are not empty because you always hear the same phrase there are no more. We spent the new year and what a disappointment again, some shrimp to do well but many people did not have one. The meal was the same as the other days. We strongly recommend against it hoping that this hotel will make efforts so that we can come back and finally have good reviews.

reviews.review_title: Hotel has the image of its small price
reviews.review_text: Horrible hotel, dirty room, swimming pool also, buffet is mediocre and unhygienic (desserts near a hot cooktop).noisy hotel and especially not very friendly staff,and especially not honest (forced to threaten to get clothes washed).Dilapidated hotel and under construction,no light at night on the stairs....in short not iris hotel but iblis 👹

Ideal family hotel to relax a few days with a dynamic and sparkling entertainment team of incredible kindness, papaya and his team will leave us a superb memory without forgetting Hamza (you can trust him for activities such as quad biking etc....) the bartenders are exceptional and listen with a big smile. Thank you to the restaurant staff who are also great and kind ... A BIG THANK YOU

good stay at the hotel the staff is very kind and helpful, hamza advised us good activities to do I recommend! the hotel is well placed next to places that can be visited with family the hotel has a very nice outdoor pool

Absolutely waste of money.  Rubbish Hotel. Stay away if possible, otherwise you definitely be disappointed.  Only two things are good sofar. People at Reception and Restaurant didn't show any face yet.  They have a warm pool if you are here in winter months.  Rest of them are nothing like what they advertise in the site.  Start with Reception.  Such a laid back approach for everyone.  1 hour to check in. Couldn't check In, they gave us the keys to the room and asked us to come back later.  If you are dealing with one person means you will have to finish them before you move on to the next guest, where as here they hopping between three four people.  If you come from Europe then you'll be annoyed to see such a silly actions,  so as in the Restaurant guests have no courtesy stand in the queue,  easily jumping the ques and staff ignoring the ones who stood in the ques and encouraging que jumpers. Coming back to Reception.  Hidden cost of 260 Dinars as Tax, I Never heard such a high Tax for a week stay.  No WIFI IN THE ROOMS. WiFi only available in Reception area.  You need to speak French or Arabic if not Communications are really difficult with the staff in here. No body speaks English.  We were using Sign language.  Everyday we need ask the cleaner to provide gel, shampoo and Towels if not they don't top up Automatically.   HOT WATER ONLY AVAILABLE IN THE MORNING.  At the Restaurant,  most of the dishes were repeated . Never labelled food contents in English,  big struggle if you are vegetarian.  Fish weren't even scaled and Gutted properly before cooking.  Orange is the only fruit available for the whole week.  Hardly seen yogurt on the counter.  It's a  total disappointment.  Hotel needs demolition and re build from scratch get all the bad practices away,  if not Europeans please find somewhere else. It is not a 4 star Hotel. I Don't even give 1 star.

reviews.review_title: Worst place we have ever been
reviews.review_text: We was out there for one week beds are hard no heating have to move rooms 3 times and my wife was sexualy assaulted by staff hotel manger did not do anything or ring police when I asked till I started shouting food was bad we ended up eating out stay well away from this hotel

This December I visited hôtel thallasso and spa. I was impressed with the decor and design of the hôtel that has a lovely layout with beautiful trees and lovely mosaic tiled decor.  Very artistic and beautiful. The hôtel has a lovely feeling and nice eastern style. I was told about the bar restaurant and swimming pool. The hôtel room was spacious and cleaned everyday to a high standard. I was impressed with the food as well.

Very nice hotel. Very welcoming staff, attentive very professional.clean rooms households made every day..very good and varied food. Staff and officials are really attentive.we had a mishap with a hotel in medoun, but they welcomed us without problem and without extra. Thank you to the whole team and very soon inchalah.

name: Hasdrubal Thalassa & Spa Yasmine Hammamet
description: A 5-star seafront hotel, along a private sandy beach, the Hasdrubal Thalassa Yasmine Hammamet, is an ideal stopover to relax. The hotel features a 5000 m2 seawater Spa Center, and is located at the heart of the resort of Yasmine Hammamet, with its marina of 740 moorings, considered as one of the most important ports of the South shore of the Mediterranean sea. The new Medina, with its Casino and theme park 'Carthage Land' are a few minutes’ walk. The hotel stands at a 15 mn drive from 02 renowned international golf courses, the CITRUS and the YASMINE. The hotel features, 196 junior suites, suites 05 ambassador suites, 10 Prestige suites, 01 presidential villa of 1542 m2, and a 300 seat conference room.Read more
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_text: Great professional and courtesy; I would also like to report the kindness at Mrs.'s reception. Najla MARAI and all the staff always ready to prevent customer requests. Spa too crowded on weekends and closes too early

I am staying at a hotel nearby. Their Spa is being renovated and I read about this hotel on Google reviews. I emailed them on Tuesday and Mohamed, the Spa manager emailed me back within the hour offering me an appointment for the Silver package I had read about for 350 TND for the following day. It was just fantastic. It included a 60 min massage, 30 min Hammam, 30 min jacuzzi bath with hot sea water and rose water and a 20 min face massage. Slippers, robe, relaxation area with lots of tisana (herb tea), bottles of water. A large warm indoor seawater pool with hydrojets. I was there for 4 hours. The staff were all so lovely and friendly and good at their job even though it is Ramadan. I saw a poster at Reception for another excellent package  - 275 TND for breakfast, lunch, use of pool, 40 min massage, 30 min facial, and use of a suite room all day. There was a 50 TND single supplement but still a wonderful experience for the price. There was a lovely helpful lady on reception called Ghada who got staff to take me to meals (2 different restaurants - the hotel is like a huge palace - art work and marble everywhere). She also took me to my room. Again, Mohamed had everything perfectly organised in the Spa and was kind enough to change the facial until after lunch. Restaurant staff was excellent too, as was the food. One young waiter (with a long Turkish name) went out of his way to make me a "caffe latte" (I found the cappuccino from the machine a bit too sweet). The rooms are luxurious with extremely comfortable beds. Everywhere was quiet because it is low season which was perfect for me.  This is a uniquely exquisite hotel with a fabulous Spa and wonderful staff who provide outstanding service. I am very grateful to have experienced being here.

reviews.review_title: My new favorite hotel in Hamamet
reviews.review_text: Great experience, I’ve been to several hotels in Hamamet this is become my favorite it , junior suite is spacious , well decorated Tunisian style, the bed is comfortable . I really enjoyed the jacuzzi and Spa pool with Mediterranean Sea water . The staff were very friendly. Just happened to meet the owner in breakfast his  very humble and welcoming.  General manager Samir N’cir came and checked on my experience in the Hotel . The Hotel is well maintained and well decorated with North African Arts..  looking forward to enjoy this hotel in summer.

reviews.review_title: A very nice hotel in Tunisia
reviews.review_text: Coming for a week of thalasso as a couple at the end of September, we discovered a beautiful luxurious hotel, a spacious and comfortable suite, fruit cup, bottle of water, Tunisian cakes, chocolates or dried fruits depending on the day. The thalasso center is well organized, its staff is competent and attentive, as well as reception, cleaning, beach and restaurants. The breakfast buffet is impeccable, good coffee machine and real orange juice, etc. The à la carte restaurant, for us included in the half board offers a Tunisian menu and a European menu, starters, meat, fish and desserts of very good quality. Little downside, prefer the à la carte restaurant to the very hearty buffet and with choice, but a tone below culinary level. In total very little extra expenses, water and wine at table at very reasonable rates. We will definitely come back with friends next time..

reviews.review_title: Award exaggerated for what it is
reviews.review_text: The Award corresponds to a 5 star luxury Parisian or even more! Spacious room but noise all day long even at night with children jumping upstairs, I saw people bathing with their clothes, this same person was at the beach then no shower with his long dress in the pool! Waiter of the evening buffet who adds you 4 drinks and 2 bottles of water on the bill! breakfast 25 min for a pancake.. August when we took the room the Award was 440 euros per night and frankly nothing in the Pension corresponds to that Award! I took a triple because the receptionist told me on the phone that with a baby of 2 years I could not take doubles and that they do not add a cot when it was not true ...

reviews.review_title: This is not the exceptional 5 star that we expected
reviews.review_text: I knew that the 5-star category does not have the same meaning in all countries but when the Award paid equals that of a 5-star Shangri La Barrière or Marriot , you expect equivalent performances. Certainly the rooms are spacious but around despite the efforts of the staff we can not find his account. Bedding is classic hard pillows. The courtesy tray is shameful, cheap kettle that leaks responsible for short circuit, instant coffee when all over the world you find espresso makers. Decent breakfast for a 5 star, already seen better with a neighbor. Not enough material, we wait 45 minutes for a pancake!  No children's club so punished with thalassotherapy if you come with family! The 120 dinars dinner is also not exceptional and children pay as much as adults for 2 slices of pizza and ice cream. No drinks included despite the Award.  In short this is not the luxury 5 star I expected given the fame and especially the Award paid.

Staff prepared, kind, very polite and above all attentive to every detail.  Very nice and clean structure. Both International and local cuisine very good  Spacious and elegant room  Super equipped and well maintained private beach.

I like to go back there. This hotel is unique and the best in Tunisia. Its thalassotherapy is incredible. Fortunately this kind of place existed. The meals served are good, the rooms are clean, beautiful and spacious. Each time I discover an unexplored corner. A little hello to the gentleman from the Moorish café who sings and plays so well. See you soon I hope

Every trip to Tunisia passes through Hasdrubal Hammamet as we appreciate the service, the setting and the services.  The helpful staff are dedicated, friendly and professional. The cuisine is excellent both at the PDJ (whose buffet is rich and varied) and at the Le Gourmet restaurant.  We recommend the Thalasso Center for exfoliation in the traditional hammam, massages... The friendly and professional staff will be able to advise you.

It has been a magnificent experience. All perfect. The rooms are very spacious and clean, the food is very delicious, perfect service from all the staff. A family visit and everyone was happy. He recommended the hotel 💯. Thank you Azdrubal Hotel. We will surely return ;))).

Nice Looking hotel, staff very happy and friendly and spotlessly clean.. If there was another 50 guests it was a lot.due to this food choice extremely poor.only 1 of 5 restaurants open. Pool and pool bar closed, beach area had no beds and no entertainment, no air conditioning in the room so couldn’t sleep

I had a faithful and excellent stay in my favorite hotel: thalassotherapy at the top, reception staff, catering, maintenance, gardens, security, always very friendly and competent✌️  Thank you to the general manager Samir N'CIR for his attentiveness and his kind responsiveness to resolve any possible problem.  Congratulations in particular this evening to the Olivier restaurant in Chokri, to Fouizia and to the clerk present for their kindness,  Wonderful pleasure for the eyes and taste this evening for the flambéing of the beef fillet and the crepes susettes.

Everything is perfect, we have been going to this hotel for 19 years, in need of a refreshment but nothing urgent, hotel management and thalassotherapy, nothing to envy of the 5 stars, the only downside is the food has deteriorated, why in the morning the omelettes are great and the evening they are not cooked no one learned in a hotel school it's a shame

reviews.review_title: Loyal to this hotel, we have the pleasure of returning there regularly
reviews.review_text: Perfect service in all departments: dedicated, attentive and professional staff. The cuisine is delicious, the dishes and buffets are varied and well presented. The thalassotherapy center is fantastic and the service perfect.

We were there at the end of August 2023 Very beautiful luxurious hotel, friendly staff, they are at your disposal at any time, extraordinary buffet at dinner, Simply magnificent and I highly recommend it.

reviews.review_title: Top & Best Luxurious 5 Star  Resort in Africa . Exceptional Service.
reviews.review_text: Big Thank you to Mr Samir Nsir the hotel GM for his passionate service and his great leadership.  Especial Thanks to Samir the Hotel Duty Manager for  His personalised Service. Not sure how he remembers The hotel guests by name ? Brilliant.  We'll done.  Thanks to all Hasdrubal staff for their attention to details and genuine care during my stay at the Resort. Another happy and memorable experience at The Spa. I am not surprised the hotel deliver 7 Star service, since they are a member of Luxury Hotel of The World.(SLH)  Please keep up the Good Work. I will return soon. Philippe

name: Hotel Royal Garden Palace
description: * Located on the island of Djerba * 3-storey building, oriental style architecture * Surrounded by 20,000 m2 of garden * Opposite the "Djerba" 27-hole golf course * 200 m from the beach * Complimentary sun loungers and parasols on the beach * 6 km from downtown Midoun * 18 km from downtown Houmt Souk * 6 km from various shops * 25 km from the Djerba airportRead more
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_text: Clean, nice hotel, friendly staff, available and smiling. Beautiful sandy beach, a dynamic animation team. As far as catering is concerned, a diversification of dishes on a daily basis would only benefit this balance sheet.

4th stay in 2 years and still satisfied. if it is true that some parts of the hotel deserve a renovation (bathtub, hallway carpeting,...), the hotel is clean, welcoming. The staff, whatever their profession, are smiling, polite, professional. I could see how quick it was: after a slip near the outside bar, I sprained my left elbow; immediately after my fall, several employees arrived, seated me in a wheelchair to take me back to my room; 15 minutes later, a doctor called by the hotel arrived to examine me and refer me to a clinic. Thank you all. See you later.

reviews.review_title: Decent stay, but past its prime
reviews.review_text: Royal Garden Palace has its charm, but it's clear that its best days are behind it. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, and the restaurant team – especially the evening shift – was professional and welcoming.  Desserts were top-notch, but beef dishes were a letdown: steaks were overcooked and rubbery, and stews needed much more time to become tender. On the bright side, fish and shrimp were delicious. The Tunisian night and local cuisine were real highlights!  Entertainment options were quite limited, which is a downside considering there isn’t much to do outside the hotel. The crocodile farm is about 3 km away – worth the walk on your own.  The hotel surroundings feel neglected, and while camels and horses on the beach might sound exotic, the mess they leave behind is less appealing.  Overall: a decent one-time experience, but not a place we’d return to.

We stayed in this Hotel waiting to be able to stay in the one of our original booking. We are very disappointed with this hotel, for the Royal Garden Palace, only the Garden is royal. We ate badly, food for Germans and Poles, the staff is cold, no smile, no welcome in all areas. the rooms are obsolete, bathroom with bathtub, we should think of people who have difficulty being able to move easily. Rust on the ceiling of the hall at night, animals in the drawers, refrigerator cooling very little, and so on. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our knowledge.

We had to stay at the Iberostar Eolia and 2 weeks before departure we are informed that it did not open on the scheduled date. Proposal to the royal garden palace , in view of the comments I had a lot of apprehension when at the hotel.....but surprised we had a pleasant stay, the rooms very clean and large garden view...very nice hotel lobby.......the staff very kind and helpful. Very very nice, beach.. good meal, fish every day......

Spacious room, sea view and quiet, very clean (thanks Lamia) large storage space. Establishment surrounded by a beautiful garden, sandy beach and emerald sea, deckchairs with mattresses as well as by the pool. The staff is really helpful and attentive. The only downside is the restoration, we find its happiness because it is varied but very repetitive. Large selection of vegetables, fruits and desserts Grilled meats are not tender and fish are full of bones. The cooks and the quality of the ingredients are not worthy of a 5 star...But that doesn't stop us from having very good times.

reviews.review_title: Simply not good enough for 5 stars.
reviews.review_text: As with many hôtels in Djerba the star rating reflects a distant past and there are a few glaring standards that differentiate this hotel from a truly luxury one. Firstly the dreadful all inclusive package  , limiting the guest to really substandard quality ingredients. All cocktails are bulk premixed stock and when served look nothing like their exotic namesakes. My husband and I don't drink alcohol but enjoy a 0.0 beer. Not available at this 5 star luxury establishment and the management refused to get some in for our stay. Even a shack on the beach had it for sale. And finally the indignity of trying to get a sunlounger around the pool. Forget it after 07.15. Despite the hotel clearly scorning the practice of towel dropping they do nothing to discourage it. In my opinion this alone puts it in a 3 star bracket. We are still at the hotel for another week, so will update as and when.

reviews.review_title: One of the best experiences ever - Now or never :)
reviews.review_text: The hotel has exceptional animation team. You can have aqua aerobic or stretching during a team and unforgettable party every night. I visited quite a few hotels in my life but has not seen such a dedicated a professional animation team, especially Sirine.  The cleaning lady and the reception was perfect. But also the guy in charge of the main restaurant was very helpful. Thank you for the great vacation !  Marcin

We end our stay at this hotel. There's good and bad. This hotel must have been a good 5 stars about 15 years ago but more now. Big renovation to be expected. Carpeting more than aging in the hallways. Paints to refresh.  In May no air conditioning... surely to save money... the restaurant decent food I'm difficult but I ate to my hunger. the organization of catering services should be reviewed. Not all the tables are available because they're already ready for the following services. At the pool if you want a deckchair either early... napkins put on and people spend 10 minutes there during the day.  At 5:00 p.m. the staff is already packing the deckchair rugs. The staff is friendly. The flies are annoying! The spa is not bad and cheap. Good massages and friendly masseuses. Cleanliness of the toilets more cleaning in the day would not be a luxury.  The room is aging but suitable. No air conditioning in low season (May!) Here's a good stay but don't trust the nice photos and video with nice filters.

Pros: Very nice pool, beautiful garden, very neat. Our server Hichem very attentive and smiling. Nice tennis courts, well maintained. Comfortable wooden deckchairs.  Cons: Old hotel, far from the 5 islands. Old and poorly cleaned rooms. After 3 days we changed the room following the nuisance of a nightclub next to the hotel (room 3356). Then we were quiet but we had to insist on making this change. The meals are correct but not very diversified. We eat the same thing every day. Sometimes lacks a little freshness especially at the pool restaurant.  Despite these many negative points we had a great family stay but we will not go back.

It is representative of the whole pool. Dozens and dozens of reserved deckchairs and nobody in the water   This is abnormal and the hotel does nothing which is even more serious. reviews.review_title: This hotel no longer corresponds to a 5-star hotel.
reviews.review_text: An ageing hotel that requires a serious renovation,  - Large room with terrace, sea and pool view, bedding much too firm, old bathroom, old bathtub that does not make you want to take a bath, ventilation is non-existent. Quick cleaning. Separate toilets are fine provided that the flushing system works despite various maintenance interventions.  Carpeting in the floors marks signs of wear, deserves a new hit.   - The indoor restaurant lunch and evening at will: clean, white tablecloth, fabric towel, the buffet very varied but tasteless, except the excellent Tunisian buffet on Saturday evening,  ( 1 correct meal over a week!) If, in the evening, you dine at the first service you will have to forget your aperitif at the piano bar, there is the bar but no musician, (musician will be there when you are at the restaurant)  I hold breakfast with fresh juice minute, boiled egg, various appetizing preparations. Thank you, Murad. - The outdoor restaurant swimming pool open at lunch: impossible to lunch because there are flies. The different pool and indoor bars are very good: the staff recognize the guests and always have a friendly word.  - A special mention and a big THANK YOU in general to all the staff who are extremely kind, friendly, from the reception, to the waiters, pool, maid, passing by the animators:   The welcome with a smile, the nice little word, is what makes this hotel strong but unfortunately it does not replace the shortcomings. I don't forget the massages we probably wouldn't come back to this hotel without

The hotel has lots of potential, but in its current condition, I would rate it 3*, not 5*. Beautiful building and surroundings - just very outdated. The gym is horrible everything is extremely old floor dirty linoleum, no proper mats no water no AC

Very good infrastructure  Decoration (everything) deserves renewal  Restaurant: Breakfast very good, the rest average  Service: reception top   Spa therapists: excellent quality price service Activities: very good  Carriage to go golfing in front a plus

5-star hotel that was awarded to us due to work at the Iberostar EOLIA which was our initial drop-off point. Large and beautiful park very well maintained and very flowery.  Reception hall and interior quite classy despite the age of the hotel.  Three small shops present and Moorish coffee with free mint tea. Sellers of outside activities not insistent. Welcoming and very pleasant staff. WIFI throughout the hotel even at the beach.  Large unheated outdoor pool. Wooden deckchair with insufficient mattress.  Heated indoor pool with jacuzzi that triggers with motion detector. Very little sunbed in it.  Very spacious room with good bedding but soundproofing is non-existent.      Separate toilet.  Bathroom with a bathtub which is very high making it difficult to access. Quid for the elderly who are in majority.  Television with French channels via satellite but which picks up regularly. Bathrobe available in the room. Safe and refrigerator stocked daily. Necessary to make coffee or tea. Cleaning done every day.  Main restaurant room on a human scale. 2 services scheduled for the evening at 6:30 p.m. and 8:30 p.m. Table numbered and allocated for the entire stay for evening meals only. Rigorous pants. Lunch from noon to 1 p.m. Nice waiters. Very good food but not much variety. Fresh juice at breakfast which is increasingly rare. Fresh bread every day. Outside restaurant next to the pool opens at 12:30.   At that time not open at night and beach bar always closed. Pancakes in the afternoon. Beautiful beach cleaned every day. Sufficient number of sunbeds.  Presence of dogs that are not aggressive but bark regularly. Basic day and evening entertainment without atmosphere. Virtually non-existent animators.   SPA and TUNISIAN restaurant not tested but very frequented.  In summary, this hotel is very quiet but with some charm. Suitable for older people who want to rest. Not suitable for families with teens as this is not a club hotel.

reviews.review_title: One week stay at Safira Palms Zarzis
reviews.review_text: Stayed one week at the end of May 2025. Nice and very clean outdoor pool. Cold indoor swimming pool. Spacious and clean room. Very hard mattress. Lots of pigeons around the rooms. Safe paying 1€/day. Tourist tax very expensive 28€ / person for a week. All the staff at the hotel are very helpful and kind. Beach at the foot of the hotel, not very large. Lots of seaweed. Hotel located about 50 minutes from the airport. Zarzis small town where there is not much and where we are docked all the time to buy. Food at the hotel of medium quality and not very diversified, my friend caught the tourista after 2 days. Nice but medium animations. Change of euro in dinars possible at the hotel reception. Beach/swimming pool towels available for 10€ deposit per towel.  We won’t come back to that.
