Very nice staff Beautiful Inn very nice animations and I highly recommend Zephir Inn ♥️the beautiful beach the subways swimmers super the clean pool and beautiful food ♥️♥️ this is the first time I am here but I love everything ♥️♥️

reviews.review_title: Pension very family atmosphere by Pension manager restaurant very small lack of space damage
reviews.review_text: Pension Restaurant very small lack of space very low ceiling of the restaurant put the atmosphere very positive the chef of the restaurant and responsible for the Pension servers very professional and very pleasant listening it is always called faouzi a polite and kind word I go to Tunisia since 2008 I am never seen a restaurant chef of the other Pension so professional and respectful of customers and it is waiters impeccable service at the table thanks to the organization and supervision of faouzi chef of the Pension zephir restaurant spa zarzis again thank you I was not very well at dining at the Pension at the beginning and thanks to the good positive atmosphere and thanks to faouzi chef of the Pension restaurant I felt very well and I even extended my stay at this Pension  Room small damage

Top staff and very responsive very kind. Great pool and talaso. The beach and well warm water The flat the kitchen hyper repetitive day by day. And minimal fruit qualities more than ripe or not ripe. And we're not talking about fries... but the mash is good

I was there for 5 days. It wasn’t bad but I feel 3* is maximum I could give to this hotel. I feel like everything needs some renovation or at least deep cleaning. The staff was not really attentive, I felt quite…anonymous, if you know what I mean.  I had an impression French people were having the most attention and care from staff. During my 5 days stay there was at least one time when I went to a dinner and I could not find a place to sit, I was walking around with my plates and no one cared about this, even if the waiters saw me looking for a table.  Food was okay for me, most of it was quite tasty, I was not hungry. But margarine instead of butter... I’d expect more.  The real highlight of my day was melon served during lunch time - it was the best melon I’ve ate ever.  Room was okay, furniture could be newer, everything could be cleaner. But it wasn’t the worst.  The beach was nice but I feel like it was dirty, I’m not sure what was that but I think there was w lot of camel poop in the sand. Sunbeds should be changed for sure.  AC was working but it was not the strongest.  All in all, I’d like to come back to Tunisia but for sure I’d look for a better hotel.

Sadly I have very few good things to say about this hotel. A faulty door lock required us to ask for the management to open the door six times. It took the bellboy a little time to fiddle with the lock to enter each time.  He was pleasant despite accompanying us several times to unlock it.  Breakfast was ordinary to say the least- like a low budget hotel. I pitied the people with all inclusive meals.  I had one beer - it was flat! Paid wifi??  40 euro for a week - Seriously that deal died years ago.   The pool and the location were nice - the saving grace

Inn announced 4 stars but it is not so!! -the food is poor and not varied - the rooms are catastrophic whether it is mattresses or hygiene it is 0 not to mention the smell - no air conditioning  -the reception, no professionalism, they are not smiling or accommodating and arrogant!   Don't trust the reviews and rating, I'm not difficult but there... there's level.  And tripadvisor I don’t trust you anymore either it’s worth far from 4 stars. Rely on Google reviews.

reviews.review_title: Beautiful relaxing holiday and nice friendly stay
reviews.review_text: Very nice staff especially AZIS. The atmosphere very nice, very nice place with a superb pool. Very hot sea with different Water Things to do.  Too bad even food and drinks not always cold.  Dessert has to go as soon as we get to the restaurant or there's less choice.

Zarzis beautiful destination, a superb Pension with a beautiful pool, perfect restaurant and very friendly staff and especially an entertainment team at the TOP very lively day and evening. The beach next to the Pension which is appreciable

For my part, I don't understand the disastrous reviews with a Rating of 1/5 "to run away" that scared me before Check-out... We had a great family holiday and it would be quite possible that we would return to this Inn in the future!  First, you must remain objective you are in Tunisia not in France! A 4-star there is not a 4-star with us. Then you are on an all inclusive buffet at a reasonable Award so you necessarily have quite simple dishes.  However starting from these two points we enjoyed our meals, the buffet offers a lot of choices and almost homemade. The only downside comes not from the buffet or the staff but from tourists who take incredible amounts to make a lot of mess and who often cut the queue in front of those who wait.. Review for us: Inn clean, appreciable meal with superb surroundings, sea and pool view room, very spacious pool, friendly staff, lots of friendly meetings on and off site. I recommend the small shop of Mohamed and Sami both extremely honest and always available for a nice discussion purchase or not.  Leaving the Inn take the sidewalk in front and on the right "the Mediterranean" on google = Center of natural Tunisian Spices and "Tunisian Crafts". Of course, our review is up to us, it is obvious that everyone's feelings are not the same in our experience and expectations, as can be seen clearly from previous reviews. Nevertheless I take the time to write this review because for us this Inn certainly does not deserve the mention "to flee" and we hope it will reassure other people who may have been afraid to read some reviews like this may have been our case.

I think some 5-star reviews and rave reviews are fake and her people have never set foot in it. The only positive is the swimming pool and well maintained outdoors. Otherwise everything sucks, from very cold reception to Check-out without consideration. I will stop there in the comment, everything is said. I would not recommend it at all.

name: Royal Nozha Hotel
description: If you’re looking for a charming hotel in Hammamet, look no further than Hotel Royal Nozha.Rooms at Hotel Royal Nozha offer a flat screen TV and air conditioning providing exceptional comfort and convenience, and guests can go online with free wifi.A 24 hour front desk, a concierge, and currency exchange are some of the conveniences offered at this hotel. A pool and free breakfast will also help to make your stay even more special. If you are driving to Hotel Royal Nozha, free parking is available.While staying in Hammamet, you can check out a popular diner like Blue Smile, which is serving up some great dishes.The staff at Hotel Royal Nozha looks forward to serving you during your upcoming visit.Read more
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_text: Wow! This word should capture your attention and the entire holiday impact upon us due to the STAFF. The staff are utterly incredible. Their warm, attentive, helpful, friendly, passionate and dedicated approach to their individual roles at the hotel is a compliment to everyone of them. All animation staff, waiters, cleaning team, bar staff and pool attendants. If your looking for the personal touch, wonderful and creative food with fabulous taste and creative displays, this hotel offers the lot. Accommodation, location to the beach, swimming pool which is like the blue Lagoon, DJ Simo :-) ......of my goodness, where to start and finish. For a true holiday experience, look no further than this hotel. You will not be disappointed at all. The animation team will turn strangers into friends, and that includes you becoming friends with the team. Book now, you will have regrets. Already about to rebook ourselves. Thank you

reviews.review_title: Great holiday and great experience amazing hotel ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
reviews.review_text: Absolutely amazing holiday ❤️ l will definitely back again. Animation team Simo doussa jiji mido nader and amine great, so friendly and funny 😁 Room service amazing. Bar staff great. People so friendly and happy.Love this place 😘😄😘🧡

The service is wonderful. Very good drinks and the service at the bar is very good and friendly. Animation  Mido Simo Doussa Nader Jiji and Amine the are amazing people. The restaurant and food is delicious. We love this place. We’ll came back here next year

The hotel is wonderful. The service is wonderful. Lots of attractions. The restaurant and food is excellent. The pool is clean with beautiful blue water. Very good drinks and the service at the bar is very good.  Beautiful beach with beautiful sand.

reviews.review_title: Amazing hotel, animation staff make your holiday!
reviews.review_text: Great hotel! We spent 11 nights here and can’t fault it, good food, clean rooms, wonderful staff, friendly atmosphere and the animation team are absolutely amazing and go above and beyond for guests, I’ve never been on a holiday and willingly chose to join in on entertainment but these guys make it so easy to get involved and make you feel welcome! Darts, french bowls, yoga, water polo, aqua aerobics, so many activities and the different shows they do in the evenings are brilliant too!   But a massive thank you to Simo, Amine, Doussa, Neder, Gigi and Midou for making our holiday so special! Can’t wait to come back with our baby!   Jamie & Nicole x

A small hotel catering to your every need. Room, food and overall accommodation cannot be faulted. Simo,  Amele and all the 'animation staff' did a wonderful job keeping the poolside guests amused and entertained all day and into the evening .  They went above and beyond. Thanks everyone.

reviews.review_title: Second visit to the Royal Nozha hotel.
reviews.review_text: Our second visit to this wonderful hotel in two years, we were still impressed by all of the staff from the gardener up to the Manager, many who remembered us from last year.  There has been one or two changes which in our mind has spoilt the bar area, it is now like a sports bar, fine if you want to watch football 24/7.  The rooms are a little bit tired but are cleaned with the towels being replaced as necessary. The beds are comfortable but oh dear the  pillows ..... very lumpy they need replacing. The shower, which is very powerful, is over the bath which in itself isn't a problem but would be better off with walk in showers.  The dining room is very good because you are allocated a table which you keep for all of your stay, saves having to search for one.   The food wasn't as good as last year, not as much variety for the main course, lots of chicken (over cooked and dry), the meats were not carved just pulled apart and put on your plate.   Fresh fruit not as plentiful as last year.  In our mind the best meal of the day was breakfast, plenty of variety and omelettes to die for, cooked to perfection.  Waiting staff are very good no complaints at all.  Pool area always kept clean and there always seemed to be sun beds available even after people had put their towels out early.  The beach area is fantastic, with life guards and security in attendance, the security guard will take your towels and find you a sun bed.  The beach bar is a nice touch where you are served by friendly staff, nothing too much trouble for anyone.  Having mentioned the food quality it wouldn't stop us from revisiting as this is a first class hotel.

This hotel is small but very friendly lots of fun with mido and his animation team. Simo the dj is very naughty but fun. Gigi does kids club she’s very good with the children. A few more are Douza and amean all are excellent. Bar staff are lovely in fact everyone is fab from management to cleaners to kitchen staff they will all do their best to make your holiday special. I’ve been here twice now and will be coming back again. There was 10 in our party and all had an amazing time thank you all at Royal nozha see you again soon xxx

Staff were excellent,  very attentive and couldn't do enough to make sure you had a enjoyable holiday.  Food.  There was always something for everyone,  but could be improved.  Entertainment team were excellent and around most of the day, if you wanted to join in activities. At night Entertainment was put on by the Entertainment team and guest acts

reviews.review_title: The best holiday ever! We will be back next year ❤️
reviews.review_text: This was the best holiday I have ever been on!   Me and my partner have just retuned after a 1 week stay at the royal nozha hotel in hammamet. We had the most amazing time.   All of the staff are super friendly and very helpful. We felt at home from the moment we arrived at the hotel to the second we left - we didn’t want to leave!   I’d like to give a special shout out to mido and his animation team for making our holiday experience so enjoyable, they ran activities throughout the day including: darts, bowls, table tennis and water sports  and had great shows and entertainment in the evening for all ages! They are the best team of people and made sure we always had something to do and were always checking in on us.   The food was very good, and the restaurant was a nice calm atmosphere, it was a buffet and had lots of choices for breakfast lunch and  dinner (I am a picky eater and there was always plenty options for me)   The a la carte meal which on coco beach (part of the hotel) was delicious - I have added a photo of the menu for this!   The rooms are clean and spacious too! We didn’t have any complaints - we went as a couple and had a gobble bed as well as 2 single beds in the room with a nice balcony.   Nothing is too much trouble for any of the staff!   There is a bowling alley down the stairs from the hotel - this does cost extra to use as it’s not affiliated with the hotel but it is very cheap! Ans a lot of fun - the animation tam held a bowling competition there on Tuesday and all the holiday makers had a blast!   Amazing hotel 1000/10 me and my partner have already booked to go back next year!

We had a great time at this hotel. Food and snacks good. Plenty of space by the pool and on the beach. Staff very frendly. The entertainment team were great, always helpful and organised lots of fun. Special thanks to Alaa, Mido, Nader and Amin. Highly recommended.

reviews.review_title: A Gem of a Hotel - So Good in so Many Ways
reviews.review_text: As with all hotels there a few niggles but these were overlooked because the 14 night stay here was simply fantastic. The hotel is clean, the staff are amazing, the rooms are comfortable and the quality of the food was far, far better than expected. My wife is coeliac and was well catered for but you can’t get gluten free bread in Tunisia so take some with you if possible. Sure, there were some nights I didn’t fancy most of the food on offer but I always found something good to eat. The pizzas are amazing. Our main waiter, Faycal (Faisal), was exceptional. The facilities are well run and amenable - Bars, pool etc…. The entertainment team are also great, not pushy and like a bit of light hearted fun. The staff in the main bar, brilliant and funny. They say you get what you pay for. With this hotel you get MORE than you pay for. So many guests have stayed here on multiple occasions and I can understand why. Ignore any negative reviews, as this hotel is brilliant. My wife and I travel regularly and this is one of the few hotels that we would seriously consider revisiting.

reviews.review_title: A little gem of a hotel
reviews.review_text: An absolutely fantastic hotel that look after you like family. This was our 4th trip to the Royal Nozha, we just love it here. Staff are amazing especially the animation team that go above and beyond to make you welcome and entertained without any much pressure. Food is generally typically all inclusive but the desserts are fantastic. They are really trying to upgrade the hotel this year and its just made it better there. My only thing is the night reception guy. Never gives you the correct exchange for your money and doesn’t issue a receipt. It wasnt a one off as he did it last year as well. The day reception guy is so helpful and genuinely lovely. There are too many staff that are fantastic to name individually. But the cleaner for room 3045 was amazing and all the little towel animals and flowers she left in our room made our stay extra special. Hopefully see you next year xx

Took my daughter for her 18th n we had such amazing holiday. The staff are so friendly n so helpful. On her birthday they set the table up and made her a cake. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. The pudding was so good. There is a beautiful beach with a great snack bar.

reviews.review_title: A really nice place to visit!
reviews.review_text: We've been here 3 times, and enjoyed it every time. The pool area gets really full, so we spent our time down at the beach, where there is a bar/cafe. Staff are very good, although I would count your change if you exchange money at reception! Food is excellent, with loads of choice and variety

The hotel is very clean and all the staff from the gardener to the manager are professional, polite and nothing is too much trouble. We were 3 friends visiting and we were disappointed with our room, so a quick visit to reception and the brilliant manager moved us to a pool view room at no extra charge. Brilliant service. You are allocated a table for the duration of your visit which is great and saves time searching for an empty table, your waiter will get to know what you like to drink and bring it over. I needed soya milk in the mornings and this was quickly arranged and then bought to me daily. Thank you. Security on the beach was great, it just stopped the sellers coming up to you, police patrol on quad bikes as well. The whole beach area from the bar, cocco beach are kept spotless. I recommend the pizzas, made to your request.. we didn’t really partake in the entertainment, choosing to sit in the bar talking. The only downside for us were the drinks. The cocktails were weak. Great if you drink wine, beer, gin and vodka, but it did not spoil the holiday.  We got a taxi to the market. 20 Dinar each way and worth a visit. Remember to barter as they like you to.  A tip. Change your Dinar BEFORE you go through security as we thought we could spend ours in duty free but had ours confiscated.  I would recommend this hotel and would visit again. Well done to all the staff

reviews.review_title: Great family holiday to Tunisia Royal Nohza
reviews.review_text: The hotel is clean the staff from the cleaners to the porters and the gardener are friendly and helpful. The bar staff and restaurant staff can't do enough to help you. The security on the beach keep you safe from the sellers on the beach bothering you.  The animation team Mido, Doussa, Simo, Naser, Gigi and Amine are friendly and welcoming. They work so hard to keep everyone entertained from first thing in the morning til last thing at night. The entertainment is great fun and suitable for everyone. These guys really do make your holiday. Nothing is too much trouble. They are funny and entertaining all through the holiday. We have been here 4 times and can't wait to come back next year.

Me and my family stayed here for a week as a little getaway. We had a great time! The animation team really made our stay 100x better especially Simo, Mido, and Nader.  Would love to come back and see them again! Entertainment is also really worth a watch too.

name: Robinson Djerba Bahiya
description: Looking for a place to stay in Midoun? Then look no further than Robinson Club Djerba Bahiya, a luxury resort that brings the best of Midoun to your doorstep. Guest rooms offer amenities such as air conditioning and a refrigerator, and guests can go online with free wifi offered by the resort. The property also features a pool and free breakfast, lunch and dinner to make your visit even more pleasant. Guests arriving by vehicle have access to free parking. When you're feeling hungry, you can check out Restaurant Lella Hadhria (0.9 mi) or Lamparo (0.9 mi), which are all within walking distance of Robinson Club Djerba Bahiya. Should time allow, Krokodilfarm Animalia and Phare de Taguermess (Lighthouse) are some popular attractions that are within walking distance. We’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay at Robinson Club Djerba Bahiya as you experience everything Midoun has to offer.Read more
property_amenities: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.review_text: I spent a wonderful time at Robinson Djerba Bahia - it was perfect all around. The complex is very nice and clear, located on a wide sandy beach - ideal also for families with children. Special praise goes to the entire team on site. They are all in a great mood and highly motivated. The positive energy is really contagious. I would particularly like to highlight the guest relations Pauli, Steffi and Veronika, who really live their job and try to read the wishes from the lips of all guests. The food is very good to sensational - always fresh and varied. There is something for every taste. Very good also the barbecue in the beach restaurant (for a fee) a very special atmosphere. My highlight of the sundowner at Café Maure. Cool live music with delicious cocktails and nice conversations. The evening shows are on a high level and you can feel with how much passion and commitment the participants represent them. Compliment! As a repeat offender, all I can say is: I will definitely be back!!!

reviews.review_title: Very friendly staff nice that everything is within walking distance so quickly to reach great shows Mega Food
reviews.review_text: The restaurant on the beach is mega directly on the sea feast and enjoy almost always freshly fried fish great fruit and much more completely sufficient and the table wine was good for us and free ambience just fantastic also the yoga at the sea in the morning The rooms very nice and clean good cleaning everything available only the hairdryer is weak

We had a great stay.  Perfect room and very nice.  Super nice meals.  Very friendly staff and speak French.  Too bad for the animation (German), a very small effort would be welcome. The DJs set a very good atmosphere.  The shows are very beautiful. Very nice holiday. Thank you.

reviews.review_title: A great holiday for the whole family
reviews.review_text: We were warmly welcomed on arrival. The rooms were neat and well cleaned. The staff was always friendly. The F&B team always took perfect care of a great buffet and you were welcomed to the buffet every night. The children had their fun and the sports offer was top

Positive things were: - beautiful and well-kept grounds - Staff very friendly - Beach restaurant for lunch - Beach bar with wonderful sea views - We noticed the live music very positively. We have never experienced so much live music in all the Robinson clubs we have visited. - cool day beds (free of charge) directly at the pool - good sports offer - Rooms are nicely decorated and clean. - Guest laundry - super Rob Store - available board games, table football, table tennis  Cons: - The main restaurant inside is quite uncomfortable and bare. - The food is rather average. - There is no comfortable seating in the club. All chairs are equipped with plastic cushions that stick to the butt and mostly high chairs. - The drinks, including wines, are all terrible. - The shows are fine, but we've seen much better at other Robinson clubs. Luhana was especially weak. - The Hawaiian evening meal had nothing to do with Hawaii. - The mattresses were quite hard. - The archery field is not usable in summer. There are hardly any shadows.

Located in a beautiful location right on the beach. It is clean, idyllic and the staff is mega friendly ! The animation is outstandingly great ! There are great food in a huge offer ! All in all a Recommendation !

reviews.review_title: Well-equipped Club with Excellent Restaurants and Things to Do
reviews.review_text: Very nice Pension, excellent catering with a large selection of well cooked and presented dishes. All sorts of sports and outing Things to do, there is something for everyone. The rooms are minimalist, no storage drawers, no decoration and tristounet furniture. On arrival the receptionist did not speak a word of French, she was German and the exchange was therefore made in English... I had booked a sea view room, but the one we were assigned overlooked the inside of the blocks. At the reception I was informed that they had not had the information from the tour operator... Another receptionist (who spoke to him French...) found us a room with sea view, but as the Pension was supposedly complete, we were on the ground floor, in a family room which was certainly larger, but whose sound insulation leaves to be desired. We could hear our neighbors when they were in their bathroom, as if they were in our own room!! Nevertheless the facilities whether beach or pool are up to the standard, I recommend the beach restaurant and the beach bar (special mention for Mabruk, efficient and friendly waiter). The only really negative point was the 99% German customer base, if we had known that we would not have chosen this Pension. We have been to Djerba several times and generally the clientele is cosmopolitan, but this club is not to be recommended to the French, some German clients do not seem to appreciate our presence and make no effort to speak, even in English. Even the manager, German, did not seek to discuss with me in English. Fortunately the Tunisian staff were happy to speak to us in French! The very few French or Belgian speakers we met felt the same way and told us that they would not come back either, despite the quality of the Pension. I submit this review so that tour operators selling stays at this Pension mention that it is a German club for German family customers.

reviews.review_title: I'm not going back to this Pension. Dinner hours are late.
reviews.review_text: The architecture of the main building is weird.l welcome is in German,like all Things to do besides.  The rooms are simple (no shower cap, no shower after bath, 1 single product for hair, body. No drawers available. Fee-paying fridge. The beach is clean, the entire Tunisian staff is very friendly and dedicated.  Wines (white, pink or red) are mediocre. The pools are beautiful.

Very bad experience: 4 cockroaches over 10 nights and no proposal for change of rooms from the reception Things to do and information are exclusively in German. This will be the first but especially the last time I frequent this hotel

It's probably the worst Robinson in the whole chain. The rooms are rather simple, uncomfortable, dark and full of ants. The food is always buffet, although almost everything is rather tasteless. At 7:20 p.m., everyone storms into the dining area and secures the tables. If you arrive at 7:30 p.m. on time, you won't find room. When we decided to book wine and dine places, we were presented with the wine list. Consistently Tunisian wines for 30-50€. All were created from the vinegar category. This situation is intolerable! Every evening the party music resounds from the bar into the rooms. Sleep is unthinkable until 1 a.m. The whole thing then culminates in the arrogance of the reception, who doesn't care.  What was outstanding: the Nautic School for sailing and childcare, where Ellen and Anne are to be mentioned. At Letizia's and others' house, my child wanted to be picked up. Employees generally only move against regular tips. Robinson really needs to think about whether they want to keep this club going. Apart from the Roby Club and the sailing school, the whole hotel needs a new coat of paint and a change of management. In no case is this club worth a Recommendation

Through out all in all it was a really nice vacation. I do hope that the resort will get a deep clean, restaurant and rooms well needed,  in there winter closing.   Staff in the kids club is very friendly. Restaurant staff not so... sadly.  Location is super, beach is nice.

I went to September 2. This time at Robinson Club Djerba Bahiya. Whether with friends or as a family with 2 children in July, this facility continues to be just perfect and by far the best hotel on Djerba. Cleanliness is the most important thing for us and we were never disappointed. Even the delicious and varied food has always pleased the children and us. There are always Things to do for young and old But you can also take it easy and just chill. In short, Robinson Club Djerba Bahiya has the ideal conditions for an unforgettable holiday. Thanks for everything and hopefully see you next year!

We stayed 12 days at the club it was the second time. We were very satisfied again. The club is super well maintained, the rooms functional and very clean. The system is kept in great shape. The beach is beautiful you can sit wonderfully in the beach bar and enjoy a drink overlooking the sea.  The food is top and varied.  The pool is huge and invites you to swim.  Great staff and great entertainment. We will definitely come back

reviews.review_title: Not a typical Robinson club but a great holiday!
reviews.review_text: We have been avid Robinson travelers for many years and were as a family with our 15-year-old son in August 2024 on a summer vacation in Djerba Bahiya.   We noticed that there was no usual "coming home" at this club. I.e. it took us longer at this club to arrive and arrive. Until the end, we missed the classic Robinson charm. Whether we will go to this club again, we do not know today.  But there were also many POSITIVES: But what we can say: As always, we met great people and enjoyed special moments.   What you really have to give the club is the varied sports offer with really TOP coaches.  A special thanks goes to:   Tennis coach "Emmy" -> Always in a good mood, top organized + attentive and courteous. If you want to make progress in tennis, you must book a coaching lesson with her. Or 2 or 3 :-). Emmy is a coach with a passion for this sport.  Water sports coach "Mirja": Daily changing program with a changing music playlist and a lot of good mood + motivation. It has been clearly noticed that Mirja gives qualified lessons and has a lot of experience in this area. And best of all: All exercises were also feasible and effective in the water. Highlight was aqua jogging in the sea. One of those Robinson moments :-)  Mindfulness trainer "Janin Stötzner": A special experience for the mindset, your own attitude... A coach with experience and a lot of sensitivity and an incredible charisma. Thank you for this experience that even our 15 year old son loved.  And what stands out very positively are the very striving and courteous staff in the service + the small, beautifully assorted Robinson shop with a great special offer. Worth a visit!

name: La Chambre bleue
description: La Chambre bleue is a Family Guests Rooms situated in the heart of the Medina of Tunis, in an authentic historical house. 2 rooms and an appartment are specially equipped for guests, arranged very comfortably and inviting you to enjoy your stay. The Suite "La Chambre blue" is a large room of Tunis'Italianizing 19th Century style, has its own living space, a sofa bed, an intimate queen bed alcove, and a shower room. Restaured in what used to be the stables of a traditional house, The Makhzen is the 2d room with crossed vaults and column of the XIVth century. It gives access to a small private open-air courtyard "The Makhzen loft" restored and adapted with the modern accomodations, includes well-equipped kitchen reserved for long stays. On the first floor the covered patio and the dining room are the common parts of the house. There is also a library with board games and touristic guides. Breakfast is served each morning in the dining roomRead more

reviews.review_text: We had a wonderful stay in this beautiful dar in the heart of the medina. Indeed, I cannot imagine that you will find better lodging in Tunis. I've stayed in many places in many countries, and this is among the very best.  Room: I believe there are four rooms altogether, one of which is an apartment. We made a point of reserving the blue room well in advance, and were glad we did. Gorgeously appointed and embarrassingly spacious, we felt like royalty. The bed was firm (which I prefer) and very comfortable. The shower is small but adequate, and the water pressure and temperature were excellent. There were plenty of electrical outlets. The room was well insulated from noise overall, although, it being spring, at times one could hear the sounds of cats wooing in the alley below.  Location: Perfect for exploring the medina, with several cafés and sandwich stalls nearby. Personally, I would strongly recommend staying in the medina, which is atmospheric and surprisingly peaceful. Though it was pretty easy to locate via GPS, we were glad we booked our taxi through the B & B, as the medina is a bit of a maze and most drivers won't take your directly to the door.  Staff: The owner, his wife and the staff were unfailingly cheerful and friendly. I texted the owner several times with questions, and his responses were prompt and helpful. My wife developed a medical problem, and he was kind enough to arrange to have a doctor/acupuncturist come to our room. Thank you, Marouane.  Food: Breakfasts were spectacular, with different options every day, most of them homemade. We were given access to bottled water as needed, and were able to buy glasses of wine.

Really beautiful, very, very large room. Comfortable bed in a sweet alcove and two sitting areas and a desk. 5 windows overlooking the alley. Very cool domed ceiling with groovy chandelier Lovely bathroom, ample linens, tons of blazing hot water and great water pressure. Some sewage smell on and off (pretty typical in these ancient homes) solved by keeping the bathroom door closed. The breakfast is unbelievably ample, delicious and varied. The husband and wife hosts and the two ladies who work with them are all completely lovely, attentive and helpful. Great location inside the car free medina. I cannot say enough good things about our stay and would give 10 stars if I could. Thank you!

Romantic and well-managed accommodation in the middle of the old town. We loved every minute of it. Access on foot only, but without worries. Personal and warm welcome by Marouan and his team. Bedroom with stone vault and column, beautiful shower and skylight. Complete change of scenery. Hearty and varied breakfast. I want to come back...
Magical room, always a pleasure to return. Quiet, excellent breakfasts, the right place to discover the Medina. Thank you Marouane for your availability and hospitality. Odile and Jackie

Marouane, Shiraz, and their staff were wonderful hosts! We enjoyed our time with them very much. Marouane took care of anything we needed, from dinner reservations to summoning drivers to walking us where we needed to go! He even helped us navigate with Bolt and was eager to please us throughout our 4 days with them. Our only problem was that they had no air conditioning and it was very hot. But they provided a fan that helped a lot. The room was also very dark, but we managed just the same! The location is great if you want to be inside the Medina.

Very beautiful place in Tunis in a dream setting, beautifully renovated Extraordinary breakfast, delicious homemade served with a smile Central place to discover Tunis and its souk and very enriching advice from the owner who takes the time to help you discover his city, thank you again..

We had a fantastic stay at Le Chambre Bleue. Our room was super clean and full of character. Well situated in the Medina, we had lots of restaurants and street food options within a few minutes walk. Each morning we were treated to a selection of local breakfast dishes which were super tasty. A big big thank you to Marouane, Shiraz and Apollinaire for there hospitality - they are fantastic hosts!

I recently spent 3 nights at La Chambre Bleue. A charming guesthouse in the heart of Tunis medina.  The owner Marouane arranged a taxi for me and the driver brought me to the door. You'd struggle to find it alone.  My room was one of those pictured with an arched ceiling. Very pleasant and atmospheric. Complete with it's own patio. Note that the bottle of water provided is from the tap and whilst it won't kill you, I wouldn't have drank it had I known in advance.  Communication in advance was excellent. Marouane speaks excellent English and was quick to respond. So I was surprised on arrival to be greeted by a woman who did not speak a word. Marouane does not live there. This was not a big problem but if you speak zero French then you might not be entirely comfortable. But then if you speak zero French then you're going to struggle to travel independently in Tunisia. M was almost always available on whatsapp and came and had breakfast with me on the first and last mornings.  The house is super charming. He's refurbished it and wants to have cultural events there. Breakfast was varied with traditional type items. I would perhaps have preferred eggs, cream cheese etc (which I got other places). The lady running the place was very nice, despite the language barrier we got by on a combination of my bad French and google translate.  It's worth noting that food options in the medina are a bit limited, and they close pretty early. I survived on the snacks I'd brought with me on the first night as everything was closed. It was only around 6pm. Even worse on Sundays. It's not the most tourist friendly medina (thinking of Marrakech, for example). Make sure and save the location of the guesthouse on google maps. When the shops close and the lights go out you might struggle to find your way home.  La Chambre Bleue is undoubtedly a top choice for your stay in Tunis medina.

We were fortunate that when we contacted Sondos that she had the Makhazen room (with the cross-vault soaring ceilings and a column) available.  The room has a private courtyard and is very spacious.  The bathroom is quirky (no door) but functional.  The walk-in shower is a small alcove but as there is no shower door or screen it does not feel cramped (nor did the bathroom get wet!).  Breakfast is served upstairs in the dining room.  There were significant changes every day but constant were an outstanding juice (prune, peach and banana), yoghurt, black bread toast, ricotta and a large array of jams and honey plus coffee/tea.  The girl service breakfast and making our room was so delightful!  Breakfast was served from 08:30 and we never had any appetite for lunch afterwards!  Sondos arranged an airport pick-up for us which was nice as La Chambre Bleu is located in the Medina.  However, the Medina is compact and we never had any issues finding our around.  Be aware that the shops close early 17:00-17:30: then the souks and the Medina are dark - phone flashlights are useful as rubbish goes into the centre of the ‘street’ for removal but is likely still there when you are walking back to your room at night.  We never heard any external noise when we were in the room which made for excellent rest.  Sondos provides us with a great map of the Medina with restaurants, cafes, and sights to visit which simplified getting around.  A fabulous base in a wonderful, underrated city/country.  Highly recommend.

An excellent location in the midst of the medina. Rooms were clean and full of character. Our host was enormously helpful in helping us plan to make the most of our two short days in Tunis, gave us a tutorial and annotated map which were indispensible for navigating the medina, and she made dinner reservations for us as well which was quite helpful. The breakfast was prepared from scratch and featured an array of homemade jams which were superb. We enjoyed meeting other travelers around the breakfast table and the house was quiet in the evening.d

We stayed here 3 nights. The place is a renovated old building with some interesting features. The lady running it is pleasant and helpful with information about the surrounding area. The breakfast is also quite interesting, with numerous jams and fruit juices. The room got quite hot, despite having a dehumidifier.

This hotel is in a great location right in the heart of the medina, perfect for exploring the historic center of the city. Additionally, the rooms are very comfortable and beautifully decorated. The host is friendly and has a lot of advice on what to do around the city and what to do nearby. The breakfast is excellent and features delicious Tunisian food. Highly recommended!

We spent a holiday with friends at this hotel. We definitely do not recommend this facility. Although we managed to find an attractive price offer, there are some things that you should not turn a blind eye to. Cleanliness in the room, in the canteen and toilets does not exist. The pool bar is located right next to the stinking public bathrooms, from which a terrible stench is extracted. I feel sorry for the bartenders who spend their days there. Despite leaving tips in the room, it was never cleaned anyway. Food is a failure, monotonous and tasteless, sometimes with a strange, disturbing taste. Whether we came to the opening of the canteen or later - it was always cold. In the cafeteria, mess, sticky tables, leftover food on the floor and tables, all in all everywhere. Sometimes at lunch there were still those from breakfast. Great chaos in the queues for meals, sometimes even fighting for priority. As for the beach at the hotel, it is wide and sandy, with a gentle descent to the sea but unfortunately littered and could easily be cut. The water in the sea was extremely clean but it could not be perfect here either, because on the shore there is a lot of rubbish, probably thrown by the sea. Lots of flip-flops, bottles, filters, foils, etc. Sunbeds on the beach free of charge, if you succeed you can also put a metarac on them, but you have to hunt them because there are fewer of them than sunbeds. The pool at the hotel is a little too small for such a large number of people who can be in the hotel at the same time. Animations mainly for children, we will not judge because we were a group of adults themselves. Plus for the reception staff - very helpful both during the problems with air conditioning and organizing a taxi to a nearby town.

2 weeks holiday. First week hotel overcrowded with local families with lots of children. The restaurant food was good and varied. The main problem was the dining room with the floor always greasy and slippery like an ice rink. Dirty, greasy tables and chairs. Buffets stormed with no politeness and no respect for queues by local tourists. You had to fight and scramble like in the Far West to reach the food, raided in absurd quantities by local families, who then abandoned it on the tables without being able to consume it because taken in quantities truly beyond imagination. The staff was constantly bringing in new pans of food, but a couple of local customers were enough to empty the whole pan. Small local children ran around the room without any parental control, touching and licking the food and tongs of the buffets. Some local children tasted the sweets and then put them back in the buffet. The European clientele was stunned and could not believe that they had ended up in such a hogwash. The staff, always kind, witnessed what was happening, made us realize that they agreed with us that the situation was crazy, but did not intervene in any way and just watched. After a complaint from us and other Italian customers, the management and the chef admitted that they were not able to cope with the situation, but they gave us their personal willingness to let us have the food personally, which was not necessary because in the second week, probably thanks to the start of school, local families drastically decreased and this made the situation much better and we finally managed to eat with peace of mind managing to access all the available foods. We have been visiting Tunisian hotels for over 30 years, we have always enjoyed it, but we have never been in a similar situation!!! The local customers sitting on the lobby chairs (often soaked in water by those who sat in their costumes still wet) with their bare feet resting on the tables we had never seen them anywhere. I would say that this is an unsuitable structure for European customers if that is always the case.

reviews.review_title: If you want Hilton service pay Hilton prices
reviews.review_text: This is going to be a long one  On arrival was greeted with a big smile and a warm welcome, then a £46 holiday tax, which we were not made aware. The hotel foyer was very spacious and comfortable seats all around, the bar area was at the back of the foyer, with doors out on to the veranda Drinks are limited local variety if you wanted anything else there was a small charge, and not self service and small glasses. The veranda had more comfortable seats and tables with large sun umbrellas over, The pool was large with sun-beds all around on the grass (ants were a pain) could always get a sun bed. The rooms were large, and clean ours had a balcony that looked out to the sea and road below, only moan about this is that the balcony had a board that run around the inside that obscured your view when sitting out, yes rooms are dated and need a bit of TLC, floor by bathroom lifted due to bathroom flooding, towels were a bit grey but they were changed daily and clean, we had a fridge but no kettle, Restaurant was clean and service from waiters amazing,  Adam for breakfast and wajdi for our evening meal both were fantastic and looked after us well,  We always found something to eat, not many English dishes but plenty of chicken,  salad, and chips, Breakfast was typical continental hams and cheeses, there was a lady making omelettes, pancakes, fried eggs or doughnut rings, my partner asked for boiled eggs and these were done daily no problem at all Shopping we found a mall with items already labelled and you could go into the shop with no hassle ( right out hotel, first right, left and a little way along also opposite) you could browse and were left alone, found smaller local shops aggressive and rude if you did not buy anything.  Would be return yes for what we paid it was a very relaxed break away

reviews.review_title: Not worthy of a 4 star with dirt and dilapidated rooms!
reviews.review_text: To escape if you like cleanliness!! Dilapidated rooms and cleaning not done, we arrived in a dirty room! We changed rooms three times. An embarrassment to a so-called 4-star hotel! Very strong bleach smell mixed with moisture, many return trips to the reception with slow elevators because the room card does not work after a while (forced to go back through the reception to re-magnetize it). The food was not up to our taste, but it remains subjective! Others liked it, it takes something for everyone. Non-subjective reviews: dilapidated rooms and shameful cleaning. The facilitators are very kind and do what they can, but we haven’t seen any daytime entertainment. Maybe in May it is quieter... We arrived on the wrong weekend because many locals were there and it was clearly a mess! It’s not the hotel’s fault, though. What is the fault of the hotel is the cleanliness, the problems of elevators, room cards, the handle of the door of our room that remained in the hand, the rust in the bathroom, the flooring horribly laid, the simply disgusting floor in our room! The hotel has not been sufficiently renovated for a 4 star! A slice of pizza as a taste for all inclusive is very light too... A review remains subjective, people less looking at cleanliness will tell you that it is a superb hotel and other people like us will really not be happy! It’s up to you to see but big downside on the cleanliness of the rooms and the renovation of the rooms that is far from finished! The hosts and Ahmed very nice, the hostess of the reception very nice at first, but in the end it got worse... We will not go back to this hotel!

reviews.review_text: What can you say about this hotel? First impressions are lovely. We got there had to wait two hours for our rooms. The rooms are very old and dirty. Me and my friends stayed here for two weeks. We had one lot of clean towels and our beds was changed once  the whole time we were there my room never got cleaned but they cleaned the balcony which I could never understand. it had one bar open and are limited drinks I asked for bottled water to take to my room on many occasions. I was told no. There was no snack bar in the day they put a tray of food by the bar. there’s no fridges hairdryers in the rooms. It is nothing like the pictures on the Internet all entertainment is done in the nightclub where people are smoking and children do their mini disco. It’s absolutely disgusting. It’s not disabled friendly and if you find steps hard to go up and down this place is full of them and if you complain about anything, you don’t get anywhere it says all inclusive but it’s not because you’ve got to pay extra mattresses for the sunbeds are five dinar a day that’s by the pool and on the beach the bar by reception, you have to pay for drinks if you want to have a drink there. Most of the staff are nice some of them are really rude they asked you for cigarettes. Even the guards on the gates asked you to get them cigarettes when you go out of the gates to go to the shop. We were sat by the pool there was work going on they were painting doing things round the pool. It wasn’t a relaxing holiday. The entertainment team are really good. The only thing is there’s a few of them that spend all their time pestering young girls which isn’t very nice to see. I would not recommend this hotel. It’s the worst hotel I’ve been to in Tunisia.

There was 8 in our party one being a 2 year child !! When we arrived they couldn’t find our booking !! So they told us to go get something to eat !! We are all tired & stressed by this time !! When we came back they had sorted out rooms for us 🤣 well if that’s what you can call them !! They were dark and dingy smelled of smoke and damp we were all split up all over the complex!! No wifi in any rooms only the club !! Which was an inconvenience as we couldn’t contact anyone!! We complained about the rooms and miraculous they found us 4 rooms all together!! They we expecting a 2 year old to sleep on a bunkbed with a hard tiled floor no offer of a cot !! No fridges in rooms to keep drinks cold !! And the rooms & tvs very dated and didn’t work properly nothing like the brouchures  advertising the hotel !! The food was diabolical it was meant to be multiple choice it was repetitive and vile !! We asked for water on more then on occasion and got refused until we complained!! Especially as you have to use the water to clean your teeth etc !! We got told we were drinking to much !! The whole complex was a disaster from start to finish !! The entertainment of an evening was in a carpeted room and you could smoke in there it was disgusting 🤢 all inclusive means you offer food throughout the day this was not the case !! There was a limited bar too !! Beer wine of vodka nothing else unless you complained!! Definitely a waste of money we will not be going back!!!

The worst holiday we have had!  To start when we arrived it took over an hour to check in to then be told they need to find the rooms we booked. We were then told to go eat while they did this.   We go to our rooms where we were far away from each other. When going into the room it smelt of damp, they were filthy. It hadn’t been cleaned it looked like someone had used the bath, the pictures when booking look nothing like what we was given, in one of our friends rooms there was mould in a bedside table. We then got given rooms as near each other after complaining. In the new rooms one of the showers was broke and was still filthy.   The food choice is very limited and repetitive. Barely edible and always cold.   We paid for all inclusive and was refused water on more than one occasion after complaining and telling them I will be posting this all online they have basically tried to bribe us they made us a table with a birthday cake and on another night they made us a table with a bottle of vodka and nibbles as one of our party posted a poor review.   Half of the amenities were closed, the ‘club’ where they did the entertainment was filthy and just smelt of smoke. There was live light wires just hanging out the wall. We asked for our rep to come to the hotel and he didn’t even bother showing up.   On one of the evenings a 2 year old shut himself in a room and they didn’t want to know, it took them over 30 mins to even open the door.   In one of the rooms there were bugs in the beds and all over the floor.  There is no wifi in the rooms, only in the reception.  They ran out of glasses and were giving drinks out in small paper coffee cups. There’s live wires sticking out the ground and walls. They have slides here and told us they are under construction but another worker told us they don’t even have a license for them.  Management really needs to look into the poor reviews as it is diabolical here.  It really is not worth the money to come here.  I’m awaiting a response on getting a refund.

First thing we see in the room was the toilet leaking always making noise, the tv didn’t work and the balcony door didn’t close all the way.  So they moved us to a different room and this room was not much better. The rooms in the photos on the website are completely different to the rooms we have seen. They say it’s all inclusive but you have to pay for icecream and sunbeds. And if you want to play football in the courts you have to pay.  The bar there was so poor that you had to walk all the way down to the main bar just to get a drink, because they don’t want to open the bar up at the pool yet. And the drinks you have come in a little plastic cup like I’m a kid.  The food here was not the best, most nights we had to eat out, just so we could eat. We fully understand traditional food, but there’s kids and people with various allergies etc, typical simplistic food would have safised.  When the cleaner come in to clean the room they moved all of are clothes around. Like don’t touch my stuff.  Overall, not satisfied and won’t be returning the pictures used on various holiday websites of the hotel/rooms etc  are very deceiving.  Slides aren’t open due to not having a license for it which isn’t stated prior to coming, why show them if you cannot use them?

reviews.review_title: great all-inclusive stay with friendly staff and fun activities
reviews.review_text: we had an amazing stay, all the people of the staff were very friendly and helpful. they were very welcoming, which is always nice. the check-in went smoothly. the room was clean and had everything we needed. the area by the pool and the beach was nice and relaxing. there were also a lot of activities to do during the day and evening thanks to the entertainment team.  Overall, it was a very enjoyable and stress-free holiday. would definitely recommend and go again!

This was our second visit to Club Selima, when we visited last year we had a great experience and returned again this year.  This year the food although traditional Tunisian as always was by far better than last year which is great. The hotel rooms are basic but perfectly suitable, the water is hot and the rooms cleaned everyday.  The whole hotel is constantly being cleaned and maintenance staff always doing stuff within the grounds. The activities available tennis courts, basketball, beach volleyball etc. The animation team are pleasant and very engaging ask people to get involved with activities of which they try and do things all day.  The evening entertainment was the same as last year everyday something different but after 7 days they repeat again and it hasn’t changed a lot since last year which was a little disappointing but won’t stop us visiting again. The staff of the hotel are second to none always looking to please, the bar staff are great and we have made a few holiday friends for life in a lot of the staff.  We will definitely be returning next year. It may be a 3 star hotel but has 5 star elements

I highly recommend this hotel , from the moment we arrived everyone was so nice and smiley ,polite and friendly any concerns or question we had would always be addressed , the rooms were okay 4 beds in the room lovely balcony , shower and was even provided complimentary shower gels & soaps too , the cleaners were lovely always checking all was okay if anything else needed doing , the animation team was amazing and friendly always getting everyone involved, the animation manager was lovely always translating if any problems for us ,the bar staff were always polite and helpful , receptionist lady were wonderful , restaurant staff were so lovely and any concern with food or anything they would always help , overall all the staff are amazing , for my first time in Tunisia , me & my daughter & my mum had an amazing time , my daughter loved mini club & the mini disco , we will be returning soon overall I loved my time and experience there , they have shops on site , restaurant and pizzeria , beach is a 2 minute walk out the back of the hotel , 2 big pools & a baby pool , lifeguards by pool always and security 24/7 in the hotel I haven’t felt so safe in my life will definitely be returning with the rest of my family soon !!! Another thing my daughter kept going on about Mickey Mouse coming so two of the animation team  dressed up for her (Mario & Mexi) , a big shout to the  Aynar  who does mini club made my daughter feel safe and very entertained and to the rest of animation team everyone was amazing and made my experience amazing ! Can’t wait to return again soon

CLUB SELIMA in August 2024, we all liked the service, the food is good, the staff very welcoming, clean room, secure private parking, private beach. Animation TOP.  Big thank you to the whole team, I booked again for the month of June 2025 inchallah.

Goood hotel and good food and serves We stayed as a family of 3 adults. From when we arrived at the hotel we were hungry and they told us to go into the restaurant to eat before we checked in. Check in was quick and we were helped with our luggage into our room. The room was outdated which for us it didn't matter as rooms were cleaned each day and hot water we weren't in the room for much of the day so it didn't bother us. The resort is big and the pools are great! The beach is beautiful and sandy. The animation team are really nice and really involve you to take part in activities. There is a guy called Mr Banana man who sells excursions if your looking to do some activities outside the hotel.

We stayed as a family of 3 adults. From when we arrived at the hotel we were hungry and they told us to go into the restaurant to eat before we checked in. Check in was quick and we were helped with our luggage into our room. The room was outdated which for us it didn't matter as rooms were cleaned each day and hot water we weren't in the room for much of the day so it didn't bother us. The resort is big and the pools are great! The beach is beautiful and sandy. The animation team are really nice and really involve you to take part in activities. There is a guy called Mr Banana man who sells excursions if your looking to do some activities outside the hotel. There are shops that are a 5 minute walk from the hotel if needing essentials etc. We got a tunisian sim card which was 42 dinar for 25gb of data so you don't need to use your UK sim as can be costly. The bar staff will bring your drinks to you whilst your at the pool which I thought was great! The staff are very helpful and polite including the waiters etc. Food here for us was excellent and reached above my expectations for a 3 star. If your looking for chips, chicken nuggets then don't book here as everything is traditional food. They have a pasta station and a pizza station if you can't find anything to eat. Desserts are lovely and for us we enjoyed the food. I can't fault this place and I'm sad to leave. Alot of the guests we met have booked 9-10 days here. There are jet skis and paragliding on the beach if you want to do some water sports. We went out for dinner a couple of times to the hard rock cafe which is a bit like TGIS and have entertainment there also. Its a 10 minute walk from the hotel. No issues or problems whilst we have been here and I would definitely recommend if your looking for a cheap getaway. Please do not book if your looking for 5 star with a 3 star budget! Good value for money!

Very pleasant stay  I spent a family stay at EL MOURADI CLUB SELIMA in August 2024, we all liked the service, the food is good, the staff very welcoming, clean room, secure private parking, private beach. Animation TOP.  Big thank you to the whole team, I booked again for the month of June 2025 inchallah.   I hope you keep the same level of service.  See you soon

Not anything like advertised pictures, the place is filthy. No clean towels in the room. That’s after a 5 hr wait to get in it. Rooms dirty and broken furniture .Food and beverages recycled from other guests leftovers and  served again. All inclusive ???? Vodka, whiskey or beer that’s it and again recycled soft drinks poured into Fanta or coke bottles. If you are just looking at reviews before you book then go elsewhere and if you have booked phone your agent now and change. There is no pool bar as advertised and snacks are non existent.  Pool area filthy and broken.  I have been to Tunisia a few times and the place and people are lovely, please don’t let this be your first experience. I see all replies to negative reviews has been copy and paste so I fully expect that also.  Please don’t waste your money or risk your health, book a different hotel. This place in all honesty should be shut down

Please don't go to this place.. rooms are disgusting, we were shown 5 rooms before got one clean enough. To stay in. We went with love holidays and tried to contact rep, trying to get him was impossible.. so we had to stay. WiFi only available in reception so this added to issues getting rep. Never seen him the whole holiday. Food was mostly inedible.. and mostly not warm. The cleanliness of the dinning room was not great, out of date hygiene certificate on display. Staff , it was a 50/50 split between nice and grumpy. I know id deffo be grumpy working there. Even shop keepers in near by shops said it was the worst place, that they only open for season and close again, they don't put money back into the hotel or area. Has totally put me off the country and dont think I will return. Which if every body done this would not be good for tourism in Tunisia. Only good bit was the beach, it was beautiful

name: Byzance Hotel
description: Welcome to Byzance Hotel, your Nabeul “home away from home.” Byzance Hotel aims to make your visit as relaxing and enjoyable as possible, which is why so many guests continue to come back year after year.Rooms at Byzance Hotel provide air conditioning, and guests can stay connected with free wifi.In addition, while staying at Byzance Hotel guests have access to a 24 hour front desk, a concierge, and express check-in and check-out. You can also enjoy a pool and an on-site restaurant. Need a place to park? Free parking is available at Byzance Hotel.Travelers looking for delis can head to Twins.Should time allow, Musee Archeologique de Nabeul is a popular attraction that is within walking distance.Byzance Hotel puts the best of Nabeul at your fingertips, making your stay both relaxing and enjoyable.Read more

reviews.review_text: Pension afue! The reception staff is arrogant.the security guards are noisy at late or very early hours.The rooms are not soundproof.old and uncomfortable bedding not to mention bedbugs.the catering is null, very limited in choice and repetitive not to mention the poor quality of food. No wifi and air conditioning in the rooms.to go to the beach you have to cross houses and a puddle of sewers to get to rocks that I will not call a beach at all. This Inn does not deserve a star!!

Very friendly hotel if it was maintained what a pity...because lovely staff throughout the Inn little wink at Sam (restaurant) and Nabil ( secu ) great people ... The rooms are in very bad condition and the cleaning is very very minimal dirty and stained bath sheets broken and rusty just like the taps, completely different from the lobby of the Inn where everything is very nice. The Pension is perfect. The food is good but always the same especially when you stay 15 days. The private beach is really not possible the same on the whole coast around the Pension you have to go further on Nabeul. Big black spot when you are with children, really a shame especially when you see that some employees throw their cigarettes on the sidewalks when they should respect the place for their customers. Really hard to have clean places around. Suitable for the Award.

The pictures from the offer do not correspond to reality. The pool is small, the beach is not like the pictures, there is no beach bar either. The beach is as dirty as a garbage dump. The offer states that there is a Fitness Club and animations, but none of these things are available. The rooms are very dirty, the cleaners do not clean as they should. The air conditioning is moldy, they only speak English in the hotel, the Internet does not work. The view from the window is of garbage cans.

reviews.review_title: Excellent stay and very good address
reviews.review_text: Despite the 3 stars of the establishment the staff is very welcoming, the receptionist houcem is attentive and very responsive, the waiter and lifeguard team are of great professionalism, the meals are plentiful, and the chef very attentive, the location is well located and a big thank you to all the staff.

I stayed 3 weeks at the hotel, warm welcome and great care. Nabil and the rest of the staff were friendly and attentive to customers. Very clean room, hearty and very good meal, very kind manager and employees.

Noise  Hotel too noisy, especially the dog who barks all night and the housekeeper on the 3rd floor who is unpleasant and rude who makes too much noise by shouting loudly in the corridor. The cleaning ladies violently slam the doors.  Restaurant  Late opening of dinner 8 p.m. always 15 minutes late The meats are not cooked: they look like plastic. Very little choice and lack of taste  The dishes are cold even the soup is cold   Household   Can do better   Security  A very senior security officer is not very friendly with customers: his other colleagues are more friendly with customers  Beach filled with pebbles and rocks  A nice swimming pool  Hotel that has aged badly and some unpleasant people who ruined our vacation.  Reception  You have to call him several times for the same technical problem because he doesn't call the technical service, so you wait for nothing. Service that leaves something to be desired, especially in the afternoon and evening.

This human-scale hotel by the sea is undergoing renovation of the rooms. The staff is friendly, the medium sized swimming pool is very pleasant. Breakfast offers a wide choice and the dinner dishes are very good. Given the deterioration of hotels in Tunisia, the management of this one seems efficient and selects its customers. It is hoped that this will continue over time. A small downside however: The wifi is almost non-existent in the rooms and works irregularly in the common areas.

The hotel Great location Very pretty hotel with clean reception and corridors. Except in the bedrooms there are bathtubs without stoppers so with children it's complicated.  The bed sheets were all stained pretty hard to sleep in such circumstances... Very unfortunate because apart from the room it is a good hotel. The little extra is the bar where you can enjoy the evening by the pool.

Very good stay in this magnificent hotel. Hotel that would be nothing without the presence of its fabulous staff. Very difficult to write a review when everything is so perfect that you would have to invent words to describe the kindness, presence and professionalism of the team. Special mention for the delicious cuisine of the restaurant and its staff. I'll be back !

reviews.review_title: Honest review! It's not worth 3 stars
reviews.review_text: My opinion is without fuss or exaggeration. So the cleanliness leaves much to be desired (dirty floors and traces of stools in the toilets) after this is Tunisia, nevertheless our sheets were clean and the bed comfortable (note: double bed = 2 beds pushed together) The night guards were great, the poor ones don't have a lot of fun even though they are just employees, the problem is the managers who don't really care about customer reviews, the swimming pool is pleasant when there is no too many people, the breakfast is not great, the orange juice is sachets diluted in water, the milk is the same.. the rest is correct. In terms of parking, don't expect us to have space easily, the popular places are reserved for the boss's colleagues who come to drink in the evening ;).. No wifi in the rooms, that’s true! And French channels yes but only 4 or 5. A LOT of noise, people don't respect anything, speak loudly, slam doors violently and often and we were extremely lucky to have work done above our room! 👍🏻 It's a 3 shooting star hotel, I've spent better nights in ibises in France which don't have any stars..

Regarding the staff they are very nice and very helpful, regarding the hotel and its infrastructure, it looks like it dates from the 70s, vitus air conditioning does not work properly, no safe in the rooms or at the reception, Wi-Fi non-existent in the rooms but remains correct at the reception level, and no fridge in the rooms, this hotel deserves a general reflection

Disgusting and dirty. The cleaners sat in my balcony while I was down in the pool. My credentials were in the room and anything could have been taken. Not recommended! When you talk to the manager, he says that they would clean and then I said that it was my check-out in about an hour and it was not professional to sit in my balcony and look out at the pool.

Nice hotel with a nice view on the sea and on a beautiful sunset. Great service even with the current circumstances.  Thank you !   Très bon hôtel, belle vue sur la mer et sur le coucher de soleil. Très bon service. Merci !

This hotel is filthy and run down. The staff are very friendly and want to make you feel welcome, but they have nothing to work with. The pictures are not representative of what is there. The patio door was unlockable, clearly been forced. The bedding dirty. Some sheets had blood on them. Cracked tiles on the floor and in the bathroom and the tap ran brown water. The beach was desolate, dirty and the beach hut a now broken down uncared for shell, to get to it you would have to cross a stretch of land littered with rubbish and occupied by stray dogs. There is more, but this should be enough to stop you going.

Good services for a 3*, a little hotel and the personnel are making a real effort to satisfy their clients, guys don’t forget that you get what you pay for, when you pay a little amount of money in a 3* hotel don’t wait to have a vacation like you get in 5* hotels...  un bon rapport qualité prix.

Visited fore 1 night We was upgraded by Mohammed  in the reception to the suite on 3 floor. Very nice   BUT..it was not cleaned Aircon not working the persienne in the room not working..the waterpressure in Deutsch nearly not existing. Lock to room not working proper.1 sheet to all guest Bad smell, also in the hall and staircase of old smoke.and so on. Escalater not working old people climping 3 stores..in hot condition. The service at the pool was not polite OR educated...serving old whitewin tasting eddike... The reception was good.

lots of people are really critical but you get what you pay for yes the hotel needs a bit of tlc but the food is plentiful the staff work really hard and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. We had a brilliant holiday here in august 2018

reviews.review_title: Absolutely horrible! You do not get what you pay for. Terrible hotel.
reviews.review_text: This hotel is horrible, It matches nothing to the description. The spa for the hamam was closed during the full two weeks of staying there. As soon as we landed we had to wait 1and half hours to get our family room. We weren’t shown around the hotel no one assisted us with taking our luggage up. The lift had gotten stuck whilst inside it. We finally got used to getting around the hotel. The only good thing about the hotel was the cleanliness around, the cleaners were good at doing there jobs. Some of the staff were lovely. However some of the staff were very very rude...I mean I’ve been to better three star hotels. We requested a fridge and paid for it and received it a whole week after renting it out. We then received it and the plug wouldn’t fit due to the size of the fridge. The fridge was absolutely disgusting. The rooms are not child friendly there are many health and safety hazards. The electrics are hanging down from the phone there’s cracks in the floor tiles. The door has no lock on the terrace. I can not stress how much of a rubbish hotel this place is!!! If your going on holiday with children this is not the place to stay. Tunisia is a beautiful place and in fact it’s my 7th time staying in Tunisia but this hotel is absolutely disgusting. There’s no entertainment for the children. It’s just not a hotel you’d want to stay at. The food is terrible everything about it is just horrible.
